original: mi brtson pa dang mi sbyor ba dang ma brtags par spyod pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi brtson pa dang mi sbyor ba dang ma brtags par spyod pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: One should avoid not making effort, not applying oneself, and engaging in analysis.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽gcer bu pa la sbyin pa'i ltung byed de /
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no // gcer bu pa la sbyin pa'i ltung byed de /
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: bzhi bcu bzhi pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: bzhi bcu bzhi pa bshad zin to /
translated: The downfall of giving to the naked is the forty-fourth.🔽The origin of the downfall of watching an army is this.

original: // / dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: // / dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: ko sa la 'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis ri brags pa zhig log nas der ru pa gcig btang ba dang / bcom zhing rab tu bcom ste phyir 'ongs so //
analyzed: ko sa la 'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis ri brags pa zhig log nas der ru pa gcig btang ba dang / bcom zhing rab tu bcom ste phyir 'ongs so //
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala had defeated a hill tribe and sent in a single army unit to destroy it.

original: ru pa gnyis pa dang / gsum pa btang ba dang / de yang bcom zhing rab tu bcom ste phyir 'ongs te /
analyzed: ru pa gnyis pa dang / gsum pa btang ba dang / de yang bcom zhing rab tu bcom ste phyir 'ongs te /
translated: He sent in a second and a third army unit, and they too returned having been destroyed.

original: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis nga'i g-yul na mtshon gyis 'tsho ba gang dag 'khod pa de dag thams cad 'dong bar bya'o zhes dril bsgrags pa byed du bcug ste /
analyzed: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis nga'i g-yul na mtshon gyis 'tsho ba gang dag 'khod pa de dag thams cad 'dong bar bya'o zhes dril bsgrags pa byed du bcug ste /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala had a proclamation made: “All those who live by the sword in my army should go out.”

original: rgyal po dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa dang bcas te 'phags pa dang / drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal po dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa dang bcas te 'phags pa dang / drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The king, together with his four-division army, went out.🔽The group of six said, “ Nanda, Upananda, let’s go see what the four-division army of the great king is like.” They went out to the road and sat down.

original: dga' bo nye dga' gsum po che'i dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi ba ci 'dra ba bltas 'dong ngo zhes de dag lam kar dong ste 'khod pa dang / ci tsam na ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa dag 'ongs nas drug ste dag gis de dag la smras pa /🔽shes ldan dag gar 'dong /
analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' gsum po che'i dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi ba ci 'dra ba bltas 'dong ngo zhes de dag lam kar dong ste 'khod pa dang / ci tsam na ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa dag 'ongs nas drug ste dag gis de dag la smras pa / shes ldan dag gar 'dong /
translated: When they saw that King Prasenajit of Kosala’s four-division army had come, the group of six said to them, “Sirs, where are you going?”

original: 'phags pa dag ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis ri brags pa zhig log pa de 'bebs su mchi'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa dag ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis ri brags pa zhig log pa de 'bebs su mchi'o //
translated: “Nobles, King Prasenajit of Kosala is going to subdue a rebellious hill tribe.”

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six said,🔽“Sirs, we are going to subdue the hill tribe.”

original: bkren pa dag dpung gi tshogs 'di lta bu dag gis ri brags pa phebs par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: bkren pa dag dpung gi tshogs 'di lta bu dag gis ri brags pa phebs par 'gyur ram /
translated: “You poor people, will you be able to reach the mountain fastness with such an army?

original: khyed kyi glang po che 'di dag ni phag 'dra la /
analyzed: khyed kyi glang po che 'di dag ni phag 'dra la /
translated: Your elephants are like pigs,

original: ri brags pa'i glang po che dag ni ri bo brtsegs pa 'dra'o //
analyzed: ri brags pa'i glang po che dag ni ri bo brtsegs pa 'dra'o //
translated: while the elephants of the mountain fastness are like piled-up mountains.

original: khyod kyi rta 'di dag ni bon @181a * //🔽bu 'dra la /
analyzed: khyod kyi rta 'di dag ni bon @181a * // bu 'dra la /
translated: Your horses are like donkeys,

original: ri brags pa'i rta dag ni glang po che'i phru gu 'dra'o //
analyzed: ri brags pa'i rta dag ni glang po che'i phru gu 'dra'o //
translated: while the horses of the mountain fastness are like elephant cubs.

original: khyed kyi shing rta 'di dag ni shing rta zhig pa 'dra la /
analyzed: khyed kyi shing rta 'di dag ni shing rta zhig pa 'dra la /
translated: Your chariots are like broken chariots,

original: ri brags pa'i shing rta dag ni gzhal med khang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ri brags pa'i shing rta dag ni gzhal med khang 'dra'o //
translated: while the chariots of the mountain fastness are like palaces.

original: khyed kyi mi 'di dag ni rtsva mi 'dra la /
analyzed: khyed kyi mi 'di dag ni rtsva mi 'dra la /
translated: Your men are like grass,

original: ri brags pa'i mi dag ni gnod sbyin gdug pa dang 'dra bas khyed cag phar 'gro ba yod kyang phyir ldog pa med kyi /
analyzed: ri brags pa'i mi dag ni gnod sbyin gdug pa dang 'dra bas khyed cag phar 'gro ba yod kyang phyir ldog pa med kyi /
translated: while the men of the mountain fastness are like vicious yakṣas. You may go there, but you will not return.🔽Go back, give your parents sesame water, and then go there.”

original: phyir deng la pha ma dag la til gyi chu byin la gzod der shig / de dag mtha' gcig tu dong ste sems khong du chud cing 'khod do //
analyzed: phyir deng la pha ma dag la til gyi chu byin la gzod der shig / de dag mtha' gcig tu dong ste sems khong du chud cing 'khod do //
translated: They went to one side and sat there, their minds troubled.

original: ci tsam na ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal 'ongs nas des smras pa /
analyzed: ci tsam na ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal 'ongs nas des smras pa /
translated: At that time, King Prasenajit of Kosala came and asked,

original: khyed cag ci'i phyir mi 'dong bar mtha' gcig tu dong ste sems khong du chud cing 'khod /
analyzed: khyed cag ci'i phyir mi 'dong bar mtha' gcig tu dong ste sems khong du chud cing 'khod /
translated: “Why don’t you go? Why do you sit here with your minds full of worry?”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: lha bdag cag rgyal bar gal 'gyur 'di ltar dge sbyong mgo reg ras yug chen glegs pa 'tshal ba 'di dag mi mchi dgu mchi'o //🔽gang dag 'phags pa drug sde dag go //
analyzed: lha bdag cag rgyal bar gal 'gyur 'di ltar dge sbyong mgo reg ras yug chen glegs pa 'tshal ba 'di dag mi mchi dgu mchi'o // gang dag 'phags pa drug sde dag go //
translated: “Your Majesty, we are worried that the shaven-headed śramaṇas, who wear patched robes, will come and take away our victory.”🔽“Who are the noble ones?”🔽“They are the six heretical teachers.”

original: shes ldan dag de dag ni dge sbyong hral po dag yin pas /🔽de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: shes ldan dag de dag ni dge sbyong hral po dag yin pas / de dag gis smras pa /
translated: “They are shaven-headed śramaṇas.”🔽“What harm have they done to you? Go!”

original: khyed la ci gnod deng shig / ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis bsams pa /
analyzed: khyed la ci gnod deng shig / ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis bsams pa /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala thought,

original: 'di dag yang dang yang du bdag la tho 'tshams par 'gyur ro snyam du rig nas /
analyzed: 'di dag yang dang yang du bdag la tho 'tshams par 'gyur ro snyam du rig nas /
translated: “They are always harassing me.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar mi zhig las 'phrin gyis bsnyun gsol te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar mi zhig las 'phrin gyis bsnyun gsol te /
translated: He sent a messenger to the Blessed One to ask about his health.

original: btsun pa 'phags pa 'di dag dmag chas pa la ltar mchi na /
analyzed: btsun pa 'phags pa 'di dag dmag chas pa la ltar mchi na /
translated: “Your Reverence, these noble ones are going to see the army.

original: kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du gang gi 'phags pa dag dmag chas pa la ltar mchi bar mi 'gyur bar dran par bgyi ba cung zhig bca' ba mdzad na legs so zhes gsol to //
analyzed: kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du gang gi 'phags pa dag dmag chas pa la ltar mchi bar mi 'gyur bar dran par bgyi ba cung zhig bca' ba mdzad na legs so zhes gsol to //
translated: “Oh, Blessed One, it would be good if, out of compassion, you would make some rule about this so that the noble ones will not have to go to war.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, because of this incident, with this foundation and on this occasion, gathered the saṅgha of monks

original: drug sde dag la rmas nas /
analyzed: drug sde dag la rmas nas /
translated: and questioned the group of six:🔽“Monks, this is not the way of the ascetic,

original: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not the ascetic’s code of conduct,

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: it is not suitable,

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: it is not proper for one gone forth to do such a thing.”🔽In this way he censured them in many ways.🔽Seeing the ten benefits, he laid down a training rule for his disciples:

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Seeing the ten benefits of establishing the precepts, I declare to my disciples that the basis of training in the Vinaya should be recited in this way.

original: yang dge slong gang dmag chas pa la ltar 'gro na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang dmag chas pa la ltar 'gro na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: Again, the Blessed One laid down a rule: If a monk goes to see an army arrayed in battle formation, he commits an offense.

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni drug sde /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug sde /
translated: The persons were the group of six.

original: nyon mongs pa ni ma dul ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni ma dul ba /
translated: The affliction was undiscipline.

original: nyes pa ni dmag chas pa la ltar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dmag chas pa la ltar 'gro ba'o //
translated: The offense was going to see an army arrayed in battle formation.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes @181b bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes @181b bya ba ni /
translated: In this regard, a monk means

original: drug sde 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //🔽dmag ces bya ba ni dmag yan lag gcig pa yang yod /🔽yan lag gnyis pa yang yod /
analyzed: drug sde 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o // dmag ces bya ba ni dmag yan lag gcig pa yang yod / yan lag gnyis pa yang yod /
translated: the group of six or anyone else like them.

original: yan lag gsum pa yang yod /🔽yan lag bzhi pa yang yod do //
analyzed: yan lag gsum pa yang yod / yan lag bzhi pa yang yod do //
translated: An army is an army with one branch, an army with two branches, an army with three branches, or an army with four branches.

original: dmag yan lag gcig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmag yan lag gcig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is an army with one branch?

original: glang po che'i tshogs so //
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs so //
translated: It is an elephant division.

original: dmag yan lag gnyis pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmag yan lag gnyis pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is an army with two branches?

original: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs so //
translated: It is an elephant division and a cavalry division.

original: dmag yan lag gsum pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmag yan lag gsum pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is an army with three branches?

original: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs so //
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs so //
translated: It is an elephant division, a cavalry division, and a chariot division.

original: dmag yan lag bzhi pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmag yan lag bzhi pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the fourth branch of the military?

original: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs so //
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs so //
translated: The branch of the military consisting of elephants, the branch of the military consisting of horses, the branch of the military consisting of chariots, and the branch of the military consisting of infantry.

original: chas par zhes bya ba ni g-yul 'gyed pa la mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: chas par zhes bya ba ni g-yul 'gyed pa la mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: “To watch” means to watch a battle with delight.

original: ltar 'gro na zhes bya ba ni ltad mo ltar 'gro na'o //
analyzed: ltar 'gro na zhes bya ba ni ltad mo ltar 'gro na'o //
translated: “To go” means to go to watch.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no // de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “One commits an offense” is as explained above.

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of this training rule by the basic offense, the preparatory action, the subsequent action, the offense, the absence of an offense, the training precept, and the amendment of downfalls.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong rgyal po dang / btsun mo dang gzhon nu dang / zhad blon dang khrom gyi ru sna dang grong rdal gyi mi dang ljongs kyi mis bkug pa dang bar chad byung ba'i dbang nyid ma gtogs pas g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag la lta ba'i don nyid kyis 'phags pa'i nye 'khor gyi mtha' las 'das te mthong
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong rgyal po dang / btsun mo dang gzhon nu dang / zhad blon dang khrom gyi ru sna dang grong rdal gyi mi dang ljongs kyi mis bkug pa dang bar chad byung ba'i dbang nyid ma gtogs pas g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag la lta ba'i don nyid kyis 'phags pa'i nye 'khor gyi mtha' las 'das te mthong
translated: Here, the actual basis of the downfall is as follows: Except for a monk who is summoned by a king, queen, prince, minister, head merchant, head of a guild, city dweller, or country dweller, or who has an obstacle, if he goes beyond the boundary of the vicinity of the noble ones for the purpose of watching an army that is engaged in battle and delights in war,

original: na dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: then he commits the actual basis of the downfall of watching an army.

original: dge slong rgyal po dang btsun mo dang gzhon nu ma dang zhang blon dang / khrom gyi ru sna dang grong rdal gyi mi dang ljongs kyi mis dmag gi nang du rang dbang med par bkug pa nyid ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong rgyal po dang btsun mo dang gzhon nu ma dang zhang blon dang / khrom gyi ru sna dang grong rdal gyi mi dang ljongs kyi mis dmag gi nang du rang dbang med par bkug pa nyid ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: Except for a monk who is summoned to the army by a king, queen, prince, minister, head merchant, head of a guild, city dweller, or country dweller, there is no fault in watching an army.

original: tshul khrims dang / srog gi bar chad la sogs pa gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig nye bar gyur pa'i dbang gis der mi 'gror mi rung ba'i bar chad byung ba'i dbang nyid ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / srog gi bar chad la sogs pa gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig nye bar gyur pa'i dbang gis der mi 'gror mi rung ba'i bar chad byung ba'i dbang nyid ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does not go because of an obstacle, such as illness, or because of an obstacle such as a need to maintain ethical conduct or to protect one’s life.

original: g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag la lta ba'i don nyid kyis mthong ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag la lta ba'i don nyid kyis mthong ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one goes to see a battle out of curiosity, but there is an offense if one goes to see a battle out of a desire to watch it.

original: gnas gang nas 'phags pa'i nye 'khor gyi mtha' las 'das te mthong ba la na smad pa med do //🔽'dir yang nye 'khor ni sngar chos gos kyi mtshams kyi nye 'khor @182a * //
analyzed: gnas gang nas 'phags pa'i nye 'khor gyi mtha' las 'das te mthong ba la na smad pa med do // 'dir yang nye 'khor ni sngar chos gos kyi mtshams kyi nye 'khor @182a * //
translated: There is no offense if one sees a battle that occurs while one is traveling on a road.

original: bstan pa dag nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bstan pa dag nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the term “vicinity” should be understood as the same as the “vicinity of the boundary” that was explained above in the section on the robe.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag la lta ba'i don nyid kyis 'phags pa'i nye 'khor gyi mtha' las 'das te mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag la lta ba'i don nyid kyis 'phags pa'i nye 'khor gyi mtha' las 'das te mthong ba'o //
translated: The agent in this case is one who sees a battle that occurs while one is traveling beyond the vicinity of the boundary of the monastic community.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The root downfall occurs due to five factors:

original: dge slong rgyal po dang btsun mo dang gzhon nu dang zhang blon dang khrom kyi ru sna dang grong rdal gyi mi dang ljongs kyi mis bkug pa dang / bar chad byung ba'i dbang nyid ma gtogs pa dang / g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag nyid dang /
analyzed: dge slong rgyal po dang btsun mo dang gzhon nu dang zhang blon dang khrom kyi ru sna dang grong rdal gyi mi dang ljongs kyi mis bkug pa dang / bar chad byung ba'i dbang nyid ma gtogs pa dang / g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag nyid dang /
translated: A monk who is summoned by a king, a queen, a prince, a minister, a general, a town person, or a country person, except when there is an emergency, and a monk who is himself a soldier who delights in battle,

original: lta ba'i don nyid dang / 'phags pa'i nye 'khor gyi mtha' las 'das pa dang mthong ba'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i don nyid dang / 'phags pa'i nye 'khor gyi mtha' las 'das pa dang mthong ba'o //
translated: and a monk who has gone beyond the limit of the noble ones’ vicinity, and a monk who has seen the meaning of the view.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these conditions are incomplete, the downfall is a partial defeat, as appropriate.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ci srid du dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ci srid du dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: The downfall of preparation for watching an army is an offense of wrong conduct until the monk has begun the preparations for watching the army and has not yet reached the actual army.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each preparation that is begun, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: lta ba'i phyir 'gro na ji srid du mig gis ma mthong gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: lta ba'i phyir 'gro na ji srid du mig gis ma mthong gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk goes to watch the army, he commits an offense of wrong conduct for as long as he does not see the army with his eyes.

original: nye 'khor gyi mtha' las ma 'das par bzhin bsgyur ba tsam gyis mthong ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: nye 'khor gyi mtha' las ma 'das par bzhin bsgyur ba tsam gyis mthong ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If one sees a woman who is not beyond the range of one's neighbors, but merely changes her face, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The offense of wrong conduct in the preparatory action is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many as are the preparations, so many are the preparations of the preparatory action.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation is a minor offense, and the preparation of the preparation is also a minor offense, a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni dge slong rgyal po dang btsun mo dang gzhon nu dang zhang blon dang khrom gyi ru sna dang grong rdal gyi mi dang / ljongs kyi mis rang dbang med par bkug pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni dge slong rgyal po dang btsun mo dang gzhon nu dang zhang blon dang khrom gyi ru sna dang grong rdal gyi mi dang / ljongs kyi mis rang dbang med par bkug pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for a monk who is summoned by a king, queen, prince, minister, or head of a guild, or by the people of a town or country, who are not independent.

original: bar chad byung ba'i dbang nyid kyis song ste mthong ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: bar chad byung ba'i dbang nyid kyis song ste mthong ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one goes and sees because of the power of an obstacle.

original: g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag nyid ma yin pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag nyid ma yin pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is not a soldier who delights in battle.

original: lta ba'i don nyid ma yin pa la gyi na mthong ste mi lta ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: lta ba'i don nyid ma yin pa la gyi na mthong ste mi lta ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does not see the army because of being in a different place, or because of being blind, or because of being in a state of distraction, or because of not wanting to see the army due to a lack of interest in it.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginning practitioner, or if one is insane, or if one’s mind is disturbed, or if one is in pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule is that a monk should train in not attending the army in all its situations and in all its aspects.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa mi bya'o //
translated: He should not act in a way that is not in accordance with the Dharma.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu lnga pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu lnga pa bshad zin to /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the forty-fifth downfall.🔽The Compendium of Determinations, an extensive commentary on the monastic code

original: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /🔽bam po sum @182b cu gcig pa /
analyzed: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /🔽bam po sum @182b cu gcig pa /
translated: Vinaya Verses🔽Vinaya Verses🔽

original: dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //🔽ri brags pa de de lta na yang mi phebs nas rgyal pos de nyid du phru ma btab ste 'dug pa dang / blon po rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so // ri brags pa de de lta na yang mi phebs nas rgyal pos de nyid du phru ma btab ste 'dug pa dang / blon po rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The origin of the offense of being in the army: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: lha khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin ni bsod nams kyi rnam par smin pa can dbang che bar grags pa lags pas gal te mchis par gyur na de'i mthus ri brags pa 'di phebs par 'gyur ba gang lags pa de lta bu'i gnas mchis par 'gyur gda'o //
analyzed: lha khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin ni bsod nams kyi rnam par smin pa can dbang che bar grags pa lags pas gal te mchis par gyur na de'i mthus ri brags pa 'di phebs par 'gyur ba gang lags pa de lta bu'i gnas mchis par 'gyur gda'o //
translated: The king’s ministers said, “Your Majesty, the householder Anāthapiṇḍada is one who has the ripening of merit, is powerful, and is well known. If he comes, by his power this fortress will be taken.”

original: rgyal pos khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la khyim bdag mthong bar 'dod do zhes yi ge spring ba dang / khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin der 'ongs so //
analyzed: rgyal pos khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la khyim bdag mthong bar 'dod do zhes yi ge spring ba dang / khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin der 'ongs so //
translated: The king sent a letter to the householder Anāthapiṇḍada, “Householder, I want to see you.” The householder Anāthapiṇḍada went there.

original: de lta na yang ri brags pa de ma phebs nas /
analyzed: de lta na yang ri brags pa de ma phebs nas /
translated: But the mountain man did not come.

original: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la smras pa /
analyzed: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la smras pa /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala said to the householder Anāthapiṇḍada,

original: khyim bdag khye'u dag mi dran nam /
analyzed: khyim bdag khye'u dag mi dran nam /
translated: “Householder, do you not remember the boys?”

original: lha khye'u dag ni mi dran te 'di ltar 'phags pa dag mthong bar 'tshal lo //
analyzed: lha khye'u dag ni mi dran te 'di ltar 'phags pa dag mthong bar 'tshal lo //
translated: “Your Majesty, I do not remember the boys. I would like to see the noble ones.”

original: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis dge 'dun la 'phags pa dag mthong bar 'tshal lo zhes yi ge spring ba dang / dge skos kyis dge 'dun gyi dbus su yi ge klags te /
analyzed: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis dge 'dun la 'phags pa dag mthong bar 'tshal lo zhes yi ge spring ba dang / dge skos kyis dge 'dun gyi dbus su yi ge klags te /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala sent a letter to the Saṅgha, saying, “I would like to see the noble ones.” The monastery attendant read the letter in the middle of the Saṅgha,

original: gang der 'gro bar spro ba des tshul shing long shig ces tshul shing brims pa dang / dge slong gnas brtan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gang der 'gro bar spro ba des tshul shing long shig ces tshul shing brims pa dang / dge slong gnas brtan dag gis smras pa /
translated: saying, “Whoever is willing to go there should take a voting stick.” When the voting sticks were distributed, the elder monks said,

original: kho bo cag ni rgan po sbyor mi bzod pa ngag yin pas der 'gro bar mi nus so //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni rgan po sbyor mi bzod pa ngag yin pas der 'gro bar mi nus so //
translated: “We are old and cannot go there.”

original: dge slong gsar bu gsar bu dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong gsar bu gsar bu dag gis smras pa /
translated: The younger monks said,

original: der chos bstan par bya dgos na bdag cag ni thos pa nyung ba yin pas chos bstan par mi nus na /
analyzed: der chos bstan par bya dgos na bdag cag ni thos pa nyung ba yin pas chos bstan par mi nus na /
translated: “If we must teach the Dharma there, we are unable to teach the Dharma because we have little learning.

original: der chu brims par bya'am /
analyzed: der chu brims par bya'am /
translated: “Should we draw lots there?

original: ci bdag cag kyang der 'gro bar mi nus so //
analyzed: ci bdag cag kyang der 'gro bar mi nus so //
translated: “Or should we say that we are unable to go there?”

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six said,

original: dga' bo nye dga' ji srid du bcom ldan 'das bzhugs shing bdag cag gson pa de srid du bstan pa gnas la /
analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' ji srid du bcom ldan 'das bzhugs shing bdag cag gson pa de srid du bstan pa gnas la /
translated: “Nandaka, as long as the Blessed One lives and we live, the teaching will remain.

original: bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das shing bdag cag dus la bab na bstan pa nub par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das shing bdag cag dus la bab na bstan pa nub par brjod par bya ste /
translated: When the Blessed One has passed into parinirvāṇa and we have passed away, we can say that the teaching has disappeared.

original: ji srid du bdag cag gson pa de srid du bstan pa la gces pa bskyed par byas /
analyzed: ji srid du bdag cag gson pa de srid du bstan pa la gces pa bskyed par byas /
translated: As long as we live, we will cherish the teaching.

original: tshul shing blang ngo zhes de dag gis tshul shing blangs te der dong nas /
analyzed: tshul shing blang ngo zhes de dag gis tshul shing blangs te der dong nas /
translated: “Let us draw lots.” They drew lots and went there.

original: rgyal po la chos bstan pas rgyal po mngon par dad par byas so //
analyzed: rgyal po la chos bstan pas rgyal po mngon par dad par byas so //
translated: They taught the Dharma to the king, and the king developed faith.

original: btsun mo dang gzhon nu dag dang zhang blon dang khrom gyi ru sna dag la @183a * //
analyzed: btsun mo dang gzhon nu dag dang zhang blon dang khrom gyi ru sna dag la @183a * //
translated: They taught the Dharma to the queen, the princes, the king’s brothers-in-law, and the leaders of the merchants,

original: yang chos bstan pas skye bo phal po che'i tshogs mngon par dad par byas so //
analyzed: yang chos bstan pas skye bo phal po che'i tshogs mngon par dad par byas so //
translated: And by teaching the Dharma, he caused a great crowd of people to be filled with faith.

original: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis blon po rnams la smras pa /🔽ri brags pa bskor du 'dong ngo zhes de dag la 'phags pa dang drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis blon po rnams la smras pa / ri brags pa bskor du 'dong ngo zhes de dag la 'phags pa dang drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala said to his ministers,🔽“Let us go and lay siege to the hill fort.”

original: dga' bo nye dga' bdag cag gis yun ji srid du gzhan gyi spyod lam gyis gnas par bya /
analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' bdag cag gis yun ji srid du gzhan gyi spyod lam gyis gnas par bya /
translated: The group of six monks said, “Ānanda, Upagupta, for how long shall we live by the conduct of others?

original: rang gi spyod lam gyis gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi spyod lam gyis gnas par bya'o //
translated: We shall live by our own conduct.”🔽“Let us go and be like the army of the fat man.”

original: gsus po che'i dmag ci 'dra ba de 'drar 'dong ngo zhes de dag lam kar dong ste 'khod pa dang ci tsam na dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa 'ongs nas de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gsus po che'i dmag ci 'dra ba de 'drar 'dong ngo zhes de dag lam kar dong ste 'khod pa dang ci tsam na dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa 'ongs nas de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They went to the road and sat down. When the four divisions of the army arrived, they said,

original: 'phags pa dag shul phye shig shul phye shig ci bya /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag shul phye shig shul phye shig ci bya /
translated: “Noble ones, make way! Make way! What is it?”

original: dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa mchi'o //
analyzed: dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa mchi'o //
translated: “The four divisions of the army are coming.”

original: bkren pa dag 'di 'dra ba dag glang po che yin nam phag dang 'dra'o zhes de dag gis mche ba dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor ro //🔽'di 'dra ba dag rta yin nam bong bu dag 'dra'o zhes de dag gis de dag gi mjug ma dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor ro //
analyzed: bkren pa dag 'di 'dra ba dag glang po che yin nam phag dang 'dra'o zhes de dag gis mche ba dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor ro // 'di 'dra ba dag rta yin nam bong bu dag 'dra'o zhes de dag gis de dag gi mjug ma dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor ro //
translated: “Are these elephants or pigs?” They grabbed them by the tusks and threw them to one side.🔽“Are these horses or donkeys?” They grabbed them by the tails and threw them to one side.

original: 'di 'dra ba dag shing rta yin nam shing rta zhig pa dag 'dra'o zhes de dag gis de dag srog shing dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor ro //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba dag shing rta yin nam shing rta zhig pa dag 'dra'o zhes de dag gis de dag srog shing dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor ro //
translated: “Are these chariots or broken-down chariots?” They grabbed them by the axles and threw them to one side.🔽“Are these men or grass men?” They grabbed them by the necks and threw them to one side.

original: 'di 'dra ba zhig mi yin nam rtsva mi dag 'dra'o zhes de dag gis de dag gi gnya' ba dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor nas de dag sems khong du chud cing 'khod do //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba zhig mi yin nam rtsva mi dag 'dra'o zhes de dag gis de dag gi gnya' ba dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor nas de dag sems khong du chud cing 'khod do //
translated: They sat there with their minds reeling.

original: ci tsam na ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal 'ongs nas des smras pa /
analyzed: ci tsam na ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal 'ongs nas des smras pa /
translated: After a while King Prasenajit of Kosala arrived. He said,🔽“What is this?

original: shes ldan dag ci'i phyir khyed cag mi 'dong bar sems khong du chud cing 'khod /
analyzed: shes ldan dag ci'i phyir khyed cag mi 'dong bar sems khong du chud cing 'khod /
translated: “Sirs, why do you sit here with your minds full of worry?”

original: lha dag bdag cag rgyal bar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: lha dag bdag cag rgyal bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: “Your Majesties, how can we be victorious?

original: 'di ltar dge sbyong mgo reg ras yug chen glegs pa 'tshal ba 'di dag mi mchi dgu mchi'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge sbyong mgo reg ras yug chen glegs pa 'tshal ba 'di dag mi mchi dgu mchi'o //
translated: These shaven-headed śramaṇas, who wear patched robes, are everywhere.”

original: gang dag 'phags pa drug sde dag go //
analyzed: gang dag 'phags pa drug sde dag go //
translated: “Sirs, they are the noble group of six.”

original: shes ldan dag de dag ni dge sbyong hral po dag yin pas de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: shes ldan dag de dag ni dge sbyong hral po dag yin pas de dag gis smras pa /
translated: “Sirs, they are shaven-headed śramaṇas who are frauds.”🔽“Sirs, what harm have they done to you? Go!”

original: khyed la ci gnod deng shig / ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis bsams pa /
analyzed: khyed la ci gnod deng shig / ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis bsams pa /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala thought,

original: 'di dag yang dang yang du bdag la tho 'tshams par 'gyur ro snyam du rig nas /
analyzed: 'di dag yang dang yang du bdag la tho 'tshams par 'gyur ro snyam du rig nas /
translated: “They will continue to harass me again and again.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar mi zhig la 'phrin gyis bsnyun gsol te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar mi zhig la 'phrin gyis bsnyun gsol te /
translated: Knowing this, he sent a message to the Blessed One through a man:

original: btsun pa 'phags pa 'di dag dmag chas pa la ltar mchis nas shin tu yun ring por dmag gi nang na gnas na /
analyzed: btsun pa 'phags pa 'di dag dmag chas pa la ltar mchis nas shin tu yun ring por dmag gi nang na gnas na /
translated: “Venerable, these nobles have gone to see the army and will stay in the army for a very long time.

original: kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du gang gis 'phags pa dag dmag chas pa la ltar mchis nas shin tu yun ring por dmag gi nang na gnas par mi 'gyur bar @183b bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa rnams la dran par bgyi ba chung🔽zhig bca' ba mdzad na legs so zhes gsol to //
analyzed: kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du gang gis 'phags pa dag dmag chas pa la ltar mchis nas shin tu yun ring por dmag gi nang na gnas par mi 'gyur bar @183b bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa rnams la dran par bgyi ba chung zhig bca' ba mdzad na legs so zhes gsol to //
translated: “Oh, Blessed One, out of compassion, please make a small rule for the noble ones, so that when they go to see the army, they will not stay in the army for a very long time.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, with this incident and with this introduction, gathered the saṅgha of monks

original: drug sde dag la rmas nas /🔽dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag la rmas nas / dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
translated: and questioned the group of six:🔽“Monks, this is not the way of a śramaṇa,

original: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not the way of a spiritual practitioner,

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: it is not suitable,🔽it is not proper for one gone forth to do such a thing.”

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: He censured them in many ways, saying,

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /🔽yang dge slong gang dmag chas pa la ltar 'gro ba de lta bu'i rkyen zhig byung na /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste / yang dge slong gang dmag chas pa la ltar 'gro ba de lta bu'i rkyen zhig byung na /
translated: Having seen the ten benefits of establishing the training rules, I have laid down this basis for training for my disciples:

original: de dge slong des dmag de'i nang du zhag gnyis tshun chad gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de dge slong des dmag de'i nang du zhag gnyis tshun chad gnas par bya'o //
translated: “If there are extenuating circumstances, a monk may go to an army for two nights.

original: de las lhag par gnas na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de las lhag par gnas na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: If he stays longer than that, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The location is Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni drug sde /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug sde /
translated: The individuals are the group of six.

original: nyon mongs pa ni ma dul ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni ma dul ba /
translated: The affliction is not being subdued.

original: nyes ba ni shin tu yun ring por dmag gi nang na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nyes ba ni shin tu yun ring por dmag gi nang na gnas pa'o //
translated: The misdeed is staying in the army for a very long time.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: As for “If there are extenuating circumstances, a monk may go to an army for two nights,” the group of six and others like them are “monks.”

original: dmag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: dmag ces bya ba la /
translated: As for “army,”

original: dmag ni yan lag gcig pa yang yod la /
analyzed: dmag ni yan lag gcig pa yang yod la /
translated: there are armies with one branch,

original: yan lag gnyis pa yang yod /
analyzed: yan lag gnyis pa yang yod /
translated: with two branches,

original: yan lag gsum pa yang yod /
analyzed: yan lag gsum pa yang yod /
translated: with three branches,

original: yan lag bzhi pa yang yod do //
analyzed: yan lag bzhi pa yang yod do //
translated: There is also an army with four divisions.

original: dmag yan lag gcig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmag yan lag gcig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is an army with one division?

original: glang po che'i tshogs so //
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs so //
translated: It is an army consisting of elephants.

original: dmag yan lag gnyis pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmag yan lag gnyis pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is an army with two divisions?

original: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta'i tshogs so //
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta'i tshogs so //
translated: It is an army consisting of elephants and cavalry.

original: dmag yan lag gsum pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmag yan lag gsum pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is an army with three divisions?

original: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs so //
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs so //
translated: It is an army consisting of elephants, cavalry and chariots.

original: dmag yan lag bzhi ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmag yan lag bzhi ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is an army with four divisions?

original: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs so //
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs so //
translated: It is an army consisting of elephants, cavalry, chariots and infantry.

original: chas pa la zhes bya ba ni g-yul 'gyed par mngon par dga' ba la'o //🔽ltar 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gis so //
analyzed: chas pa la zhes bya ba ni g-yul 'gyed par mngon par dga' ba la'o //🔽ltar 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gis so //
translated: “In the process of marching out” means in the process of going out to battle.🔽“In the process of returning” means in the process of returning from battle.

original: de lta bu'i rkyen zhig byung na zhes bya ba ni rgyal po dang btsun mo dang gzhon nu dang zhang blon dang / khrom gyi ru sna dang / grong rdal gyi mi dang ljongs kyi mis bkug na'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rkyen zhig byung na zhes bya ba ni rgyal po dang btsun mo dang gzhon nu dang zhang blon dang / khrom gyi ru sna dang / grong rdal gyi mi dang ljongs kyi mis bkug na'o //
translated: “If such a situation arises” means if the king, the queen, the prince, the royal ministers, the head of the market, the town people, or the country people summon him.

original: dge slong des zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang yin pa des so //
analyzed: dge slong des zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang yin pa des so //
translated: “That monk” means the one who is a monk.

original: dmag de'i nang du zhes bya ba ni dmag chas pa de'i nang du'o //
analyzed: dmag de'i nang du zhes bya ba ni dmag chas pa de'i nang du'o //
translated: “In the middle of the army” means in the middle of the arrayed army.

original: zhag gnyis tshun chad gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni zhag gnyis kyi mtha' tshun chad gnas par bya'o //🔽de las lhag par gnas na zhes bya ba ni de @184a * //
analyzed: zhag gnyis tshun chad gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni zhag gnyis kyi mtha' tshun chad gnas par bya'o // de las lhag par gnas na zhes bya ba ni de @184a * //
translated: “He should stay for two nights” means he should stay for the duration of two nights.

original: las 'das par gnas na'o //
analyzed: las 'das par gnas na'o //
translated: “If he stays longer than that” means if he stays longer than that.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “He commits an offense entailing confession” means he commits an offense entailing confession as declared by the Venerable One.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “What is an offense entailing confession?”

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of this through the downfalls, the preparations, the preparations for the preparations, the non-downfalls, the trainings, and the amendings.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong rgyal po dang btsun mo dang / gzhon nu dang zhang blon dang / khrom gyi ru sna dang grong rdal gyi mi dang ljongs kyi mis bkug pa dang / bar chad kyi dbang nyid byung na g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag de'i nang du nyin mtshan gnyis las lhag par nyin mtshan gsum pa'i skya rengs dang po shar bar gnas sam /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong rgyal po dang btsun mo dang / gzhon nu dang zhang blon dang / khrom gyi ru sna dang grong rdal gyi mi dang ljongs kyi mis bkug pa dang / bar chad kyi dbang nyid byung na g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag de'i nang du nyin mtshan gnyis las lhag par nyin mtshan gsum pa'i skya rengs dang po shar bar gnas sam /
translated: Here, the presentation of the downfalls of the actual basis is this: If a fully ordained monk is summoned by a king, queen, prince, minister, army general, townsman, or country person, and if he stays for more than two days and nights in the midst of an army that is eager for battle due to the occurrence of a powerful obstacle, then at the break of dawn of the third day, he commits a downfall.

original: rgyal po la sogs pas bkug pa dang / bar chad kyi dbang de dag med par lta ba'i don nyid kyis g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag de'i nang du nyin mtshan gsum pa'i snga ma nyin mtshan gcig dang gnyis kyi mthar gnas na yang dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pas bkug pa dang / bar chad kyi dbang de dag med par lta ba'i don nyid kyis g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag de'i nang du nyin mtshan gsum pa'i snga ma nyin mtshan gcig dang gnyis kyi mthar gnas na yang dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur
translated: If a monk is summoned by a king or others, or if he is under the power of an obstacle, and he stays in the midst of an army that delights in battle for three days and nights, or for two days and nights at the end of the first day and night, he commits the actual basis of a downfall of staying in the midst of an army.

original: ro // dge slong rgyal po dang btsun mo dang gzhon nu dang zhang blon dang / khrom gyi ru sna dang grong rdal gyi mi dang ljongs kyi mis bkug pa dang bar chad kyi dbang nyid yod du zin yang g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag de'i nang du nyin mtshan gsum pa'i skya rengs dang po shar ba la na smad pa med do
analyzed: ro // dge slong rgyal po dang btsun mo dang gzhon nu dang zhang blon dang / khrom gyi ru sna dang grong rdal gyi mi dang ljongs kyi mis bkug pa dang bar chad kyi dbang nyid yod du zin yang g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag de'i nang du nyin mtshan gsum pa'i skya rengs dang po shar ba la na smad pa med do
translated: If a monk is summoned by a king, queen, prince, uncle, minister, leader of a group, town dweller, or country dweller, or if he is under the power of an obstacle, and he stays in the midst of an army that delights in battle for three days and nights, or for two days and nights at the end of the first day and night, he is not faulted if the first dawn of the third day has passed.

original: // rgyal po la sogs pas bkug pa dang bar chad kyi dbang de dag med par lta ba'i don nyid kyis g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag de'i nang du nyin mtshan gsum pa'i snga ma nyin mtshan gcig dang gnyis kyi mthar gnas pa la yang dngos gzhi re
analyzed: // rgyal po la sogs pas bkug pa dang bar chad kyi dbang de dag med par lta ba'i don nyid kyis g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag de'i nang du nyin mtshan gsum pa'i snga ma nyin mtshan gcig dang gnyis kyi mthar gnas pa la yang dngos gzhi re
translated: The actual basis is when one stays in the midst of such a battle for three days and nights, or for one or two days and nights at the end of the three days and nights.

original: rer 'gyur ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rer 'gyur ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: The performance is the absence of regret.🔽The agent is a monk who is summoned by a king or other authorities, or who is under the influence of obstacles, and who stays in the midst of a battle that is delightful to the mind, when the third dawn has risen, or who stays there for one or two days and nights.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni rgyal po la sogs pas bkug pa dang / bar chad kyi dbang de dag yod na g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag gi nang du skya rengs gsum pa shar ba dang / de dag med par der zhag gcig dang gnyis kyi skya rengs shar ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni rgyal po la sogs pas bkug pa dang / bar chad kyi dbang de dag yod na g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag gi nang du skya rengs gsum pa shar ba dang / de dag med par der zhag gcig dang gnyis kyi skya rengs shar ba'o //
translated: The actual basis is when one stays there for three days and nights, or for one or two days and nights at the end of the three days and nights.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The conclusion is the absence of regret.

original: dag slong rgyal po la sogs pas bkug pa dang / bar chad kyi dbang gis dgos pa yod pa dang / g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag nyid dang / der skya rengs gsum bshar ba dang / dgos pa de dag med par der zhag gcig gi skya rengs shar ba dang /
analyzed: dag slong rgyal po la sogs pas bkug pa dang / bar chad kyi dbang gis dgos pa yod pa dang / g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag nyid dang / der skya rengs gsum bshar ba dang / dgos pa de dag med par der zhag gcig gi skya rengs shar ba dang /
translated: The first is when one is summoned by a king or the like, the second is when there is a need due to an obstacle, the third is when one is a soldier who delights in battle, the fourth is when one stays there for three dawns, and the fifth is when one stays there for the dawn of the second day without any of those needs.

original: dgos pa @184b de dag med par der zhag gnyis pa'i skya rengs shar ba'o //
analyzed: dgos pa @184b de dag med par der zhag gnyis pa'i skya rengs shar ba'o //
translated: The first is when one stays there for the dawn of the second day without any of those needs.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of those limbs are incomplete, one is partially defiled.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ci srid du dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ci srid du dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: The downfall through preparation is a minor offense. As long as one stays in the army, one commits a minor offense for each day, from the time one begins the preparations for the downfall of staying in the army until one reaches the actual downfall.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each preparation that is different from the actual downfall, one commits a minor offense.

original: rgyal po la sogs pas bkug pa dang bar chad kyi dbang de dag yod na nyin mtshan gnyis pa las 'das pa phan chad gsum pa'i skya rengs 'char ka tshun chad du nyes byas so //
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pas bkug pa dang bar chad kyi dbang de dag yod na nyin mtshan gnyis pa las 'das pa phan chad gsum pa'i skya rengs 'char ka tshun chad du nyes byas so //
translated: If there is a reason for the king and so on to summon him, or if there is a reason for an obstacle, then there is an offense of wrong conduct after the second day, until the dawn of the third day.

original: de dag med par nyin mtshan gcig dang gnyis kyi skya rengs 'char ka tshun chad du yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: de dag med par nyin mtshan gcig dang gnyis kyi skya rengs 'char ka tshun chad du yang nyes byas so //
translated: If there is no such reason, then there is an offense of wrong conduct after one or two days, until the dawn.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The offense of wrong conduct for the preparation is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many preparations as there are, there are also that many preparations for the preparation.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation for the preparation is also a minor offense, a minor offense of wrong conduct.

original: ltung ba med pa ni rgyal po la sogs pas bkug pa dang / bar chad kyi dbang gis dgos pa yod na zhag gnyis pa'i skya rengs dang po shar gyi bar du der gnas pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni rgyal po la sogs pas bkug pa dang / bar chad kyi dbang gis dgos pa yod na zhag gnyis pa'i skya rengs dang po shar gyi bar du der gnas pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if there is a reason for the king and so on to summon him, or if there is a reason for an obstacle, and he stays there until the first dawn of the second day.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is a beginner, or is insane, or is deranged, or is overwhelmed by pain, or is the first offender.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule is that monks should train by not staying in the army for more than three nights.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is as before.

original: dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu drug pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu drug pa bshad zin to /
translated: This was the forty-sixth downfall.

original: // / dpung gi yan lag nyams su myong bar byed pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra nga na bzhugs so //
analyzed: // / dpung gi yan lag nyams su myong bar byed pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra nga na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin of the downfall of experiencing the army’s maneuvers: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Prince Jeta’s grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: ri brags pa de de lta na yang ma phebs nas ko sa'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la smras pa /
analyzed: ri brags pa de de lta na yang ma phebs nas ko sa'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la smras pa /
translated: The mountain man did not go, and King Prasenajit of Kosala said to the householder Anāthapiṇḍada,

original: khyim bdag khye'u mi dran nam /
analyzed: khyim bdag khye'u mi dran nam /
translated: “Householder, do you not remember the young men?”

original: lha khye'u dag ni mi dran te /
analyzed: lha khye'u dag ni mi dran te /
translated: “Your Majesty, I do not remember the young men.

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa dag mthong bar 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa dag mthong bar 'tshal lo //
translated: I only wish to see the noble ones.”

original: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis dge 'dun la 'phags pa dag mthong bar 'tshal lo zhes yi ge spring ba dang / dge skos kyis dge 'dun gyi mdun du yi ge klags te /
analyzed: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis dge 'dun la 'phags pa dag mthong bar 'tshal lo zhes yi ge spring ba dang / dge skos kyis dge 'dun gyi mdun du yi ge klags te /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala sent a letter to the Saṅgha, saying, “I wish to see the noble ones.” The monk in charge of announcements read the letter in front of the Saṅgha,

original: gang der 'gro bar spro ba des tshul shing long shig ces tshul shing brims pa dang / dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gang der 'gro bar spro ba des tshul shing long shig ces tshul shing brims pa dang / dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag gis smras pa /
translated: saying, “Whoever is willing to go there should take a voting stick.” When the voting sticks were distributed, the elder monks said,

original: kho bo cag ni rgan po sbyor mi bzod pa dag yin pas @185a * //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni rgan po sbyor mi bzod pa dag yin pas @185a * //
translated: “We are old and cannot bear the journey.

original: der 'gro mi nus so //
analyzed: der 'gro mi nus so //
translated: We cannot go there.”

original: dge slong gsar bu gsar bu dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong gsar bu gsar bu dag gis smras pa /
translated: The younger monks said,

original: der chos bstan par bya dgos na /
analyzed: der chos bstan par bya dgos na /
translated: “We must teach the Dharma there.

original: bdag cag ni thos pa nyung ba yin pas chos bstan par ni mi nus na /
analyzed: bdag cag ni thos pa nyung ba yin pas chos bstan par ni mi nus na /
translated: “We have little learning, so we cannot teach the Dharma.

original: der chu brim par bya ba'am ci bdag cag der 'gro mi nus so //
analyzed: der chu brim par bya ba'am ci bdag cag der 'gro mi nus so //
translated: We cannot go there to pour water.”

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six said,

original: dga' bo nye dga' ji srid du bcom ldan 'das bzhugs shing bdag cag gson pa de srid du bstan pa gnas la /
analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' ji srid du bcom ldan 'das bzhugs shing bdag cag gson pa de srid du bstan pa gnas la /
translated: “Nandaka, as long as the Blessed One lives and we are alive, the teaching will remain.

original: bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das shing bdag cag dus la bab na bstan pa nub par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das shing bdag cag dus la bab na bstan pa nub par brjod par bya ste /
translated: When the Blessed One has passed into parinirvāṇa and we have died, we can say that the teaching has disappeared.”

original: ci srid du bdag cag gson pa de srid du bstan pa la gces pa bskyed par byas tshul shing blang ngo zhes de dag gis tshul shing blangs te der dod nas rgyal po la chos bsten pas /
analyzed: ci srid du bdag cag gson pa de srid du bstan pa la gces pa bskyed par byas tshul shing blang ngo zhes de dag gis tshul shing blangs te der dod nas rgyal po la chos bsten pas /
translated: They took the sticks and went to the king, where they taught the Dharma.

original: rgyal po mngon par dad par byas so //
analyzed: rgyal po mngon par dad par byas so //
translated: The king developed faith.

original: btsun mo dang gzhon nu dang / zhang blon dang khrom gyi ru sna dag la yang chos bstan pas skye bo phal po che'i tshogs mngon par dad par byas so //
analyzed: btsun mo dang gzhon nu dang / zhang blon dang khrom gyi ru sna dag la yang chos bstan pas skye bo phal po che'i tshogs mngon par dad par byas so //
translated: He also taught the Dharma to the queens, princes, ministers, and leaders of the merchants, and so he caused a great crowd of people to develop faith.

original: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis blon po rnams la smras pa /
analyzed: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis blon po rnams la smras pa /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala said to his ministers,

original: ded la g-yul shoms shig dang ri brags pa bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: ded la g-yul shoms shig dang ri brags pa bskor bar bya'o //
translated: “Prepare for battle! We will attack the hill fort.”

original: de dag gis g-yul bsham par brtsams pa dang / drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis g-yul bsham par brtsams pa dang / drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: When they began to prepare for battle, the group of six said,

original: dga' bo nye dga' bdag cag gis yun ji srid du gzhan gyi spyod lam gyis gnas par byas /
analyzed: dga' bo nye dga' bdag cag gis yun ji srid du gzhan gyi spyod lam gyis gnas par byas /
translated: “Nandaka and Upanandaka, for how long must we live by the conduct of others?

original: rang gi spyod lam gyis gnas par byas /
analyzed: rang gi spyod lam gyis gnas par byas /
translated: Let us live by our own conduct.

original: gsus po che'i rgyal mtshan gyi mchog dang dpung gi mchog dang g-yul bkod cing bshams pa'i dmag la lta ba nyams su myong bar byas 'dong ngo zhes de dag g-yul shom pa'i nang du dong ste dris pa /
analyzed: gsus po che'i rgyal mtshan gyi mchog dang dpung gi mchog dang g-yul bkod cing bshams pa'i dmag la lta ba nyams su myong bar byas 'dong ngo zhes de dag g-yul shom pa'i nang du dong ste dris pa /
translated: Let us go and experience the sight of the supreme banner of the great belly, the supreme army, and the arrayed and prepared army.” They went to the place where the battle was being prepared and asked,

original: shes ldan dag ci byed /
analyzed: shes ldan dag ci byed /
translated: “Sirs, what are you doing?”🔽“We are preparing for battle.”🔽“

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: 'phags pa dag bkod pa shom mo //
analyzed: 'phags pa dag bkod pa shom mo //
translated: “Noble ones, we are preparing the array.”

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group-of-six said,

original: bkren pa dag glang po che bcos ma 'di lta bu dag phyogs 'dir 'jog gam /
analyzed: bkren pa dag glang po che bcos ma 'di lta bu dag phyogs 'dir 'jog gam /
translated: “You poor things, are you putting such fake elephants in this place?

original: 'di dag sol cig ces de dag gis mchi ba dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor ro //🔽rta theng po 'di lta bu dag phyogs 'dir 'jog gam 'di sol cig ces de dag gis mjug ma dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor ro //🔽shing rta zhig pa 'di lta bu 'di dag phyogs 'dir 'jog gam /
analyzed: 'di dag sol cig ces de dag gis mchi ba dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor ro // rta theng po 'di lta bu dag phyogs 'dir 'jog gam 'di sol cig ces de dag gis mjug ma dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor ro // shing rta zhig pa 'di lta bu 'di dag phyogs 'dir 'jog gam /
translated: Throw them out!” They grabbed them by the trunk and threw them in a heap in one place.🔽“Are you putting such lame horses in this place? Throw them out!” They grabbed them by the tail and threw them in a heap in one place.

original: 'di sol cig ces dag gis de dag gi srog shing dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor ro /🔽mi zhar ba 'di lta bu dag phyogs 'dir 'jog gam /
analyzed: 'di sol cig ces dag gis de dag gi srog shing dag nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor ro / mi zhar ba 'di lta bu dag phyogs 'dir 'jog gam /
translated: “Are you putting such broken-down carts in this place? Throw them out!” They grabbed them by the axle and threw them in a heap in one place.

original: 'di sol cig cas de dag gis de dag gi gnya' ba nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor ro //
analyzed: 'di sol cig cas de dag gis de dag gi gnya' ba nas bzung ste mtha' gcig tu bor ro //
translated: “Are you putting such hunchbacked men in this place? Throw them out!” They grabbed them by the neck and threw them in a heap in one place.

original: drug sde dag de'i mdun logs su ri brags pa dang / thag mi @185b ring bar 'khod de glag tshor gyi sgra phyung ba dang / de dag gis bsams pa /🔽ri brags pa dag rdzong nas rlugs te byung ngo snyam du rig nas skrag cing sngangs te 'bros par brtsams pa dang / drug sde dag myur ba myur bar dong ste /
analyzed: drug sde dag de'i mdun logs su ri brags pa dang / thag mi @185b ring bar 'khod de glag tshor gyi sgra phyung ba dang / de dag gis bsams pa / ri brags pa dag rdzong nas rlugs te byung ngo snyam du rig nas skrag cing sngangs te 'bros par brtsams pa dang / drug sde dag myur ba myur bar dong ste /
translated: The group of six monks drew a picture of a fort in front of them, and sat down not far away. They made the sound of a hawk, and they thought,🔽“The people of the fort have been driven out and are coming.”🔽They ran away in fear and terror, but the group of six monks quickly went to the front of the crowd and said,

original: khrom gyi ru sna'i mdun du 'khod de smras pa / shes ldan dag ci'i phyir 'bros /
analyzed: khrom gyi ru sna'i mdun du 'khod de smras pa / shes ldan dag ci'i phyir 'bros /

original: de dag gis smras pa 'phags pa dag ri brags pa dag rdzong nas rlugs te byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa 'phags pa dag ri brags pa dag rdzong nas rlugs te byung ngo //
translated: “Noble ones, the people of the fort have been driven out and are coming.”

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six monks said,

original: bkren pa dag de ni kho bo cag gis ku re cung zhig byas pa yin te /
analyzed: bkren pa dag de ni kho bo cag gis ku re cung zhig byas pa yin te /
translated: “You fools, we were just joking a little bit.

original: gal te ri brags pa dag gis khyed cag de ltar bred ngas par shes shing rig par gyur na nang par snga ba kho nar yang khyed cag gnya' ba dag nas btags te ri brags shig tu khrid par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te ri brags pa dag gis khyed cag de ltar bred ngas par shes shing rig par gyur na nang par snga ba kho nar yang khyed cag gnya' ba dag nas btags te ri brags shig tu khrid par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the mountain tribes know that you are so frightened, they will capture you by the neck early in the morning and lead you off to their mountain fastness.🔽Do not be afraid. Return home.”

original: ma 'jigs par phyir log shig / de dag phyogs gcig tu dong ste sems khong du chud cing 'khod do //
analyzed: ma 'jigs par phyir log shig / de dag phyogs gcig tu dong ste sems khong du chud cing 'khod do //
translated: They went off to one side and sat there with their minds troubled.

original: ci tsam na ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal 'ongs nas des smras pa /
analyzed: ci tsam na ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal 'ongs nas des smras pa /
translated: Then King Prasenajit of Kosala came and said to them,

original: shes ldan dag khyed kyis da dung yang g-yul gyi bkod pa ma bshams sam /
analyzed: shes ldan dag khyed kyis da dung yang g-yul gyi bkod pa ma bshams sam /
translated: “Sirs, have you not yet set up the battle array?”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: lha bdag cag rgyal bar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: lha bdag cag rgyal bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: “Your Majesty, how could we be victorious?

original: 'di ltar dge sbyor mgo reg ras yug chen glegs pa 'tshal ba 'di dag mchis nas bdag cag la tho 'tshams shing mi mchi dgu mchi'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge sbyor mgo reg ras yug chen glegs pa 'tshal ba 'di dag mchis nas bdag cag la tho 'tshams shing mi mchi dgu mchi'o //
translated: These shaven-headed religious impostors, wearing saffron robes, have come and are harassing us in every way.”🔽“Who are these noble ones?”

original: gang dag 'phags pa drug sde dag go //
analyzed: gang dag 'phags pa drug sde dag go //
translated: “They are the group of six.”

original: shes ldan dag de dag ni dge sbyong hral po dag yin pas de dag gis smras pa khyed la ci gnod /🔽deng la g-yul gyi bkod pa shoms shig / ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis bsams pa /
analyzed: shes ldan dag de dag ni dge sbyong hral po dag yin pas de dag gis smras pa khyed la ci gnod / deng la g-yul gyi bkod pa shoms shig / ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis bsams pa /
translated: “Sirs, they are shaven-headed ascetics. What harm have they done you?”🔽“Go and prepare for battle.”🔽King Prasenajit of Kosala thought, “They will continue to harass me again and again.”

original: 'di dag yang dang yang du bdag la tho 'tshams par 'gyur ro snyam du rig nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar mi zhig las 'phrin gyis bsnyun gsol te / btsun pa 'phags pa 'di dag shin tu yun ring por dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i tshe na
analyzed: 'di dag yang dang yang du bdag la tho 'tshams par 'gyur ro snyam du rig nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar mi zhig las 'phrin gyis bsnyun gsol te / btsun pa 'phags pa 'di dag shin tu yun ring por dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i tshe na
translated: Knowing this, he sent a man to the Blessed One with a message, “Lord, if these noble ones remain in the army for a long time,🔽they will again experience the excitement of battle, the sight of the best of banners, the best of armies, and the arrayed troops.

original: yang bshams pa 'khrug tu mchi zhing rgyal mtshan gyi mchog dang dpung gi mchog dang g-yul bshams pa'i dmag la lta ba nyams su myong bar bgyid na kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du gang gis 'phags pa dag shin tu yun ring por dmag
analyzed: yang bshams pa 'khrug tu mchi zhing rgyal mtshan gyi mchog dang dpung gi mchog dang g-yul bshams pa'i dmag la lta ba nyams su myong bar bgyid na kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du gang gis 'phags pa dag shin tu yun ring por dmag
translated: “Oh, Blessed One, out of compassion, please do something so that the noble ones will not remain in the army for a long time,

original: gi nang na gnas pa'i tshe yang bshams pa 'khrug tu mi mchi zhing /
analyzed: gi nang na gnas pa'i tshe yang bshams pa 'khrug tu mi mchi zhing /
translated: When we are in the inner quarters, we are not disturbed by the commotion of the army.

original: rgyal mtshan gyi mchog dang / dpung gi mchog dang / g-yul bshams pa'i dmag la lta ba nyams su myong bar bgyid par mi 'gyur bar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa rnams la dran par bgyi ba cung zhig bca' ba mdzad na legs so zhes gsol to //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan gyi mchog dang / dpung gi mchog dang / g-yul bshams pa'i dmag la lta ba nyams su myong bar bgyid par mi 'gyur bar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa rnams la dran par bgyi ba cung zhig bca' ba mdzad na legs so zhes gsol to //
translated: It would be good if the Blessed One would give the noble ones some advice so that we do not experience the best of the banners, the best of the armies, and the sight of the army arrayed for battle.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das @186a * //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das @186a * //
translated: Then the Blessed One,

original: kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: in this case, with this background, and on this occasion, gathered the saṅgha of monks

original: drug sde dag la rmas nas /
analyzed: drug sde dag la rmas nas /
translated: and questioned the group of six:

analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: “Monks, this is not the way of a mendicant,🔽it is not suitable,🔽it is not proper,

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: it is not fitting.🔽This is not something a renunciant should do.”

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Having seen the ten benefits of establishing the training rules, I have laid down for my disciples this basis of training:

analyzed: dge slong zhag gnyis dmag de'i nang na gnas pa'i tshe yang gal te bshams pa 'khrug tu 'gro'am /
translated: “If a monk stays among an army for two nights, and if he goes to watch an army setting out,

original: rgyal mtshan gyi mchog gam /
analyzed: rgyal mtshan gyi mchog gam /
translated: or the best of the banners,

original: dpung gi mchog gam /
analyzed: dpung gi mchog gam /
translated: or the best of the troops,

original: g-yul bshams pa'i dmag la lta ba nyams su myong bar byed na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: g-yul bshams pa'i dmag la lta ba nyams su myong bar byed na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: or if he experiences the army arrayed for battle, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The location is Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni drug sde /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug sde /
translated: The individuals are the group of six.

original: nyon mongs pa ni ma dul ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni ma dul ba /
translated: The affliction is any one of the three.

analyzed: nyes pa ni zhag gnyis dmag de'i nang na gnas pa'i tshe yang dpung gi yan lag bzhi nyams su myong bar byed pa'o //
translated: The misdeed is staying among an army for two nights and experiencing the four divisions of the army.

original: de la dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la dge slong zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //

analyzed: zhag gnyis zhes bya ba ni zhag gnyis tshun chad do //

original: dmag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: dmag ces bya ba la /

analyzed: dmag ni yan lag gcig pa yang yod /

original: yan lag gnyis pa yang yod /
analyzed: yan lag gnyis pa yang yod /

original: yan lag gsum pa yang yod /
analyzed: yan lag gsum pa yang yod /

analyzed: yan lag bzhi pa yang yod do //

analyzed: dmag yan lag gcig pa gang zhe na /

original: glang po che'i tshogs so //
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs so //

original: dmag yan lag gnyis pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmag yan lag gnyis pa gang zhe na /

original: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs so //

original: dmag yan lag gsum pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmag yan lag gsum pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is an army with three branches?

original: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs so //
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs so //
translated: It is an army of elephants, an army of horses, and an army of chariots.

original: dmag yan lag bzhi pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmag yan lag bzhi pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is an army with four branches?

original: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs so //🔽de'i nang na gnas pa'i tshe yang zhes bya ba ni 'dug pa'i tshe yang ngo //
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs so // de'i nang na gnas pa'i tshe yang zhes bya ba ni 'dug pa'i tshe yang ngo //
translated: It is an army of elephants, an army of horses, an army of chariots, and an army of infantry.

analyzed: gal te bshams pa 'khrug tu 'gro 'am zhes bya ba ni g-yul la chas pa 'khrug tu 'gro ba'o //
translated: “If he goes to the place where the army is arrayed” means if he goes to the place where the army is arrayed in battle formation.
