analyzed: rgyal mtshan gyi mchog ces bya ba ni rgyal mtshan rnam pa bzhi ste /

analyzed: khyu mchog gi rgyal mtshan dang / chu srin gyi rgyal mtshan dang / seng ge'i rgyal mtshan dang / klu'i rgyal mtshan no //
translated: the banner of the bull, the banner of the crocodile, the banner of the lion, and the banner of the nāga.

original: dpung gi mchog ces bya ba ni dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: dpung gi mchog ces bya ba ni dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa ste /
translated: The “best of armies” is the fourfold army:

original: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs so //
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs so //
translated: the army of elephants, the army of horses, the army of chariots, and the army of infantry.🔽If, motivated by a wrong view, he goes to see an army arrayed in battle formation, then except for the time when he is simply passing by, he commits an offense.

original: g-yul bshams pa'i @186b dmag la lta ba nyams su myong bar byed na zhes bya ba ni bshams pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: g-yul bshams pa'i @186b dmag la lta ba nyams su myong bar byed na zhes bya ba ni bshams pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: “Arrayed” means arrayed in four ways:

analyzed: 'bru'i kha lta bu dang / shing rta'i dbyibs lta bu dang zla gam gyi dbyibs lta bu dang / nam mkha' lding gi dbyibs lta bu'o //

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //🔽de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong bar chad kyi dbang gis 'gro ba ma yin pas dpung gi yan lag sdud pa'am /
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o // de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong bar chad kyi dbang gis 'gro ba ma yin pas dpung gi yan lag sdud pa'am /
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of this downfall through the main part, the preparation, and the preparation of the preparation, as well as through the downfalls, the non-downfalls, the trainings, and the amendments.

original: so so ba sta gon byas pa rnams kyi dngos kyi reg pa dang / bshams pa dkrugs pa dang / lta ba'i phyir 'phags shing nye 'khor gyi mtha' las 'das te /
analyzed: so so ba sta gon byas pa rnams kyi dngos kyi reg pa dang / bshams pa dkrugs pa dang / lta ba'i phyir 'phags shing nye 'khor gyi mtha' las 'das te /
translated: The main part of the downfall of joining an army is defined as follows: A monk who is not going because of an obstacle and who either joins an army or prepares to join it, and then touches the actual army or disturbs its formation or goes beyond the boundary of its encampment for the purpose of observing it,

original: mthong ba lta bu nyams su myong na dpung gi yan lag nyams su myong bar byed pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba lta bu nyams su myong na dpung gi yan lag nyams su myong bar byed pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: commits the actual downfall of joining an army if he sees or experiences the army.

original: dge slong bar chad brgyad dang / gnod pa nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i don du 'gro ba la sogs pa ma yin pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong bar chad brgyad dang / gnod pa nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i don du 'gro ba la sogs pa ma yin pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in going to the eight assemblies of monks, etc.

original: g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag gi dpung gi yan lag glang po che dang / rta dang / shing rta dang dpung bu chung dag la na smad pa med do //🔽dpung gi yan lag de dag bsdus pa 'am /

translated: There is no fault in going to the four divisions of an army, elephants, horses, chariots, and infantry, which delight in battle.🔽There is no fault in going to the army when it is assembled,

original: so so ba lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: so so ba lan smad pa med do //
translated: or when it is dispersed.

original: bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal mtshan gyi mchog dang / dpung gi mchog bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal mtshan gyi mchog dang / dpung gi mchog bsdus pa ste /
translated: The army is said to be assembled when the best of the banners and the best of the troops are assembled.

original: rgyal mtshan gyi mchog ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rgyal mtshan gyi mchog ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The best of the banners are of four types:

original: khyu mchog gi rgyal mtshan dang / chu srin gyi rgyal mtshan dang / seng ge'i rgyal mtshan dang / klu'i rgyal mtshan no //
analyzed: khyu mchog gi rgyal mtshan dang / chu srin gyi rgyal mtshan dang / seng ge'i rgyal mtshan dang / klu'i rgyal mtshan no //
translated: the banner of the bull, the banner of the crocodile, the banner of the lion, and the banner of the naga.

original: dpung gi mchog ces bya ba ni dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: dpung gi mchog ces bya ba ni dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa ste /
translated: The best of the troops is the fourfold army.

original: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta pa'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs so //
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta pa'i tshogs dang / shing rta pa'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs so //
translated: the division of elephants, the division of cavalry, the division of chariots, the division of infantry.

original: so so ba zhes bya ba ni g-yul bkod cing bshams pa'i dmag so so ba ste /
analyzed: so so ba zhes bya ba ni g-yul bkod cing bshams pa'i dmag so so ba ste /
translated: The individual is the individual army that is arrayed and set in order for battle.

original: g-yul bkod cing bshams pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: g-yul bkod cing bshams pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The array and setting in order of the army is of four kinds:

original: 'bru'i kha lta bu dang / shing rta'i dbyibs lta bu dang / zla gam gyi rnam pa lta bu dang / nam mkha' lding gi 'dab ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'bru'i kha lta bu dang / shing rta'i dbyibs lta bu dang / zla gam gyi rnam pa lta bu dang / nam mkha' lding gi 'dab ma lta bu'o //
translated: like a spike of grain, like a chariot, like a half-moon, and like a flying goose.

original: de la 'bru'i kha lta bu zhes bya ba ni mdun du yang ru dngar /
analyzed: de la 'bru'i kha lta bu zhes bya ba ni mdun du yang ru dngar /
translated: Among them, like a spike of grain means that in front there is a vanguard,

original: rgyab tu yang ru dang ra la /
analyzed: rgyab tu yang ru dang ra la /
translated: and in the rear there is a rearguard,

analyzed: dbus na rgyal po 'dug pa'o // shing rta'i dbyibs lta bu zhes bya ba ni mdun du yang ru dngar /

original: glor yang ru dngar la /
analyzed: glor yang ru dngar la /
translated: and in the flanks there are sideguards,

original: rgyab na rgyal po 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: rgyab na rgyal po 'dug pa'o //

original: rgyab tu yang ru dngar /
analyzed: rgyab tu yang ru dngar /
translated: and in the rear there is a rearguard,🔽with the king in the middle.

original: glor yang ru dngar la /
analyzed: glor yang ru dngar la /
translated: In the back, too, is a row of chariots.

original: dbus na rgyal po 'dug pa'o //🔽nam mkha' lding gi 'dab ma lta bu zhes bya ba ni rgyab tu yang ru dngar /
analyzed: dbus na rgyal po 'dug pa'o // nam mkha' lding gi 'dab ma lta bu zhes bya ba ni rgyab tu yang ru dngar /

original: glor yang ru dngar la /
analyzed: glor yang ru dngar la /

original: mdun na rgyal po 'dug pa'o //

analyzed: dpung gi yan lag bsdus pa'am /

analyzed: so so ba de dag sta gon byas ba rnams kyi dngos la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in the actual army of those who are prepared.

analyzed: sta gon byas pa zhes bya ba ni glang po che la sogs pa go bskon pa dang / shing rta bshams pa dang / rgyal mtshan bsgreng ba dang / gzhu bdungs pa dang / mda' mde'u can bstar ba dang / ral gri phyung ba nyid la sogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: What is called prepared is the armoring of elephants and so on, the arrangement of chariots, the raising of banners, the drawing of bows, the lining up of arrows and quivers, the unsheathing of swords and so on.

original: sta gon byas pa rnams kyi dngos zhes bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: sta gon byas pa rnams kyi dngos zhes bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the actual army of those who are prepared?

original: reg pa dang bshams pa dkrugs pa dang / lta ba'i phyir 'phags shing nye 'khor gyi mtha' las 'das te mthong ba lta bu ni dngos dag yin no //
analyzed: reg pa dang bshams pa dkrugs pa dang / lta ba'i phyir 'phags shing nye 'khor gyi mtha' las 'das te mthong ba lta bu ni dngos dag yin no //
translated: The actual basis is when one mounts a vehicle, or goes beyond the boundary of the village or town for the purpose of touching, arranging, or looking.

original: dngos de dag la ltung ba'i dngos gzhi la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dngos de dag la ltung ba'i dngos gzhi la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one touches the limbs of the army out of necessity, such as when a snake or a thorn pricks one.

original: reg pa zhes bya ba ni glang po che la sogs pa sta gon byas pa rnams la reg pa ste /
analyzed: reg pa zhes bya ba ni glang po che la sogs pa sta gon byas pa rnams la reg pa ste /
translated: Touching means to touch an elephant or other animal that is ready to be mounted.

original: dpung gi yan lag la reg pa 'di rin po cher smos pa la reg pa'i ltung byed las yul gzhan yin par reg par bya'o //
analyzed: dpung gi yan lag la reg pa 'di rin po cher smos pa la reg pa'i ltung byed las yul gzhan yin par reg par bya'o //
translated: This is different from the downfall of touching precious substances, which refers to touching the limbs of the army.

original: bshams pa dkrugs pa zhes bya ba ni glang po che la sogs pa gnas nas bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: bshams pa dkrugs pa zhes bya ba ni glang po che la sogs pa gnas nas bskyod pa'o //

original: lta ba'i phyir 'phags shing nye 'khor gyi mtha' las 'das te mthong ba zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis dpung gi yan lag dag lta ba'i phyir gnas nas 'phags shing nye 'khor gyi mtha' las 'das te dpung gi yan lag dag mthong ba gang yin pa'o //🔽lta ba ni dngos dag yin no zhes bya ba ni reg pa dag dang bshams pa dkrugs pa dang blta ba'i phyir 'phags shing nye 'khor gyi mtha' las 'das te mthong ba zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum po de lta bu'i dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba'i
analyzed: lta ba'i phyir 'phags shing nye 'khor gyi mtha' las 'das te mthong ba zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis dpung gi yan lag dag lta ba'i phyir gnas nas 'phags shing nye 'khor gyi mtha' las 'das te dpung gi yan lag dag mthong ba gang yin pa'o // lta ba ni dngos dag yin no zhes bya ba ni reg pa dag dang bshams pa dkrugs pa dang blta ba'i phyir 'phags shing nye 'khor gyi mtha' las 'das te mthong ba zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum po de lta bu'i dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba'i
translated: The term having gone beyond the boundary of the vicinity for the purpose of seeing means that a monk, having gone beyond the boundary of the vicinity for the purpose of seeing the army, sees the army.

original: rgyur gyur pa'i dngos dag yin pa'o //🔽de lta bu nyams su myong ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa'i dngos dag yin pa'o // de lta bu nyams su myong ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: The term the actual basis means the actual basis that is the cause of the offense that is the basis of a root downfall. The term for the purpose of seeing refers to the three types of seeing: seeing that which is arranged, seeing that which is disturbed, and seeing for the purpose of seeing.

original: nyams su myong ba la sbyor ba'i nyes byas su na smad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba la sbyor ba'i nyes byas su na smad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term there is no offense for one who has experienced such means that there is no offense for one who has experienced such a thing.🔽The term there is an offense for one who has applied himself to experience means that there is an offense for one who has applied himself to experience such a thing.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge slong bar chad kyi dbang gis 'gro ba ma yin pa la dpung gi yan lag bsdus pa 'am /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge slong bar chad kyi dbang gis 'gro ba ma yin pa la dpung gi yan lag bsdus pa 'am /
translated: The agent of this is a monk who is not going due to an obstacle, who assembles the four branches of the army,

analyzed: so so ba sta gon byas pa rnams kyi dngos byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: or who prepares each branch individually.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The actual basis is a downfall through five factors:

original: dge slong bar chad kyi dbang gis 'gro ba ma yin pa dang / dpung gi yan lag bzhi po rnams dang bsdus pa 'am /
analyzed: dge slong bar chad kyi dbang gis 'gro ba ma yin pa dang / dpung gi yan lag bzhi po rnams dang bsdus pa 'am /
translated: a monk who is not going due to an obstacle, who assembles the four branches of the army,

analyzed: so so ba gang yang rung ba dang / sta gon byas pa rnams kyi dngos la reg pa dang / bshams pa dkrugs pa dang / @187b lta ba'i phyir 'phags shing nye 'khor gyi mtha' las 'das te mthong ba lta bu gang yang rung ba dang de dag nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: or who prepares each branch individually, who touches the actual army, who disturbs the prepared army, who goes beyond the boundary of the vicinity for the purpose of seeing the army, or who sees it as if it were passing by, and who experiences it.

analyzed: dge slong de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If the factors are incomplete, the monk is censured according to the circumstances.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ci srid du dpung gi yan lag nyams su myong bar byed pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la mthug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ci srid du dpung gi yan lag nyams su myong bar byed pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la mthug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor offense.🔽As long as one has begun the preparation for the actual downfall of engaging in battle, but has not yet reached the climax, it is a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed pa brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed pa brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the preparations for the actual downfall, there is a minor offense.

original: dpung ma chas pa nyid la nyes byas so /
analyzed: dpung ma chas pa nyid la nyes byas so /
translated: If the army has not set out, it is a minor offense.

original: nyams su ma myong ba'i sbyor ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: nyams su ma myong ba'i sbyor ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If one has not yet experienced the actual downfall, the preparation is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The downfall of preparation for preparation is a minor infraction.

original: sbyor ba ci snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ci snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /

analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //

analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni dge slong bar chad kyi dbang gis 'gro ba la ltung ba mad do //

analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen ba la ltung ba med do //

translated: The training rule is that a monk should train in not attending to the experience of the branches of the army in all countries and in all situations.

original: glang po che dang / rta dang / bya gag dang / bya la ba ka dang / bya brta ka dang / skyes pa dang / bud med 'thab pa la sogs pa bya ba dang / byed du gzhug pa dang / blta bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: glang po che dang / rta dang / bya gag dang / bya la ba ka dang / bya brta ka dang / skyes pa dang / bud med 'thab pa la sogs pa bya ba dang / byed du gzhug pa dang / blta bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not attend or cause others to attend, or watch elephants, horses, cocks, or sparrows fighting, or men and women fighting, and so on.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

analyzed: dpung gi yan lag nyams su myong bar byed pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu bdun pa bshad zin to /

translated: The origin of the downfall of beating: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

analyzed: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen pos nye ba 'khor la sogs pa sar ba skyes pa gzhon nu bcu bdun sde'i chogs dag rab tu phyung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par byas pa de'i tshe na /
translated: When the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana gave the going forth and the ordination to the group of seventeen young men, beginning with Upasena,

analyzed: de dag drug sde dag la rten par byed / bsnyen par byed /

analyzed: de nas 'char kas smras pa /

analyzed: bcu bdun sde dag tshur sheg /'di dang 'di gyis shig / de dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka ci'i phyir gzhon nu dag la rdeg par byed / 'char kas smras pa /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag kho bos gcig brdegs pa dang thams cad sa la 'gyel te du'o // dge slong rnams kyis bcu bdun sde dag la smras pa /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed cag las gcig brdegs na ci'i phyir thams cad sa la 'gyel te ngu / de dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: gal te ma dus na thams cad la brdeg par 'gyur ro zhes zer nas /
translated: They said, If we had not cried, he would have hit all of us.🔽 They said, If we had not cried, he would have hit all of us.🔽 They said, If we had not cried, he would have hit all of us.

analyzed: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas dge slong la rdeg par byed ces smod bar byed /

analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /

original: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /

analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa / rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: it is not to be performed.🔽It is not proper for one gone forth to do such a thing.”

analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: He censured them in many ways, saying,🔽“Monks, how can the monks act like this?

translated: Having seen the ten benefits of establishing the training rules, I have established this basis of training for my disciples:

original: yang dge slong gang khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te /
translated: “If a monk, out of anger,

analyzed: yi ma rangs nas dge slong la rdeg na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
