analyzed: gang zag ni 'char ka / nyon mongs pa ni zhe sdang gi kun du sbyor ba /
translated: The affliction is any of the three poisons.

original: nyes pa ni dge slong la brdeg pa'o //🔽de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ka 'am /
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge slong la brdeg pa'o // de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ka 'am /
translated: The action is striking a monk.

original: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: The monk is either the monk Udayī or anyone else like him.

original: khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas zhes bya ba ni khros shing 'khrugs pa'i zil gyis mnan nas so //
analyzed: khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas zhes bya ba ni khros shing 'khrugs pa'i zil gyis mnan nas so //
translated: Out of anger is being overcome by anger.

original: dge slong la zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa la'o //
analyzed: dge slong la zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa la'o //
translated: A monk is a fellow Buddhist.

original: rdeg na zhes bya ba ni rdeg par byed na'o //
analyzed: rdeg na zhes bya ba ni rdeg par byed na'o //
translated: Strikes means to strike.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The downfall is accrued by the monk himself, not by the other monk.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the downfall?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the downfall is to be understood in terms of the actual basis, the preparatory stage, the aftermath of the preparatory stage, the absence of downfall, the training, and the restoration of the vow.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong @188b gis rnyog pa can gyi sems nyid kyis dge slong pha rol la lus sam des 'phangs pa 'am /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong @188b gis rnyog pa can gyi sems nyid kyis dge slong pha rol la lus sam des 'phangs pa 'am /
translated: The actual basis of the downfall is for a monk to strike another monk with a hostile mind, either with his own body, with something projected by his body, or with something connected to his body.

original: de dang 'brel ba dang gang yang rung ba na tha na rkang pa'i mthe bo 'am yungs kar ram rtsva dag gis brdegs na reg pa tsam gyis brdeg spyad re re la rdeg pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang 'brel ba dang gang yang rung ba na tha na rkang pa'i mthe bo 'am yungs kar ram rtsva dag gis brdegs na reg pa tsam gyis brdeg spyad re re la rdeg pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: The moment the other monk is struck, even if it is only with the tip of a hair or a mustard seed or a blade of grass, the actual basis of the downfall of striking is accrued.

original: rnyog pa can gyi sems khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te /
analyzed: rnyog pa can gyi sems khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te /
translated: The preparatory stage of the downfall is to be in an angry and hostile state of mind.

original: yi ma rangs pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //🔽dge slong pha rol po brdeg par bya ba chos 'di pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa can ma nyams pa mtshan dang lta ba mthun pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: yi ma rangs pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do // dge slong pha rol po brdeg par bya ba chos 'di pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa can ma nyams pa mtshan dang lta ba mthun pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the other monk is not disgusted.🔽There is no offense if the other monk is fully ordained in the same Buddhist sect, has not been expelled from the monastery, and has the same view.

original: lus sam des 'phangs pa 'am de dang 'brel pa dag gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: lus sam des 'phangs pa 'am de dang 'brel pa dag gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the other monk is struck with something that is not animate, that is not thrown, or that is not connected to a person.

original: lus zhes bya ba ni nang gi zin pa ste /
analyzed: lus zhes bya ba ni nang gi zin pa ste /
translated: “ Animate” means something that is alive.

original: sor mo gcig gam gnyis sam gsum dang bzhi dang lnga'am /
analyzed: sor mo gcig gam gnyis sam gsum dang bzhi dang lnga'am /
translated: It can be one finger, two fingers, three fingers, four fingers, or five fingers.

original: khu tshur dang gru mo dang phrag pa dang mgo dang glo dang rgyab dang rked pa dang brla dang pus mo dang rje dar la sogs pas so //
analyzed: khu tshur dang gru mo dang phrag pa dang mgo dang glo dang rgyab dang rked pa dang brla dang pus mo dang rje dar la sogs pas so //
translated: It can be a fist, an elbow, a shoulder, the head, the chest, the back, the waist, the thigh, the knee, the foot, and so on.

original: des 'phangs pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du 'phangs pa ste /
analyzed: des 'phangs pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du 'phangs pa ste /
translated: “ Thrown” means thrown from a distance.

original: mda' dang / lcags mda' dang / mda' phyed lcags las byas pa dang / mde'u ste'u kha dang / mde'u be'u so lta bu dang / mde'u zur bzhi ma dang / mde'u ka ra bi ra'i 'dab ma lta bu dang / mde'u bye snying ma dang /
analyzed: mda' dang / lcags mda' dang / mda' phyed lcags las byas pa dang / mde'u ste'u kha dang / mde'u be'u so lta bu dang / mde'u zur bzhi ma dang / mde'u ka ra bi ra'i 'dab ma lta bu dang / mde'u bye snying ma dang /
translated: arrows, iron arrows, half-arrows made of iron, arrows with heads like the mouth of a goat, arrows with heads like a calf’s tooth, arrows with four-sided heads, arrows with heads like the leaves of the karavīra plant, and arrows with heads like the seeds of the jujube plant.

original: 'khor lo dang / rdo rje rtse gcig pa dang / mda' bo che dang / mtshon rtse gcig pa dang / rgya shug gi tshi gu la sogs pas so //
analyzed: 'khor lo dang / rdo rje rtse gcig pa dang / mda' bo che dang / mtshon rtse gcig pa dang / rgya shug gi tshi gu la sogs pas so //
translated: wheels, single-pointed vajras, javelins, single-pointed weapons, and jujube seeds.

original: de dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni de gnyi ga dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni de gnyi ga dang ldan pa ste /
translated: “In connection with those” means in connection with both of those.

original: ral gri dang / shang lang dang / ral gri so gcig pa dang / ral gri so gnyis pa dang / mdung thung dang / 'phang mdung dang / chu gri dang / rtsva'i nyag ma la sogs pas so //
analyzed: ral gri dang / shang lang dang / ral gri so gcig pa dang / ral gri so gnyis pa dang / mdung thung dang / 'phang mdung dang / chu gri dang / rtsva'i nyag ma la sogs pas so //
translated: swords, spears, single-edged swords, double-edged swords, short spears, long spears, daggers, and blades of grass.

original: de gsum gyi mtha' bstan pa'i phyir tha na rkang pa'i mthe bong dang yungs kar ram rtsva dag gis brdegs na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de gsum gyi mtha' bstan pa'i phyir tha na rkang pa'i mthe bong dang yungs kar ram rtsva dag gis brdegs na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to show the limit of those three, he says, “even if struck with a toe, a mustard seed, or a blade of grass.”

original: nang gi zin pa tha na rkang pa'i mthe bo 'am /🔽phyi rol du 'phangs pa yungs kar ram /
analyzed: nang gi zin pa tha na rkang pa'i mthe bo 'am / phyi rol du 'phangs pa yungs kar ram /
translated: If one strikes internally, even with the toe,🔽or externally, even with a mustard seed,

original: phyi rol du 'phangs pa yungs kar ram /🔽de gnyis ga dang ldan pa tha na rtsva dag gis brdegs pa 'am /
analyzed: phyi rol du 'phangs pa yungs kar ram / de gnyis ga dang ldan pa tha na rtsva dag gis brdegs pa 'am /
translated: or both internally and externally, even with a blade of grass,

original: de bas kyang ches chung ba'i dngos pos brdegs na yang ltung ba la na smad pa med do //🔽ci brdegs pa'i 'og tu gang gi tshe snad cing skrangs par gyur pa de'i tshe na dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas kyang ches chung ba'i dngos pos brdegs na yang ltung ba la na smad pa med do // ci brdegs pa'i 'og tu gang gi tshe snad cing skrangs par gyur pa de'i tshe na dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: or even with something smaller than that, there is no offense.🔽Is it the case that when one is struck and injured and becomes swollen, then there is a root downfall?

original: 'on te rdeg pa'i tshe nyid na zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rdeg pa'i tshe nyid na zhe na /
translated: Or is it the case that when one is struck, there is a root downfall?

original: de'i phyir reg pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir reg pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “by mere contact.”

original: de dag gis lus la sogs pa la reg pa tsam la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de dag gis lus la sogs pa la reg pa tsam la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is merely touched on the body and so on.

original: ci brdeg spyad mang po yin na yang ltung byed gcig tu 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci brdeg spyad mang po yin na yang ltung byed gcig tu 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If one strikes many times, is there a single offense of wrongdoing, or is there an offense for each blow?

original: @189a * // ma yin te /
analyzed: @189a * // ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that there is a single offense.

original: de'i phyir brdeg spyad re re la zhes bya ba smas te /
analyzed: de'i phyir brdeg spyad re re la zhes bya ba smas te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “for each blow.”

original: brdeg spyad re re la ltung byed re rer 'gyur te /
analyzed: brdeg spyad re re la ltung byed re rer 'gyur te /
translated: There is no fault if one strikes with a fingernail, a blade of grass, or a piece of wood.

original: sor mo re re la ltung byed re re dang / yungs kar 'bru re re la ltung byed re re dang / rtsva nya ga re re la ltung byed re rer 'gyur ba la lta bu la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: sor mo re re la ltung byed re re dang / yungs kar 'bru re re la ltung byed re re dang / rtsva nya ga re re la ltung byed re rer 'gyur ba la lta bu la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if one strikes with a fingernail, a blade of grass, or a piece of wood.🔽The agent of this is a fully ordained monk who strikes another.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni pha rol po brdeg par bya ba dge slong nyid dang / brdeg spyad gang yang rung ba ci snyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni pha rol po brdeg par bya ba dge slong nyid dang / brdeg spyad gang yang rung ba ci snyed pa'o //
translated: The basis is any of the means of striking.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The actual basis is fivefold:

original: rnyog pa can gyi sems nyid dang / pha rol po brdeg par bya ba dge slong nyid dang / brdeg pa lus sam des 'phangs pa 'am de dang 'brel par gang yang rung ba dang brdeg spyad tha na rkang pa'i mthe bong ngam yungs kar ram /
analyzed: rnyog pa can gyi sems nyid dang / pha rol po brdeg par bya ba dge slong nyid dang / brdeg pa lus sam des 'phangs pa 'am de dang 'brel par gang yang rung ba dang brdeg spyad tha na rkang pa'i mthe bong ngam yungs kar ram /
translated: a mind that is disturbed, a fully ordained monk who is the one to be struck, the act of striking with the body or something projected or connected with the body, the means of striking, even if it is a toe, a mustard seed, or a blade of grass, and the act of striking.

original: rtsva bas chung ba gang yang rung ba dang tha na lus la reg pa dang / de dag las yan lag ma tshad na ci rigs bar na smad do //
analyzed: rtsva bas chung ba gang yang rung ba dang tha na lus la reg pa dang / de dag las yan lag ma tshad na ci rigs bar na smad do //
translated: If it is smaller than a blade of grass, or if it is not a part of the body, or if it is less than a part of the body, it is a minor infraction.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ci srid du brdeg pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ci srid du brdeg pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor infraction. As long as you have begun the preparation for the downfall of striking but have not reached the actual basis, you have a minor infraction.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la yang nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la yang nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the various preparations for the actual basis, you have a minor infraction.

original: rnyog pa can gyi sems kyis khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs pa nyid med pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: rnyog pa can gyi sems kyis khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs pa nyid med pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If you are in an agitated state of mind, but are not angry, hostile, or upset, you have a minor infraction.

original: pha rol po brdeg par bya ba dge slong nyams pa dang / ma chags pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: pha rol po brdeg par bya ba dge slong nyams pa dang / ma chags pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the other person is a fallen monk or a layperson, you have a minor infraction.

original: dge slong ma dang chos 'di pa'i rab tu byung ba pho mo bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong ma dang chos 'di pa'i rab tu byung ba pho mo bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the other person is a nun or a male or female novice of this doctrine, you have a minor infraction.

original: pha rol po'i rab tu byung ba dang khyim pa mi'i 'gro ba pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: pha rol po'i rab tu byung ba dang khyim pa mi'i 'gro ba pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the other person is a renunciate or a layperson of the human realm, it is a minor offense.

original: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba dang dud 'gro la nyes byas na smad do //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba dang dud 'gro la nyes byas na smad do //
translated: If the other person is a nonhuman being or an animal, it is a slight offense.

original: ma phog na nyes byas so //
analyzed: ma phog na nyes byas so //
translated: If you do not strike, it is a minor offense.

original: rang la brdegs na nyes byas so //
analyzed: rang la brdegs na nyes byas so //
translated: If you strike yourself, it is a minor offense.

original: ka ba dang rtsig pa dang sa dang shing ljon pa dang / gzhan la brdegs na nyes byas so //
analyzed: ka ba dang rtsig pa dang sa dang shing ljon pa dang / gzhan la brdegs na nyes byas so //
translated: If you strike a pillar, a wall, the ground, a tree, or another person, it is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: The downfall through preparation is a slight offense. As many as there are preparations, there are that many preparations of preparations.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation of a preparation is also a slight offense.

original: ltung ba med ba ni brnangs pa dang thal lcag gi rig sngags sgrub bar byed pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med ba ni brnangs pa dang thal lcag gi rig sngags sgrub bar byed pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if you are choking or if you are practicing a spell to cure someone who is choking.

original: dgos pa'i dbang gis shing gshegs pa dang sa brdung ba la sogs pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dgos pa'i dbang gis shing gshegs pa dang sa brdung ba la sogs pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if you are striking the ground and so forth for a purpose.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is a beginner, or is insane, or is deranged, or is overwhelmed by pain.🔽The training rule on not striking is finished.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du brdeg pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur @189b ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du brdeg pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur @189b ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The monk should not strike anyone, but should train in not striking anyone.

original: brdeg par bya ba gzhan yin la gzhan la brdeg par mi bya'o //
analyzed: brdeg par bya ba gzhan yin la gzhan la brdeg par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not strike one person while someone else is striking.

original: ka ba la brdeg par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ka ba la brdeg par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not strike a pillar.

original: rtsig pa dang shing ljon pa dang sgo glegs la sogs pa gzhan la yang brdeg par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rtsig pa dang shing ljon pa dang sgo glegs la sogs pa gzhan la yang brdeg par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not strike a wall, a tree, a door, or the like.

original: byir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: byir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as above.

original: brdeg pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu brgyad pa bshad zin to ;
analyzed: brdeg pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu brgyad pa bshad zin to ;
translated: The forty-eighth training rule on striking is finished.

original: // / gzas pa'i ltung byad kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: // / gzas pa'i ltung byad kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen pos nye ba 'khor la sogs pa sar pa skyes phran gzhon nu bcu bdun sde'i tshogs dag rab tu phyung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par byas pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen pos nye ba 'khor la sogs pa sar pa skyes phran gzhon nu bcu bdun sde'i tshogs dag rab tu phyung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par byas pa de'i tshe na /
translated: When the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana gave the going forth and the ordination to Upāli and the group of seventeen young men, the group of new young monks,

original: de dag drug sde dag la rten par byed /🔽bsnyen par byed /
analyzed: de dag drug sde dag la rten par byed / bsnyen par byed /
translated: they relied on the group of six.🔽They attended on them.

original: bsnyen bkur bar byed do //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bar byed do //
translated: They served them.

original: de nas 'char kas smras pa /
analyzed: de nas 'char kas smras pa /
translated: Then Udayin said,🔽“Group of seventeen, come here. Do this and that.”

original: bcu bdun sde dag tshur sheg /'di dang 'di gyis shig / de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: bcu bdun sde dag tshur sheg /'di dang 'di gyis shig / de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: ci khyed kho bo cag gi slob dpon yin nam mkhan po yin /
analyzed: ci khyed kho bo cag gi slob dpon yin nam mkhan po yin /
translated: “Are you our preceptor or teacher?”

original: mi byed do //
analyzed: mi byed do //
translated: “We won’t do it.”

original: des glen pa dag khyed gzhan ci zhig byed ces de dag las gcig la brdeg par gzas pa dang / de dag thams cad kyis bdag cag la brdeg par gzas so //
analyzed: des glen pa dag khyed gzhan ci zhig byed ces de dag las gcig la brdeg par gzas pa dang / de dag thams cad kyis bdag cag la brdeg par gzas so //
translated: The fool thought, They're all going to beat me up! and he went to beat up one of them.🔽All of them fell to the ground and began to cry, saying, He's going to beat us up!

original: bdag cag la brdeg par gzas so zhes phyi rgan du 'gyel te du bar brtsams so //
analyzed: bdag cag la brdeg par gzas so zhes phyi rgan du 'gyel te du bar brtsams so //
translated: He's going to beat us up!

original: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The monks asked,

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka ci'i phyir gzhon nu dag la brdeg par gzas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka ci'i phyir gzhon nu dag la brdeg par gzas /
translated: Venerable Udayi, why did you go to beat up those young men?

original: 'char kas smras pa tshe dang ldan pa dag kho bos gcig la brdeg par gzas pa dang / thams cad sa la 'gyel te du'o //
analyzed: 'char kas smras pa tshe dang ldan pa dag kho bos gcig la brdeg par gzas pa dang / thams cad sa la 'gyel te du'o //
translated: Udayi said, Venerables, when I went to beat up one of them, all of them fell to the ground and cried.

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcu bdun sde dag la smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcu bdun sde dag la smras pa /
translated: The monks said to the group of seventeen,

original: tshe dang ldan pa khyed cag las gcig la brdeg par gzas na ci'i phyir thams cad sa la 'gyel te ngu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa khyed cag las gcig la brdeg par gzas na ci'i phyir thams cad sa la 'gyel te ngu /
translated: Venerable ones, why did all of you fall to the ground and cry when he went to beat up one of you?

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said, Venerables, we're not crying because he beat us up.

original: gal te ma dus na gang cis brdeg gtol med do zhes zer nas dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas dge slong la brdeg par gzas par byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: gal te ma dus na gang cis brdeg gtol med do zhes zer nas dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas dge slong la brdeg par gzas par byed ces smod par byed /
translated: They criticized him,

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /🔽kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed / kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: and spread it about, saying,🔽“How could a monk do such a thing?”🔽The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.🔽The Blessed One assembled the saṅgha of monks and questioned the monk Udayi:

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /🔽'char ka la rmas nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de / 'char ka la rmas nas /
translated: “Is it true, Udayi, that you did such a thing?”

original: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun @190a * //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun @190a * //
translated: “It is not the way of a śramaṇa,

original: pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not the Dharma,

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: it is not the self-control,🔽it is not the precepts and observances,🔽it is not the way of life of a śramaṇa,

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: to do such a thing.”

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Having seen the ten benefits of establishing the training rules, I declare to my disciples that the basis of the training in the monastic code should be established in this way.

original: yang dge slong gang khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas dge slong la brdeg par gzas na tha na thal mos kyang rung ste ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas dge slong la brdeg par gzas na tha na thal mos kyang rung ste ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: “Any monk who, out of anger, irritation, and resentment, and with a mind of ill will, threatens a monk, even with his hand, commits an offense entailing suspension.”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /🔽gang zag ni 'char ka / nyon mongs pa ni zhe sdang gi kun du sbyor ba /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod / gang zag ni 'char ka / nyon mongs pa ni zhe sdang gi kun du sbyor ba /
translated: The location is Śrāvastī.🔽The person is a monk.🔽The basis is threatening a monk.

original: nyes pa ni dge slong la brdeg par gzas pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge slong la brdeg par gzas pa'o //
translated: The offense is a serious one.

original: de la yang dag slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ka 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ka 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: “Any monk” means the monk Udayī or any other.

original: khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas zhes bya ba ni khros shing khro ba'i zil gyis non nas so //
analyzed: khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas zhes bya ba ni khros shing khro ba'i zil gyis non nas so //
translated: “Out of anger, irritation, and resentment, and with a mind of ill will” means being angry and overwhelmed by anger.

original: dge slong la zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa la'o //
analyzed: dge slong la zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa la'o //
translated: “A monk” means a follower of this doctrine.

original: brdeg par gzas na zhes bya ba ni brdeg par bshams na'o //
analyzed: brdeg par gzas na zhes bya ba ni brdeg par bshams na'o //
translated: “If he attacks” means if he prepares to strike.

original: tha na thal mos kyang ste zhes bya ba ni tha na thal lcag tsam gzas kyang rung ste'o //
analyzed: tha na thal mos kyang ste zhes bya ba ni tha na thal lcag tsam gzas kyang rung ste'o //
translated: “Even with his palm” means even if he prepares to strike with his open hand.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Offense” is as above.

original: de la ltung ba ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the offense here?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the offense is to be understood by the characteristics of the basic offense, the preparation, the preparation for the preparation, the non-offenses, the trainings, and the amendments.

original: sngar brdegs pa'i ltung byed bstan pa dang / 'dir gzas pa'i ltung byed bstan pa de gnyis kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'dra'o //
analyzed: sngar brdegs pa'i ltung byed bstan pa dang / 'dir gzas pa'i ltung byed bstan pa de gnyis kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'dra'o //
translated: The general characteristics of the previously explained offense of striking and the offense explained here of attacking are similar.

original: bye brag tu snga ma ni brdeg pa'i yul la rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: bye brag tu snga ma ni brdeg pa'i yul la rnam par gzhag go //
translated: In particular, the former is determined by the object of striking,

original: 'di ni brdeg par gzas pa'i yul la rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di ni brdeg par gzas pa'i yul la rnam par gzhag go //
translated: and the latter is determined by the object of attacking.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis rnyog pa can gyi sems nyid kyis dge slong pha rol la lus sam des 'phangs pa 'am de dang 'brel ba dag gang yang rung ba tha na rkang pa'i mthe bo'am yungs kar ram
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis rnyog pa can gyi sems nyid kyis dge slong pha rol la lus sam des 'phangs pa 'am de dang 'brel ba dag gang yang rung ba tha na rkang pa'i mthe bo'am yungs kar ram
translated: Here, the basic downfall is defined as follows: If a fully ordained monk, with a corrupt mind, threatens to strike another fully ordained monk, with anything, even a blade of grass, mustard seed, or a straw,

original: / rtsva dag gis brdeg par gzas na gzas pa tsam gyis rdzas re re la gzas pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / rtsva dag gis brdeg par gzas na gzas pa tsam gyis rdzas re re la gzas pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: he commits the actual basis of a serious transgression of the downfalls that require confession alone for each substance that he threatens to strike with.

original: rnyag pa can gyi sems khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te /
analyzed: rnyag pa can gyi sems khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te /
translated: If he is corrupt, angry, and furious,

original: yi ma rang ba gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: yi ma rang ba gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: he commits no offense if he threatens to strike someone who is not a fully ordained monk.

original: dge slong pha rol pos brdeg par gzas pa chos 'di pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa ma nyams pa mtshan dang lta ba mthun pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong pha rol pos brdeg par gzas pa chos 'di pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa ma nyams pa mtshan dang lta ba mthun pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: He commits no offense if he threatens to strike a fully ordained monk who is not a member of the same Buddhist order, who has damaged his vows, or whose views are not in accord with his own.

original: lus sam ma des 'phangs @190b pa 'am /
analyzed: lus sam ma des 'phangs @190b pa 'am /
translated: He commits no offense if he threatens to strike with his body, or with something projected from his body,

original: de dang 'brel pa dag gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa dag gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no blame in any of these cases.

original: lus zhes bya ba ni nang gi zin pa ste sor mo gcig gam gnyis sam /🔽gsum dang / bzhi dang / lnga 'am /
analyzed: lus zhes bya ba ni nang gi zin pa ste sor mo gcig gam gnyis sam / gsum dang / bzhi dang / lnga 'am /
translated: The body is the internal object, such as a finger, two fingers, three fingers, four fingers, five fingers,🔽a fist, an elbow, a shoulder, a head, a chest, a back, a thigh, a knee, a foot, etc.

original: khu tshur dang / gru mo dang / phrag pa dang / mgo dang / glo dang / rgyab dang / brla dag pus mo dang / rje bar la sogs pa'o //🔽des 'phangs pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du 'phangs pa ste /🔽mda' dang lcags mda' dang / mnga' phyed lcags las byas pa dang / mde'u ste'u kha dang / mde'u be'u'i so lta bu dang / mde'u zur bzhi ma dang / mde'u ka ra bi ra'i 'dab ma lta bu dang / mde'u bye'u snying ma dang /
analyzed: khu tshur dang / gru mo dang / phrag pa dang / mgo dang / glo dang / rgyab dang / brla dag pus mo dang / rje bar la sogs pa'o // des 'phangs pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du 'phangs pa ste / mda' dang lcags mda' dang / mnga' phyed lcags las byas pa dang / mde'u ste'u kha dang / mde'u be'u'i so lta bu dang / mde'u zur bzhi ma dang / mde'u ka ra bi ra'i 'dab ma lta bu dang / mde'u bye'u snying ma dang /
translated: The external object is what is thrown, such as an arrow, a spear, a javelin, a dart, a stone, a club, a wheel, a thunderbolt, a sword, a knife, a stick, a pebble, etc.🔽The internal object is what is cut, such as a finger, two fingers, three fingers, four fingers, five fingers,🔽a fist, an elbow, a shoulder, a head, a chest, a back, a thigh, a knee, a foot, etc.🔽The external object is what cuts, such as an arrow, a spear, a javelin, a dart, a stone, a club, a wheel, a thunderbolt, a sword, a knife, a stick, a pebble, etc.🔽The internal object is what is burned, such as a finger, two fingers, three fingers, four fingers, five fingers,

original: 'khor lo dang / rdo rje rtse gcig pa dang / mnga' bo che dang mtshon rtse gcig pa dang / rgya shug gi tshi gu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo dang / rdo rje rtse gcig pa dang / mnga' bo che dang mtshon rtse gcig pa dang / rgya shug gi tshi gu la sogs pa'o //
translated: a fist, an elbow, a shoulder, a head, a chest, a back, a thigh, a knee, a foot, etc.🔽The external object is what burns, such as a fire, a torch, a pile of straw, a pile of chaff, a pile of cow-dung, a pile of grass, a pile of wood, etc.

original: de dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni de gnyi ga dang ldan bas te ral gri dang / shang lang dang / ral gri so gcig pa dang / gral gri so gnyis pa dang / mdung dang / 'phang mdud dang / chu gri dang / rtsva'i nyag ma dang /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni de gnyi ga dang ldan bas te ral gri dang / shang lang dang / ral gri so gcig pa dang / gral gri so gnyis pa dang / mdung dang / 'phang mdud dang / chu gri dang / rtsva'i nyag ma dang /
translated: “In connection with that” means that both are present, such as a sword, a knife, a single-edged razor, a double-edged razor, a spear, a javelin, a water knife, a blade of grass,

original: thur ma'i thag pa dang / thag pa'i chun po la sogs pas so //
analyzed: thur ma'i thag pa dang / thag pa'i chun po la sogs pas so //
translated: a rope for a spade, a bundle of ropes, and so on.

original: de gsum gyi mtha' bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de gsum gyi mtha' bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the limit of those three,

original: tha na rkang pa'i mthe bo 'am yungs kar ram /🔽rtsva dag gis brdeg par gzas na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: tha na rkang pa'i mthe bo 'am yungs kar ram / rtsva dag gis brdeg par gzas na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “at the very least, a toe, a mustard seed,🔽or a blade of grass.”

original: nang gi zin pa tha na rkang pa'i mthe bo 'am /
analyzed: nang gi zin pa tha na rkang pa'i mthe bo 'am /
translated: “At the very least” means that internally, it is a toe,

original: phyi rol du 'phangs pa than yungs kar ram /
analyzed: phyi rol du 'phangs pa than yungs kar ram /
translated: externally, it is a mustard seed,

original: de gnyi ga dang ldan pa tha na rtsva dag gis brdeg par gzas sam /
analyzed: de gnyi ga dang ldan pa tha na rtsva dag gis brdeg par gzas sam /
translated: and both of those together is at the very least a blade of grass.

original: de bas kyang ches chung pa'i dngos pos brdeg par gzas na yang ltung ba la smad pa med do //
analyzed: de bas kyang ches chung pa'i dngos pos brdeg par gzas na yang ltung ba la smad pa med do //
translated: Even if one threatens to strike with something smaller than that, there is no fault in the downfall.

original: ci brdeg par gzas pa'i 'og tu gang gi tshe bsnun cing phog par gyur pa de'i tshe na dngos gzhir ro //
analyzed: ci brdeg par gzas pa'i 'og tu gang gi tshe bsnun cing phog par gyur pa de'i tshe na dngos gzhir ro //
translated: When one is struck after having been threatened, then it is the actual basis.

original: 'on te brdeg par gzas pa'i tshe nyid na zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te brdeg par gzas pa'i tshe nyid na zhe na /
translated: But if it is at the time of the threat itself,

original: de'i phyir gzas pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzas pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: then it is said, “there is no offense if he is threatened, but not struck.”

original: de dag gis lus la sogs pa la brdeg par gzas pa tsam la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de dag gis lus la sogs pa la brdeg par gzas pa tsam la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if he is threatened but not struck with the body, etc.

original: ci gzas pa'i spyad mang po nyid yin na yang ltung byed gcig tu 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci gzas pa'i spyad mang po nyid yin na yang ltung byed gcig tu 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: But if there are many threats, is there only one offense of wrong conduct?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.🔽🔽

original: de'i phyir rdzas re re la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rdzas re re la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: therefore it says, “for each substance.”

original: gzas par bya ba'i rdzas re re la ltung byed re rer 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzas par bya ba'i rdzas re re la ltung byed re rer 'gyur te /
translated: For each substance that is threatened, there is one offense of wrong conduct.

original: sor mo re re la ltung byed re re dang / yungs kar 'bru re re la ltung byed ra re dang / rtsva nyag ma re re la ltung byed re re 'gyur pa lta bu la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: sor mo re re la ltung byed re re dang / yungs kar 'bru re re la ltung byed ra re dang / rtsva nyag ma re re la ltung byed re re 'gyur pa lta bu la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if there is one offense of wrong conduct for each finger, one offense of wrong conduct for each mustard seed, and one offense of wrong conduct for each blade of grass.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni pha rol po brdeg par gzas pa dge slong nyid dang / gzas pa'i rdzas gang yang rung ba ji snyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni pha rol po brdeg par gzas pa dge slong nyid dang / gzas pa'i rdzas gang yang rung ba ji snyed pa'o //
translated: The agent is the monk who is the aggressor, and the object of the aggression is any of the things that are to be struck.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te //
translated: Here, the actual basis is a downfall by five factors:

original: rnyog pa can gyi sems nyid dang / pha rol @191a * //
analyzed: rnyog pa can gyi sems nyid dang / pha rol @191a * //
translated: the mind is disturbed,🔽the monk is the aggressor,

original: po brdeg par gzas pa'i dge slong nyid dang / gzas pa lus sam des 'phangs pa 'am /🔽de dang 'brel pa gang yang rung ba dang / gzas pa'i rdzas tha na rkang pa'i mthe bo 'am /
analyzed: po brdeg par gzas pa'i dge slong nyid dang / gzas pa lus sam des 'phangs pa 'am / de dang 'brel pa gang yang rung ba dang / gzas pa'i rdzas tha na rkang pa'i mthe bo 'am /
translated: the object of the aggression is any of the things that are to be struck,

original: yungs kar ram rtsva bas chung ba gang yang rung ba dang / than gzas par brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: yungs kar ram rtsva bas chung ba gang yang rung ba dang / than gzas par brtsams pa'o //
translated: the object of the aggression is any of the things that are to be struck, even if it is as small as a toe, a mustard seed, or a blade of grass,🔽and the aggression is initiated.

original: de dag las yan lag mtshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag mtshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors is missing, then the downfall is a serious transgression.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ji srid du gzas pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ji srid du gzas pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor infraction as long as the preparation for the actual basis of the downfall of aggression has been initiated, but the actual basis has not been reached, it is a minor infraction.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For the actual basis, for each of the various different preparations that are undertaken, there is one offense of wrong conduct.

original: rnyog pa can gyi sems khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te /
analyzed: rnyog pa can gyi sems khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te /
translated: If one is in an agitated state of mind, angry, upset, and furious,

original: yi ma rangs pa nyid med pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: yi ma rangs pa nyid med pa la nyes byas so //
translated: but not displeased, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: pha rol pos brdeg par gzas pa dge slong nyams pa dang / ma chags pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: pha rol pos brdeg par gzas pa dge slong nyams pa dang / ma chags pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the other person is about to strike a degenerate monk or one who is free of attachment, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong ma dang chos 'di pa'i rab tu byung ba pho mos bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong ma dang chos 'di pa'i rab tu byung ba pho mos bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the other person is a nun or a male or female novice of this Buddhist tradition who has not completed the approach to the vows, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba dang khyim pa mi'i 'gro ba pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba dang khyim pa mi'i 'gro ba pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the other person is a renunciate of another religion or a layperson who is a human being, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba dang / dud 'gro la nyes byas na smad do //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba dang / dud 'gro la nyes byas na smad do //
translated: If the other person is a nonhuman being or an animal, it is a minor offense.

original: rang la brdeg par gzas na nyes byas so //
analyzed: rang la brdeg par gzas na nyes byas so //
translated: If the other person is about to strike oneself, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ka ba dang rtsig pa dang sa dang shing ljon pa dang gzhan la yang brdeg par gzas na nyes byas so //
analyzed: ka ba dang rtsig pa dang sa dang shing ljon pa dang gzhan la yang brdeg par gzas na nyes byas so //
translated: If the other person is about to strike a pillar, a wall, the ground, a tree, or something else, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The offense of preparation is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ci snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ci snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many preparations as there are, there are that many preparations of preparation.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation of a preparation is also a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni brnangs pa bsal ba dang / thal lcag gi rig sngags sgrub par gzas pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni brnangs pa bsal ba dang / thal lcag gi rig sngags sgrub par gzas pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is clearing away a choking sensation, or if one is reciting a spell for the sake of a slap.

original: dgos pa'i dbang gis shing gshegs pa dang sa brdung ba la sogs par gzas pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dgos pa'i dbang gis shing gshegs pa dang sa brdung ba la sogs par gzas pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is striking a tree or the ground for the sake of a purpose.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for a beginner, or for one who is insane, deranged, or in pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du gzas pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du gzas pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule is that a monk should train in not engaging in all forms of striking in all situations.

original: brdeg par gzas pa gzhan yin la //
analyzed: brdeg par gzas pa gzhan yin la //
translated: Striking is one thing,

original: gzhan dang gzhan la brdeg par gzas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan la brdeg par gzas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not aim to strike another and another.

original: ka ba la brdeg par gzas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ka ba la brdeg par gzas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not aim to strike a pillar.

original: rtsig pa dang sa dang shing ljon pa dang / sgo glegs la sogs pa gzhan la yang brdeg par gzas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rtsig pa dang sa dang shing ljon pa dang / sgo glegs la sogs pa gzhan la yang brdeg par gzas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not aim to strike a wall, the ground, a tree, a door, a doorsill, or anything else.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is as before.

original: gzas pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu dgu pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: gzas pa'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu dgu pa bshad zin to /
translated: The forty-ninth downfall in the class of offenses that require confession alone has been explained.

original: // / @191b gnas ngan len 'chab ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: // / @191b gnas ngan len 'chab ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin of the downfall of concealing evil deeds: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: dga' bo la lhan cig gnas pa'i dge slong chos zhes bya ba ngo tsha shes pa /
analyzed: dga' bo la lhan cig gnas pa'i dge slong chos zhes bya ba ngo tsha shes pa /
translated: A monk named Dharma, a fellow student of Nanda, was ashamed of his evil deeds.

original: 'gyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: He was remorseful.

original: bsdams pa / bslab pa 'dod pa zhig yod pa des ci srid du de gnas ngan len de kun du spyod par mi shes pa de srid du de dang lhan cig gnas so //
analyzed: bsdams pa / bslab pa 'dod pa zhig yod pa des ci srid du de gnas ngan len de kun du spyod par mi shes pa de srid du de dang lhan cig gnas so //
translated: The one who is restrained, who desires the training, lives with him as long as he does not know that he is engaging in misconduct.

original: gang gi tshe des de gnas ngan len kun du spyod par shes pa de'i tshe na de rang bzhin du gnas pa'i dge slong rnams dang lhan cig gnas par brtsams te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe des de gnas ngan len kun du spyod par shes pa de'i tshe na de rang bzhin du gnas pa'i dge slong rnams dang lhan cig gnas par brtsams te /
translated: When he knows that he is engaging in misconduct, then he begins to live with the monks who are of a natural disposition.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' lung gis dus gsum du rkang pa la phyag 'tshal du 'gro ba 'ba' zhig byed do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' lung gis dus gsum du rkang pa la phyag 'tshal du 'gro ba 'ba' zhig byed do //
translated: By the word of the Blessed One, he goes three times a day to bow at his feet.

original: de dga' bo'i gan du song ste /
analyzed: de dga' bo'i gan du song ste /
translated: He goes to Nanda and says,

original: mkhan po gdugs la spyod du mchi'o zhes zhus pa dang / nye dgas de thos nas smras pa /
analyzed: mkhan po gdugs la spyod du mchi'o zhes zhus pa dang / nye dgas de thos nas smras pa /
translated: “Preceptor, I will go to live under the sunshade.” When Upagupta hears this, he says,🔽“

original: bu chos kho bo'i stan yang khyer la song shig / des de'i stan khyer te nyin mo spyod du song nas des de'i stan de shing ljon pa zhig gi drung du gzhag ste dben pa'i phyogs su 'dug nas yid la byed pa bskyed par brtsams pa dang /
analyzed: bu chos kho bo'i stan yang khyer la song shig / des de'i stan khyer te nyin mo spyod du song nas des de'i stan de shing ljon pa zhig gi drung du gzhag ste dben pa'i phyogs su 'dug nas yid la byed pa bskyed par brtsams pa dang /
translated: He took his seat and went out to walk during the day. He placed his seat at the foot of a tree and sat in a secluded place, and began to generate mental attention.

original: de'i 'og tu nye dga' 'ongs nas chos kyis smras pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu nye dga' 'ongs nas chos kyis smras pa /
translated: Later, Upasena came and Dharma said,🔽Master, your seat is at the foot of a tree, so go there and sit.

original: slob dpon gdan shing ljon pa'i drung du gzhag gi der bzhud la bzhugs shig / nye dga' der song nas mgo g-yogs te 'dug pa dang / der des mos pa ma rnyed nas stan las langs te phyogs bzhir rnam par blta bar brtsams pa dang /
analyzed: slob dpon gdan shing ljon pa'i drung du gzhag gi der bzhud la bzhugs shig / nye dga' der song nas mgo g-yogs te 'dug pa dang / der des mos pa ma rnyed nas stan las langs te phyogs bzhir rnam par blta bar brtsams pa dang /
translated: Upasena went there and sat with his head covered. Since he did not find inspiration there, he rose from his seat and began to look around in the four directions.

original: ci tsam na bu mo zhig rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi rib ma 'dral ba mthong nas /
analyzed: ci tsam na bu mo zhig rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi rib ma 'dral ba mthong nas /
translated: When he saw a girl opening the curtain of the Jetavana,

original: nye dga' song ste smras pa /
analyzed: nye dga' song ste smras pa /
translated: Upasena went and said,

original: bu mo khyod ci'i phyir rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi rib ma 'dral bar byed /
analyzed: bu mo khyod ci'i phyir rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi rib ma 'dral bar byed /
translated: Girl, why are you opening the curtain of the Jetavana?

original: bu mo des 'dzum phyung ba dang / nye dgas de'i yan lag dang nyid lag dag nas mnams te 'o byas nas /
analyzed: bu mo des 'dzum phyung ba dang / nye dgas de'i yan lag dang nyid lag dag nas mnams te 'o byas nas /
translated: The girl smiled and, with affection, she kissed her limbs and body.

original: des chos kyi gan du song ste dris pa /
analyzed: des chos kyi gan du song ste dris pa /
translated: She went to Dharmalabdha and asked,

original: bu chos khyod kyis cung zad mthong ngam /
analyzed: bu chos khyod kyis cung zad mthong ngam /
translated: “Son, have you seen anything at all?”

original: slob dpon gzhug 'jug pa 'ba' zhig ma gtogs pa gzhan thams cad mthong ngo //
analyzed: slob dpon gzhug 'jug pa 'ba' zhig ma gtogs pa gzhan thams cad mthong ngo //
translated: “I have seen everything except for the master’s entry and exit.”

original: bu chos su la yang ma zer cig / slob dpon ji srid du rang bzhin du gnas pa'i dge slong ma mthong ba de srid kyi bar du su la yang mi mchi'o //
analyzed: bu chos su la yang ma zer cig / slob dpon ji srid du rang bzhin du gnas pa'i dge slong ma mthong ba de srid kyi bar du su la yang mi mchi'o //
translated: “Son, don’t tell anyone. I will not go to anyone until I see a fully ordained nun who is naturally good.”

original: nye dgas smras pa /🔽kho bo khyod kyi mkhan po'i gnas ngan len gyi ltung ba 'chab par byed na khyod kho bo'i 'chab par mi byed dam /
analyzed: nye dgas smras pa / kho bo khyod kyi mkhan po'i gnas ngan len gyi ltung ba 'chab par byed na khyod kho bo'i 'chab par mi byed dam /
translated: Upatiṣya said,🔽“I will conceal your master’s downfall of a lapse in discipline. Will you conceal mine?”

original: sleb dpon khyod 'chab par mdzad kyang bdag gis 'chab par mi bgyid do zhes zer ba'i skabs de @192a * //
analyzed: sleb dpon khyod 'chab par mdzad kyang bdag gis 'chab par mi bgyid do zhes zer ba'i skabs de @192a * //
translated: “Master, even if you conceal it, I will not.”

original: dge slong rnams la brjod pa dang / dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag shes bzhin du dge slong gi gnas ngan len gyi ltung ba 'chab par byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la brjod pa dang / dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag shes bzhin du dge slong gi gnas ngan len gyi ltung ba 'chab par byed ces smod par byed /
translated: and the monks who had few desires complained and criticized those monks, “Why do the monks knowingly conceal the downfalls of other monks?”

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed //
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed //
translated: They disparaged them,

original: bzer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: bzer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: and the monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having assembled the saṅgha of monks with this account and this basis and this cause,

original: nye dga' la rmas nas /🔽dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
analyzed: nye dga' la rmas nas / dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
translated: asked Upāli,🔽“Monks, is it true that you did this?”🔽“It is true, Blessed One.”🔽The Blessed One rebuked them,🔽“Foolish men, this is not fitting for ascetics,🔽this is not fitting for renunciants,

original: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: this is not fitting for those with a sense of modesty,

original: rung ba ma yin pa /🔽tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /🔽tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: this is not right,🔽this is not to be done.”

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Having seen the ten benefits of establishing the training rules, he said, “My disciples, you should recite this training rule:

original: yang dge slong gang shes bzhin du dge slong gi gnas ngan len gyi ltung ba 'chab na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang shes bzhin du dge slong gi gnas ngan len gyi ltung ba 'chab na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘If a monk knowingly conceals a monk’s downfall of wrong conduct, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni nye dga'/
analyzed: gang zag ni nye dga'/
translated: The person was Nyagrodha.

original: nyon mongs pa ni nyes pa brtsams pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni nyes pa brtsams pa /
translated: The affliction was the commission of an offense.

original: nyes pa ni shes bzhin du dge slong gi gnas ngan len 'chab pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni shes bzhin du dge slong gi gnas ngan len 'chab pa'o //
translated: The offense was knowingly concealing a monk’s downfall of wrong conduct.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: As to “a monk,” it refers to Nyagrodha, a son of the Śākyas, or any other monk.

original: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de rang nyid kyis rig par 'gyur ba'am gzhan dag gis brjod pa'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de rang nyid kyis rig par 'gyur ba'am gzhan dag gis brjod pa'o //
translated: As to “knowingly,” it means that he himself knows or that others tell him.

original: dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
translated: As to “a monk,” it means a follower of this doctrine.

original: gnas ngan len gyi ltung byed ces bya ba ni gnas ngan len gnyis te /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi ltung byed ces bya ba ni gnas ngan len gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of degeneration:

original: pham par 'gyur ba kun nas slong ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma kun nas slong ba'o //
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba kun nas slong ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma kun nas slong ba'o //
translated: degeneration that is the motivation for a defeating offense, and degeneration that is the motivation for a serious offense.

original: ci'i phyir de dag gnas ngan len ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag gnas ngan len ces bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called “degeneration”?

original: ngo bo nyid las dang / kun nas slong ba las so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las dang / kun nas slong ba las so //
translated: Because of their nature and because of their motivation.

original: 'chab na zhes bya ba ni mkhyud na'o //
analyzed: 'chab na zhes bya ba ni mkhyud na'o //
translated: “If he conceals it” means if he hides it.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “A downfall” is as above.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the downfall here?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the characteristics of the downfall, the absence of a downfall, the training, and the restoration should be understood through the main part, the preparation, and the preparation of the preparation, as above.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis shes bzhin du dge slong gi pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba 'chab na bde ba la mi reg pa dang / dge sbyong gi tshul dang /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis shes bzhin du dge slong gi pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba 'chab na bde ba la mi reg pa dang / dge sbyong gi tshul dang /
translated: Here, the actual basis of a downfall is as follows: If a fully ordained monk knowingly conceals a downfall of a fellow monk that is a defeating offense or a partial defeat, he will not be able to attain bliss,🔽will create an obstacle to the practice of pure conduct, and will cause the Saṅgha to be disturbed.

original: tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad dang / dge @192b 'dun 'khrug tu dogs pa'i dbang nyid ma gtogs pa nyin mtshan gcig gi skya rengs dang po shar ba'i mthar gnas ngan len 'chab pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //🔽dge slong gis pha rol po pham par 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad dang / dge @192b 'dun 'khrug tu dogs pa'i dbang nyid ma gtogs pa nyin mtshan gcig gi skya rengs dang po shar ba'i mthar gnas ngan len 'chab pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro // dge slong gis pha rol po pham par 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: Except in the case of a powerful person, the actual basis of the downfall of concealing evil is reached at the end of the first dawn of the day and night.🔽If a fully ordained monk conceals a fellow monk’s downfall that is a defeating offense or a partial defeat,

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba nyid la der 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za bzhin du 'chab pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba nyid la der 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za bzhin du 'chab pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: there is no fault in concealing it if he is unsure whether the other monk has committed the downfall or if he is unsure whether it is a defeating offense or a partial defeat.

original: bdag la de ma bcabs pa'i gzhi 'dis bde ba la mi reg pa'i dbang nyid dang / dge sbyong gi tshul gyi bar chad kyi dbang nyid dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad kyi dbang nyid dang / dge 'dun 'khrug tu dogs pa'i dbang nyid ma gtogs par dge slong gi pham par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: bdag la de ma bcabs pa'i gzhi 'dis bde ba la mi reg pa'i dbang nyid dang / dge sbyong gi tshul gyi bar chad kyi dbang nyid dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad kyi dbang nyid dang / dge 'dun 'khrug tu dogs pa'i dbang nyid ma gtogs par dge slong gi pham par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: There is no offense for a monk who conceals a defeat or a serious offense, except when it is a matter of not touching bliss,🔽or a matter of obstructing the way of life of a spiritual practitioner, or a matter of obstructing pure conduct, or a matter of fearing a schism in the community.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba 'chab pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba 'chab pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense for concealing a defeat or a serious offense.

original: de dag gi dbang gis bcabs pa la ni ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi dbang gis bcabs pa la ni ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no offense for concealing them when it is a matter of those.

original: de la bde ba la mi reg pa'i dbang nyid ces bya ba ni gal te de ma bcabs pa'i gzhi des bdag nyid la srog gi bar chad la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de la bde ba la mi reg pa'i dbang nyid ces bya ba ni gal te de ma bcabs pa'i gzhi des bdag nyid la srog gi bar chad la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Among them, “a matter of not touching bliss” means that if one conceals the basis, suffering such as an obstacle to life will arise for oneself.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul gyi bar chad kyi dbang nyid ces bya ba ni gal te de ma bcabs pa'i gzhi des bdag la 'phags pa'i lam gyi bar chad 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul gyi bar chad kyi dbang nyid ces bya ba ni gal te de ma bcabs pa'i gzhi des bdag la 'phags pa'i lam gyi bar chad 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The power of being an obstacle to the way of virtuous endeavor means that if, because of that ground of concealment, an obstacle to the path of the noble ones would arise for oneself.

original: tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad kyi dbang nyid ces bya ba ni gal te de ma bcabs pa'i gzhi des de dag la tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad kyi dbang nyid ces bya ba ni gal te de ma bcabs pa'i gzhi des de dag la tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The power of being an obstacle to pure conduct means that if, because of that ground of concealment, an obstacle to pure conduct would arise for them.

original: dge 'dun 'khrug tu dogs pa'i dbang nyid ces bya ba ni gal te de ma bcabs pa'i gzhi des dge 'dun dbye ba dang / dge 'dun 'khod pa dang / dge 'dun gnyis su 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun tha dad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun 'khrug tu dogs pa'i dbang nyid ces bya ba ni gal te de ma bcabs pa'i gzhi des dge 'dun dbye ba dang / dge 'dun 'khod pa dang / dge 'dun gnyis su 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun tha dad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The power of fearing a schism in the Saṅgha means that if, because of that ground of concealment, a schism in the Saṅgha would occur, or if the Saṅgha would be divided, or if the Saṅgha would become two, or if the Saṅgha would become separate.

original: nyin mtshan gcig gi skya rengs dang po shar ba'i mthar 'chab pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: nyin mtshan gcig gi skya rengs dang po shar ba'i mthar 'chab pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no blame for concealing for one day and night up to the first dawn.

original: de yang gang zag gi gzhi 'khor dang bcas pa'i skabs nas de'i mod la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na gnas pa yod bzhin du 'chab pa'i sems bskyed🔽de / ci srid du skya rengs shar ba'i bar du mi mthol ba la dngos gzhir rnam par gzhag go //🔽de'i mod la gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag de lta bu med na skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //🔽ji srid du gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du skya rengs shar kyang ma mthol ba @193a * //
analyzed: de yang gang zag gi gzhi 'khor dang bcas pa'i skabs nas de'i mod la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na gnas pa yod bzhin du 'chab pa'i sems bskyed de / ci srid du skya rengs shar ba'i bar du mi mthol ba la dngos gzhir rnam par gzhag go // de'i mod la gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag de lta bu med na skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do // ji srid du gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du skya rengs shar kyang ma mthol ba @193a * //
translated: Further, if the person who is to confess the offense is a fully ordained monk who naturally remains in the vows, who is in the same boundaries, who has the same view and the same characteristics as the one who is to confess, and who is present, then the offense is considered to be a root downfall as long as the monk does not confess it.🔽If there is no such person to whom the monk can confess, then there is no offense of concealment until dawn.

original: la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: As long as the monk does not find a person to whom he can confess, there is no offense of concealment even if dawn has already broken.

original: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag med na ji srid du gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du mthol ba'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag med na ji srid du gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du mthol ba'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: If there is no person to whom one should confess, then as long as one does not find a person to whom one should confess, one has no thought of confessing, and there is no fault of concealment.

original: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang rkyen 'ga' zhig gis bdag nyid 'gro ba'i skabs med dam /
analyzed: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang rkyen 'ga' zhig gis bdag nyid 'gro ba'i skabs med dam /
translated: Even if there is a person to whom one should confess, if one does not have the opportunity to go to them because of some circumstance,

original: bdag nyid gnas de nas gzhan du song bar gyur na de'i bar du mthol ba'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid gnas de nas gzhan du song bar gyur na de'i bar du mthol ba'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: or if one goes from that place to another, as long as one does not have the thought of confessing, there is no fault of concealment.

original: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang ltung ba yod pa de 'di snyam du gal te de'i gan du song ba ma brjod na 'chab pa'i nyes par 'gyur du dogs pas de'i dbang gis der mi 'gro 'am gzhan du song bas brjod par
analyzed: gang la mthol bar bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang ltung ba yod pa de 'di snyam du gal te de'i gan du song ba ma brjod na 'chab pa'i nyes par 'gyur du dogs pas de'i dbang gis der mi 'gro 'am gzhan du song bas brjod par
translated: Even if there is a person to whom one should confess, if one has a downfall, if one does not go to them out of fear of the fault of concealment, or if one does not confess because one has gone elsewhere,

original: ma byas pa la yang 'chab ba'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ma byas pa la yang 'chab ba'i nyes pa med do //
translated: there is no fault of concealment.

original: rkyen cis kyang ma bskal ba'i bar de'i gan du mi 'gro ba dang / skya rengs kyi mdun rol du mi mthol ba dang / 'chab pa'i sems bskyed pa dag ni nyes byas su 'gyur la skya rengs dang po shar ba'i mthar ni dngos gzhir 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa 'am bye brag gzhan dag kyang skabs 'dir shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rkyen cis kyang ma bskal ba'i bar de'i gan du mi 'gro ba dang / skya rengs kyi mdun rol du mi mthol ba dang / 'chab pa'i sems bskyed pa dag ni nyes byas su 'gyur la skya rengs dang po shar ba'i mthar ni dngos gzhir 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa 'am bye brag gzhan dag kyang skabs 'dir shes par bya'o //
translated: If one does not go to the presence of the preceptor or instructor before dawn, if one does not confess before dawn, and if one generates a thought of concealment, then one commits an offense of wrong conduct. At the end of the first dawn, it becomes the actual basis.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge slong gzhan gyi pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge slong gzhan gyi pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma'i ltung ba byung ba nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The agent of this is a fully ordained monk who has committed a defeating offense or a serious violation of the monastic code.

original: 'di la yan ldas las dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan ldas las dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: This has five parts:

original: dge slong gzhan gyi pham par 'gyur ba 'am dge 'dun lhag ma kun nas slong ba'i gnas ngan len byung ba nyid dang / der 'du shes pa dang / 'chab pa dang / bdag la gzhi des bde ba la mi reg pa dang / dge sbyong gi tshul dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad dang /
analyzed: dge slong gzhan gyi pham par 'gyur ba 'am dge 'dun lhag ma kun nas slong ba'i gnas ngan len byung ba nyid dang / der 'du shes pa dang / 'chab pa dang / bdag la gzhi des bde ba la mi reg pa dang / dge sbyong gi tshul dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad dang /
translated: It is a downfall if one has the negative tendency to commit a defeating offense or a partially defeating offense of a fully ordained monk, and if one perceives that, conceals it, does not regard it as a basis for not being comfortable, and does not regard it as an obstacle to the life of a renunciate or to pure conduct.

original: dge 'dun 'khrug tu dogs pa'i dbang nyid ma gtogs pa dang / nyin mtshan gyi mthar thug pa'o //🔽de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //🔽sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /🔽ji srid du gnas ngan len 'chab pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so ;🔽/ dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
