analyzed: gang gi tshe de'i lus las mdangs yal ba de'i tshe na glos phab ste nyal ba dang / dge slong rnams kyis de la smras pa /
translated: But when his body was emaciated, he lay down to rest. The monks said to him,

original: tshe dang ldan pa chos gal te zan gzhan gyi yin zhes te lto yang gzhan gyi yin nam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa chos gal te zan gzhan gyi yin zhes te lto yang gzhan gyi yin nam /
translated: “Venerable Dṛḍha, if the food is someone else’s, is the stomach also someone else’s?”

original: ji na ci tsam gyis dge ba'i phyogs la tron byed kyang mi nus pa de tsam gyi zan zos so //
analyzed: ji na ci tsam gyis dge ba'i phyogs la tron byed kyang mi nus pa de tsam gyi zan zos so //
translated: “I ate as much as I could, but I was not able to practice virtue.”

original: sus zos / khyod kyis ma zos sam /
analyzed: sus zos / khyod kyis ma zos sam /
translated: “Who ate it? Didn’t you eat it?”

original: ma zos so ci'i phyir /
analyzed: ma zos so ci'i phyir /
translated: “I didn’t eat it.” “Why not?”

original: des skabs de rgyas par brjod pa dang / dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag ched du bsams te dge slong gi zan gcod du 'jug ces smod par byed /
analyzed: des skabs de rgyas par brjod pa dang / dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag ched du bsams te dge slong gi zan gcod du 'jug ces smod par byed /
translated: and the monks with few desires complained, “Why do monks make other monks fast on purpose?”

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: They criticized him,🔽and spread it about, saying, “How could a monk do this?”

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported the matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /🔽nye dga' la rmas nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de / nye dga' la rmas nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, in this connection, in this context, assembled the community of monks and asked Venerable Upāli,🔽“Upāli, is it true that a monk did this?”

original: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
translated: “It’s not suitable for a monk to do this.

original: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: It’s not proper.🔽It’s not right.

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: It’s not pure.🔽It’s not to be done.”

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: He criticized him in many ways and then asked the monks,

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Having seen the ten benefits of establishing the training rules, my disciples, you should recite this basis of the training for the monastic code:

original: yang dge slong gang klan ka tshol zhing ci nas kyang dge slong 'di la klan ka btsal bar 'gyur ro snyam pa de nyid rkyen du byas te /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang klan ka tshol zhing ci nas kyang dge slong 'di la klan ka btsal bar 'gyur ro snyam pa de nyid rkyen du byas te /
translated: ‘If a monk searches for an offense, thinking, “I will search for an offense so that this monk is accused,”

original: dge slong dag la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa tshur shog khyim dag tu 'dod dang // der khyed la bca' ba dang bza' ba bsod pa ci tsam 'dod pa sbyin du gzhug go zhes smras nas des de la sbyin du ma bcug @195a * //
analyzed: dge slong dag la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa tshur shog khyim dag tu 'dod dang // der khyed la bca' ba dang bza' ba bsod pa ci tsam 'dod pa sbyin du gzhug go zhes smras nas des de la sbyin du ma bcug @195a * //
translated: and then says to the monks, “Venerables, come! Let’s go to the houses. There we will give you as much fresh and cooked food as you like,” and if, after not having given him the opportunity to receive,

original: par de'i 'og tu 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa kho bo khyod dang lhan cig smra'am 'dug pa bde ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: par de'i 'og tu 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa kho bo khyod dang lhan cig smra'am 'dug pa bde ba ma yin gyi /
translated: he then says, “Venerables, it is not pleasant for me to talk or sit with you.

original: 'di ltar kho bo gcig pu kho na smra'am 'dug na bdes khyod song shig ces zer na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo gcig pu kho na smra'am 'dug na bdes khyod song shig ces zer na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: If you say, I am not the only one who speaks this way, then you should say, Go away, you who are not a monk!

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni nye dga'/
analyzed: gang zag ni nye dga'/
translated: The person was Upasena.

original: nyon mongs pa ni zhe dku /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni zhe dku /
translated: The affliction was anger.

original: nyes pa ni ched du bsams te dge slong gi zan gcod du 'jud pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni ched du bsams te dge slong gi zan gcod du 'jud pa'o //
translated: The fault was intentionally causing a monk to miss a meal.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am /
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am /
translated: In this case, monk means the Śākya son Upasena,

original: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: or anyone else like him.

original: klan ka tshol zhing ci nas kyang dge slong 'di la klan ka btsal bar 'gyur ro snyam pa zhes bya ba ni ji nas kyang dge slong 'di zan gcod du 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam pa'o //
analyzed: klan ka tshol zhing ci nas kyang dge slong 'di la klan ka btsal bar 'gyur ro snyam pa zhes bya ba ni ji nas kyang dge slong 'di zan gcod du 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam pa'o //
translated: Seeking an opportunity, thinking, How can I find an opportunity to accuse this monk? means thinking, How can I cause this monk to miss a meal?

original: de nyid rkyen du byas te zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rkyen du byas te zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin pa'o //
translated: Taking that as the reason means not otherwise.

original: dge slong la zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong la zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
translated: To a monk means to one who belongs to this Dharma.

original: 'di skad ces bya ba ni 'di skad ces smras nas so //
analyzed: 'di skad ces bya ba ni 'di skad ces smras nas so //
translated: This is what was said means this is what was spoken.

original: tshe dang ldan pa tshur shog khyim dag tu 'dod dang zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim dag tu'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa tshur shog khyim dag tu 'dod dang zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim dag tu'o //
translated: Come here, Venerable! means Come to the houses of brahmins and householders.

original: der khyod la bca' ba dang bza' ba bsod pa zhes bya ba ni bca' ba lnga po dang / bza' ba lnga po dag go //
analyzed: der khyod la bca' ba dang bza' ba bsod pa zhes bya ba ni bca' ba lnga po dang / bza' ba lnga po dag go //
translated: Delicious food and drink means the five cooked foods and the five drinks.

original: ci tsam 'dod pa sbyin du gzhug go zhes smras nas zhes bya ba ni ji tsam gyis chog pa'o //
analyzed: ci tsam 'dod pa sbyin du gzhug go zhes smras nas zhes bya ba ni ji tsam gyis chog pa'o //
translated: Having said, Give as much as you like, means Give as much as you need.

original: des de la sbyin du ma bcug par de'i 'og tu 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa kho bo khyod dang lhan cig smra 'am 'dug pa bde ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des de la sbyin du ma bcug par de'i 'og tu 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa kho bo khyod dang lhan cig smra 'am 'dug pa bde ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Having said that, if he then says, Venerable, it is not pleasant for me to talk or sit with you.

original: 'di ltar kho bo gcig pu kho na smra 'am 'dug na bdes khyod song shig ces zer na zhes bya ba ni de skad ces zer na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo gcig pu kho na smra 'am 'dug na bdes khyod song shig ces zer na zhes bya ba ni de skad ces zer na'o //
translated: It is pleasant for me to talk or sit alone. You should go away, then he commits an offense entailing confession. Then he says means if he says this.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dgas ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dgas ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /
translated: The term offense means that one is burned in the hells, as an animal, or in the realm of the hungry ghosts, in the lower realms, in bad places.

original: 'tshed par byed /
analyzed: 'tshed par byed /
translated: One is cooked,

original: ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: one is fallen.

original: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
translated: Moreover, as long as that offense is not confessed and disclosed, it is an obscuration to virtuous qualities.

original: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //🔽de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so // de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is called an offense.

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i @195b mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i @195b mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of this [offense] through the basic offense, the preparatory act, the preparatory act of the preparatory act, the established offense, the absence of offense, the training, and the restoration.🔽What is the basic offense?

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong dag dge slong pha rol po'i nang kyi gnyen po'i don nyid ma gtogs par ched du bsams te khyim pa sbyin pa po tshig gis bsgo bas zan gcod du bcug na zan gcod du 'jug🔽pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong dag dge slong pha rol po'i nang kyi gnyen po'i don nyid ma gtogs par ched du bsams te khyim pa sbyin pa po tshig gis bsgo bas zan gcod du bcug na zan gcod du 'jug pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk intentionally causes a layperson donor to stop giving food to another monk, except for the purpose of treating an internal illness of the other monk, he commits an actual downfall.

original: dge slong pha rol po'i nad kyi gnyen po'i don du zan gcod du 'jug pa ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //🔽klan ka'i bsam pas ched du bsams pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong pha rol po'i nad kyi gnyen po'i don du zan gcod du 'jug pa ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do // klan ka'i bsam pas ched du bsams pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk causes the donor to stop giving food to the other monk for the purpose of treating an internal illness of the other monk.🔽There is no offense if the monk does so with the intention of correcting the other monk.

original: sbyin bdag khyim pa yin pa la na smad pa med do //🔽tshig gis bsgo bas zan gcod du bcug pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: sbyin bdag khyim pa yin pa la na smad pa med do // tshig gis bsgo bas zan gcod du bcug pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the donor is a layperson.🔽There is no offense if the monk causes the donor to stop giving food by means of a messenger.

original: zan gcod par bya ba dge slong nyid yin pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: zan gcod par bya ba dge slong nyid yin pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is himself the one who is to stop receiving food.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni zan gcod par bya ba dge slong nyid dang / sbyin bdag khyim pa dang zas nyid do /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni zan gcod par bya ba dge slong nyid dang / sbyin bdag khyim pa dang zas nyid do /
translated: The agent of this is the monk who is fasting, the layperson who is the donor, and the food itself.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the actual basis is a downfall by means of five limbs:

original: ched du bsams pa dang / zan gcod par bya ba dge slong nyid dang / nad kyi gnyen po'i don nyid ma gtogs pa dang / sbyin pa po khyim pa nyid dang / tshig gis bsgo bas zan gcod du bcug pa'o //
analyzed: ched du bsams pa dang / zan gcod par bya ba dge slong nyid dang / nad kyi gnyen po'i don nyid ma gtogs pa dang / sbyin pa po khyim pa nyid dang / tshig gis bsgo bas zan gcod du bcug pa'o //
translated: intentionally, the monk who is fasting, except for the purpose of treating an illness, the layperson who is the donor, and the food is made to be the object of the fast.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these limbs is incomplete, then the downfall is a serious transgression, as appropriate.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor infraction.

original: ji srid du zan gcod du 'jug pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du zan gcod du 'jug pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has begun the preparation for the downfall of making someone fast, but has not yet reached the actual basis, it is a minor infraction.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the various preparations for the actual basis, there is one minor infraction.

original: ched du ma bsams par gya tshom du zan gcod du 'jug pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: ched du ma bsams par gya tshom du zan gcod du 'jug pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If you do not think about it, but do it thoughtlessly, you have committed a minor offense.

original: zan gcod par bya ba dge slong nyid ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: zan gcod par bya ba dge slong nyid ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If you make someone who is not a fully ordained monk fast, you have committed a minor offense.

original: sbyin pa po khyim pa nyid ma yin pa mu stegs can gyi khyim la sogs pa dag la nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyin pa po khyim pa nyid ma yin pa mu stegs can gyi khyim la sogs pa dag la nyes byas so //
translated: If you make a layperson who is not a donor fast, or if you make someone fast in the home of a non-Buddhist, you have committed a minor offense.

original: tshig gis bsgo ba ma yin pa spring yig dang / lag yig dang / lag rtsis dang / mngags pa dang / brgyud pa dang / zur gyis gcod du bcug pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: tshig gis bsgo ba ma yin pa spring yig dang / lag yig dang / lag rtsis dang / mngags pa dang / brgyud pa dang / zur gyis gcod du bcug pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If you make someone fast by means of a letter, a written message, a sign, a messenger, a go-between, or by hinting, you have committed a minor offense.

original: zas bca' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa las gzhan pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: zas bca' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa las gzhan pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If you make someone fast with food that is not included in the five cooked foods or the five foods that are not cooked, you have committed a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: A minor offense that is a downfall through performance is a minor offense.🔽There are as many minor offenses that are downfalls through performance as there are performances.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /🔽sbyor ba nyes byas @196a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de / sbyor ba nyes byas @196a * //
translated: A minor offense that is a performance is a minor offense.

original: kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: A minor offense that is a performance of a minor offense is a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni nad kyi gnyen po'i don nyid kyis zan gcod du 'jug pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni nad kyi gnyen po'i don nyid kyis zan gcod du 'jug pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is sick and is fasting for the sake of his health.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is a beginner, or is insane, or is deranged, or is overwhelmed by pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du zan gcod du 'jug pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du zan gcod du 'jug pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule is that monks should not fast in all places and at all times.

original: zhe dku dang klan ka btsal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhe dku dang klan ka btsal bar mi bya'o //
translated: They should not be spiteful or argumentative.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is as before.

original: zan gcod du 'jug pa'i ltung byed de lnga bcu gcig pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: zan gcod du 'jug pa'i ltung byed de lnga bcu gcig pa bshad zin to /
translated: This was the ninety-first training rule on fasting.

original: // / me la reg pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni byung ba dang / bcas pa dang / gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: // / me la reg pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni byung ba dang / bcas pa dang / gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The introduction to the downfall on touching fire is threefold: what has happened, what is prescribed, and what is permitted.

original: byung ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na bzhugs so //
analyzed: byung ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na bzhugs so //
translated: The frame story is that the Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: de nas mnyan yod pa'i tshong pa rab tu mang po dag bcom ldan 'das gal der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: de nas mnyan yod pa'i tshong pa rab tu mang po dag bcom ldan 'das gal der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Then a great many merchants from Śrāvastī went to the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'khod do //🔽mtha' gcig tu 'khod nas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod pa'i tshong pa rab tu mang po dag la chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par ston par mdzad /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'khod do // mtha' gcig tu 'khod nas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod pa'i tshong pa rab tu mang po dag la chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par ston par mdzad /
translated: When they arrived, they bowed low until their foreheads touched the Blessed One’s feet, and then they sat down to one side.

original: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par mdzad /🔽yang dag par gzengs stod par mdzad /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par mdzad / yang dag par gzengs stod par mdzad /
translated: When they had sat down to one side, the Blessed One instructed, inspired, fired, and delighted the great many merchants from Śrāvastī with a discourse on the Dharma.🔽He exhorted them,🔽encouraged them,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad do //
translated: and satisfied them.

original: rnam grangs du mar chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par bstan /
analyzed: rnam grangs du mar chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par bstan /
translated: In many ways, he instructed, inspired, fired, and delighted them with a discourse on the Dharma.

original: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: He inspired them to take it up, and he encouraged them.

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi gsung ngo //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi gsung ngo //
translated: He delighted them with a discourse on the Dharma.🔽Then the many merchants of Śrāvastī,

original: de nas mnyan yod pa'i tshong pa rab tu mang po dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la mngon par dga' ba dang rjes su yi rang ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga
analyzed: de nas mnyan yod pa'i tshong pa rab tu mang po dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la mngon par dga' ba dang rjes su yi rang ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga
translated: having rejoiced in and praised the Blessed One’s words, bowed low until their foreheads touched the Blessed One’s feet, and then departed from the Blessed One’s presence.

original: shes ldan dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus shig / btsun pa kun dga' bo bcom ldan 'das ni bsnyen par dka' ba dang bzod par dka' ba lags pas bdag cag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhu ba'i rdo mi thogs so //
analyzed: shes ldan dag sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus shig / btsun pa kun dga' bo bcom ldan 'das ni bsnyen par dka' ba dang bzod par dka' ba lags pas bdag cag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhu ba'i rdo mi thogs so //
translated: “Venerable Ānanda, the Blessed Buddha is difficult to approach and difficult to converse with. We cannot ask the Blessed Buddha.”

analyzed: btsun pa kun dga' bos mtshan ma 'am bka' mchid kyis bcom ldan 'das dbyar gnas par zhal gyis bzhes nas phyogs gang du gshegs par 'gyur ba ji ltar mkhyen /

original: shes ldan dag bcom ldan 'das dbyar gnas par zhal gyis bzhes nas phyogs gang du gshegs par bzhed pa'i phyogs de logs su zhal gzigs shing bzhugs la de dag gi bsngags pa yang brjod par mdzad do //
analyzed: shes ldan dag bcom ldan 'das dbyar gnas par zhal gyis bzhes nas phyogs gang du gshegs par bzhed pa'i phyogs de logs su zhal gzigs shing bzhugs la de dag gi bsngags pa yang brjod par mdzad do //
translated: “Sirs, the Blessed One, having accepted the invitation to spend the rainy season, sits facing the direction in which he will go and praises that place.

analyzed: da ltar ni bcom ldan 'das ma ga dh'ara gzigs shing bzhugs la /

analyzed: rgyal po'i khab pa'i mi dag gi bsngags pa yang brjod par mdzad do //

original: de nas mnyan yod pa'i tshong pa rab tu mang po de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la mngon par dga' ba dang rjes su yi rang ba byas nas phyag 'tshal te mngon du dong nas rgyal po'i khab tu 'dong ba'i zong sta gon byas
analyzed: de nas mnyan yod pa'i tshong pa rab tu mang po de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la mngon par dga' ba dang rjes su yi rang ba byas nas phyag 'tshal te mngon du dong nas rgyal po'i khab tu 'dong ba'i zong sta gon byas
translated: Then the many merchants from Śrāvastī, having delighted in and rejoiced in what the venerable Ānanda said, bowed down to him and departed. They prepared their goods for the journey to Rājagṛha.

original: so // de nas bcom ldan 'das dbyar gnas par zhal gyis bzhes te dbyar gyi zla ba gsum po de dag 'das nas /
analyzed: so // de nas bcom ldan 'das dbyar gnas par zhal gyis bzhes te dbyar gyi zla ba gsum po de dag 'das nas /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: kun dga' bo song la dge slong rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa ma ga dh'a dag tu ljongs rgyur gshegs kyis khyed cag las gang de bzhin gshegs pa dang thabs cig tu ma ga dh'a dag tu ljongs rgyur 'gro bar spro ba des chos gos kyi las gyis

analyzed: shig ces bsgo shig / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos dge slong rnams la de skad ces bsgo ba mnyan yod pa'i tshong pa rab tu mang po de dag gis thos nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: The Venerable Ananda, having thus announced, the many merchants of Śrāvastī, having heard, went to where the Blessed One was, and having arrived,

analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pas mnyan yod nas rgyal po'i khab kyi bar du ji tsam par bdag cag las na bza' dang bsod snyoms dang / gnas mal dang bsnyung ba'i rkyen dang @197a * //
translated: they touched their heads to the two feet of the Blessed One, and said, Blessed One, please accept from us, together with the community of monks, as much as is needed from Śrāvastī to Rājagṛha, of robes, alms-food, bedding, seats, and medicinal herbs and implements,

original: sman gyi yo byad dag bzhes par ci gnang /
analyzed: sman gyi yo byad dag bzhes par ci gnang /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //

original: de nas mnyan yod pa'i tshong pa rab tu mang po de dag tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo ga la ba der dong ste phyag 'tshal nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs mal ji tsam pa dris nas /🔽'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i dgongs mal bzhin du rgyang grags bcu bcur gshegs pa mthong nas /
analyzed: de nas mnyan yod pa'i tshong pa rab tu mang po de dag tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo ga la ba der dong ste phyag 'tshal nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs mal ji tsam pa dris nas / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i dgongs mal bzhin du rgyang grags bcu bcur gshegs pa mthong nas /

analyzed: de dag gis rgyang grags bcu bcur bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa'i tshogs dag bshams so //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi 'khor dang bcas pa rgyal po'i kha ba ga la ba de logs su ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs so /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo tshong pa don mthun gyi mdun du song ba dang / ji tsam na lam kha brag mthong nas des bcom ldan 'das ma gshegs kyi bar du der bsdad do //
translated: The venerable Ānanda went in front of the caravan of merchants, and when he saw a narrow path ahead, he stayed there until the Blessed One had passed.

original: bcom ldan 'das gshegs nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gshegs nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One went and said,

analyzed: kun dga' bo khyod ci sdod /

analyzed: btsun pa 'di ni shul kha brag lags te / shul 'di ni drang la seng ge'i 'jigs pa dang bcas pa lags /
translated: “Lord, this is a narrow path.🔽This path is straight but has the danger of lions.

analyzed: shul 'di ni 'khyog la bde ba lags na /
translated: This path is crooked but is safe.

original: shul gang nas mchi bar bgyi /
analyzed: shul gang nas mchi bar bgyi /
translated: Which path should we take?”

analyzed: kun dga' bo lam drang po nas song shig dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ni seng ge'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: “Ānanda, take the straight path. The Tathāgata is free from the danger of lions.”

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das shul drang po nas gshegs par brtsams nas ji tsam na lam de na ri brags shig yod pa der byon pa dang / ri brags de nas byis pa khye'u gnyis shig lam kar 'ongs te rtse zhing 'dug go // de na gcig gi lag na ni rda pa ta ha thogs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One began to go by the straight path. When they reached a village on that path, two boys came out onto the path from the village and began to play there.🔽One of them had a clay lion in his hand.

original: cig shos kyi lag na ni gzhu thogs so //
analyzed: cig shos kyi lag na ni gzhu thogs so //

analyzed: de gnyis kyis bcom ldan 'das mthong nas phyag 'tshal te 'di skad ces gsol to //

original: bcom ldan 'das tshur gshegs su gsol /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das tshur gshegs su gsol /
translated: “Blessed One, please come!

original: bcom ldan 'das byon pa legs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byon pa legs so //
translated: Blessed One, welcome!

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i shul du gar gshegs //
translated: Blessed One, where are you going, on this dangerous road?

analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das mi bsnyengs su gsol /
translated: But please, Blessed One, do not be afraid!

analyzed: bdag cag gnyis gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi bsel bgyi'o //
translated: We will protect the Blessed One.”

translated: and the other, who also had faith, drew a bow. They began to go in front of the Blessed One, and the Blessed One thought, “These two boys have planted roots of virtue.” Knowing this, the Blessed One said to the two boys,🔽“Boys, do not be afraid!

analyzed: khye'u gnyis phyir log shig / de bzhin gshegs pa ni seng ge'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: “You two boys should return. The Tathāgata is free from the fear of lions.”

original: de gnyis kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ba dang / bcom ldan 'das 'dzum pa mdzad de /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ba dang / bcom ldan 'das 'dzum pa mdzad de /
translated: They bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One and left his presence. The Blessed One smiled,

analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos zhus nas bcom ldan 'das kyis khye'u de gnyis dge ba'i rtsa ba de dang legs par spyad pa des bskal pa bcu gsum du log par ltung bar 'gro bar mi 'gyur zhing lha dang mi rnams su mtshams sbyor zhing
translated: They will be reborn among gods and humans,

analyzed: 'khod nas / srid pa tha ma dang / gnas tha ma dang / gzugs tha ma dang / lus tha ma thob pa na /
translated: and in their last existence, last dwelling, last body, last form,

analyzed: las de nyid dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid dang / legs par spyad pa de nyid kyis rab tu byung nas rang byang chub mngon du byed par 'gyur te / gcig ni rang sangs rgyas rda sgra zhes bya bar 'gyur /

analyzed: cig shos ni rang sangs rgyas 'jigs sbyin zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan to //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das grong med pa'i dgon pa'i gnas shig tu mtshan mo gnas par zhal gyis bzhes so //
translated: Then the Blessed One accepted the invitation to spend the night in a certain forest grove.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis shing ljon pa yang rgan rims kyis bsko bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal pas /

analyzed: drug sde dag gis shing ljon pa khong stong zhig thob nas /

translated: When they lit a fire in the hollow tree to warm themselves, a snake that lived in the hollow tree was disturbed by the smoke. It climbed up into the branches and hung there.

original: drug sde dag gis de mthong nas @198a * //
analyzed: drug sde dag gis de mthong nas @198a * //
translated: When the group of six saw it,🔽they said, “It’s come out! It’s come out!”

original: byung ngo byung ngo zhes smras pa dang / tshong pa don mthun dag gis de thos nas bsams pa /
analyzed: byung ngo byung ngo zhes smras pa dang / tshong pa don mthun dag gis de thos nas bsams pa /
translated: When the merchants heard that, they thought,

analyzed: seng ge byung ngo snyam nas de dag skrag ste phyogs bzhir byer ro //
translated: “A lion has come out!” They were frightened and fled in the four directions.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda,

analyzed: kun dga' bo ci'i phyir tshong pa don mthun 'di dag phyogs bzhir byer /
translated: “Ānanda, why have these merchants split up in the four directions?”

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos skabs de rgyas par gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: When the venerable Ānanda had explained the situation in detail, the Blessed One said,🔽“Ānanda, go and tell the merchants, ‘The Tathāgata is free from the fear of lions. Return!’”

original: kun dga' bo song la tshong pa don mthun dag la de bzhin gshegs pa ni seng ge'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba yin gyi phyir log shig ces bsgo shig / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos de dag la de skad bsgo nas phyir log par gyur to
analyzed: kun dga' bo song la tshong pa don mthun dag la de bzhin gshegs pa ni seng ge'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba yin gyi phyir log shig ces bsgo shig / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos de dag la de skad bsgo nas phyir log par gyur to
translated: When the venerable Ānanda had told them that, they returned.

original: // drug sde dag gis tshong pa don mthun gyi tshogs skrag par byas te /
analyzed: // drug sde dag gis tshong pa don mthun gyi tshogs skrag par byas te /
translated: The group of six frightened the merchants.

analyzed: phyogs bzhir byer ba bcom ldan 'das kyis dbugs phyung bar gyur pa'i skabs de las bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon ri bong drug cig mtshe'u 'gram na shing bil ba'i tshal gse ba na 'dug pa na shing bil pa zhig mtshe'u'i nang du rdib pa'i sgra cal zhes zer
translated: The Buddha said, “Once six rabbits were living in a bilva tree grove on the bank of a lake. When a bilva fruit fell into the lake with a splash,

analyzed: ba ri bong drug gis thos nas de dag 'bros par brtsams pa /

translated: The fox, hyena, deer, pig, buffalo, rhinoceros, elephant, bear, leopard, and lion heard the commotion in succession and they too started to flee.

analyzed: ri bong drug dang nye ba zhig na seng ge ral pa can cod pan lta bu dang ldan pa zhig 'dug pa des phyir log cing dbyugs phyung ste /
translated: Near the six rabbits was a lion with a mane like a crown. He turned around, bared his fangs,🔽and roared. The six rabbits and the others fled.

original: ri bong drug ni drug sde dag yin la /
analyzed: ri bong drug ni drug sde dag yin la /
translated: The six rabbits are the group of six.

original: wa la sogs pa ri dags kyi tshogs chen po skrag ste byer ba dag ni tshong pa dag yin no //
analyzed: wa la sogs pa ri dags kyi tshogs chen po skrag ste byer ba dag ni tshong pa dag yin no //
translated: The great herd of deer, such as the fox, that were frightened and scattered are the merchants.

original: seng ge ral pa can cod pa na lta bu dang ldan pa dag gis ri dvags kyi tshogs chen po skrag pa phyogs bzhir byer ba dag dbugs phyung bar gyur pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid lags pa'i bka' mchid kyang stsal to //
analyzed: seng ge ral pa can cod pa na lta bu dang ldan pa dag gis ri dvags kyi tshogs chen po skrag pa phyogs bzhir byer ba dag dbugs phyung bar gyur pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid lags pa'i bka' mchid kyang stsal to //
translated: The lion with a mane like a turban who comforted the great herd of deer that were frightened and scattered in the four directions is the Tathāgata himself.

original: de ni re zhig byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni re zhig byung ba yin te /

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyis bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do //

original: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The basis for the rule is as follows: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda,🔽Ānanda, go to the bhikṣus living in the vicinity of Rājagṛha in the Bamboo Grove, the Squirrels' Feeding Ground, and assemble them in the assembly hall.

original: kun dga' bo @198b song la dge slong dang tshong pa rnams la khyed cag las gang yang don mthun gyi mdun du ma 'gro shig / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid don mthun gyi mdun du gshegs so zhes bsgo shig / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos de
analyzed: kun dga' bo @198b song la dge slong dang tshong pa rnams la khyed cag las gang yang don mthun gyi mdun du ma 'gro shig / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid don mthun gyi mdun du gshegs so zhes bsgo shig / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos de
translated: “Ānanda, go and tell the monks and merchants, ‘None of you should go in front of the caravan. The Tathāgata himself will go in front of the caravan.’ ”🔽When the Venerable Ānanda had given the order, the Tathāgata himself went in front of the caravan.

original: skad bsgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid don mthun gyi mdun du gshegs pa dang / ci tsam na seng ge ral pa can cod pan lta bu dang ldan pa rngam ste bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dong zhing byung ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag g-yas pa'i mthil du seng ge ral pa can cod pan lta bu dang ldan pa lnga sprul pa mdzad nas /
analyzed: skad bsgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid don mthun gyi mdun du gshegs pa dang / ci tsam na seng ge ral pa can cod pan lta bu dang ldan pa rngam ste bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dong zhing byung ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag g-yas pa'i mthil du seng ge ral pa can cod pan lta bu dang ldan pa lnga sprul pa mdzad nas /
translated: When a lion with a mane like a crown came roaring and appeared before the Blessed One, the Blessed One emanated five lions with manes like crowns on the palm of his right hand.

original: des de dag gi dri tshor nas skrag ste 'bros par brtsams pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis phyogs bzhir me sprul pa mdzad do //
analyzed: des de dag gi dri tshor nas skrag ste 'bros par brtsams pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis phyogs bzhir me sprul pa mdzad do //
translated: When it smelled their scent, it became frightened and tried to flee, but the Blessed One emanated fire in the four directions.

original: seng ge nges phyogs bzhir 'bar rab tu 'bar te me lce gcig tu gyur cing 'bar bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: seng ge nges phyogs bzhir 'bar rab tu 'bar te me lce gcig tu gyur cing 'bar bar mthong ngo //
translated: He saw that the lion was burning in the four directions, blazing with a single tongue of flame.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs kyi drung 'ba' zhig na zhi bar mthong nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs kyi drung 'ba' zhig na zhi bar mthong nas /

analyzed: des bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la gtugs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag 'khor lo dang / bkra shis dang / g-yung drung dang dra bas 'brel pa bsod nams brgya phrag du ma las 'khrungs pa 'jigs pa rnams dbugs 'byin par mdzad pas mgo la byugs te bka' stsal pa /
translated: He touched his head to the Blessed One’s feet, and the Blessed One, with his hands, which were marked with wheels, auspicious symbols, and swastikas, and which had arisen from many hundreds of merits, and which brought relief to the frightened, stroked his head and said,

analyzed: bzhin bzangs khyod sngon gyi nyes par spyad pa dang ldan pas dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes te /
translated: “Good man, you were born in the animal realm because of your previous misdeeds.

original: khyod da ltar drag shul can lag pa dmar ba /
analyzed: khyod da ltar drag shul can lag pa dmar ba /
translated: You are now a violent man, with bloody hands,

original: bsnun pa dang rab tu bsnun pa la zhugs pa gzhan gyi srog 'phrog pa /
analyzed: bsnun pa dang rab tu bsnun pa la zhugs pa gzhan gyi srog 'phrog pa /
translated: who has taken up the practice of striking and striking hard, and who robs others of their lives.

original: gzhan gyi srog gcod du 'jug na gzhan gyi srog gcod pas 'tsho bar byed pa yin pas khyod 'di nas shi 'phos pa'i 'gro ba ni cir 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan gyi srog gcod du 'jug na gzhan gyi srog gcod pas 'tsho bar byed pa yin pas khyod 'di nas shi 'phos pa'i 'gro ba ni cir 'gyur /

original: skye ba ni cir 'gyur /
analyzed: skye ba ni cir 'gyur /
translated: What will be your rebirth?

original: tshe phyi ma ni cir 'gyur /
analyzed: tshe phyi ma ni cir 'gyur /
translated: What will be your next life?

original: bzhin bzangs 'di ltar 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: bzhin bzangs 'di ltar 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Good man, all compounded things are impermanent.

original: chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o //

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes tshig gsum gyis chos bstan nas /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o zhes tshig gsum gyis chos bstan nas /
translated: Nirvāṇa is peace.

translated: Good man, if you think about this, you will become faithful. That will free you from the animal realm.

analyzed: dge slong dag seng ge de la reg par byed pa na de sgra 'byin to //

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis @199a * //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis @199a * //
translated: Then the Blessed One

analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na dge slong gis seng ge la reg par mi bya'o //

analyzed: dge slong seng ge la reg par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de nas ri dags kyi rgyal po seng ge des rang gi zan bcad par byas te /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la sems mngon par dad par byas nas dus la bab pa dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams kyi nang du skyes te /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'ongs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'ongs nas /
translated: He came into the presence of the Blessed One.🔽The Blessed One, knowing the thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperament, and nature of the god formerly a lion,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon seng ge lha'i bu'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / khams dang / rang bzhin thugs su chud nas des rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par mdzad do //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i sngon byung ba'i tshul yang rgya cher bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One also related in detail the past events.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ma ga dh'a dag tu ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa na rgyal po'i khab tu byon nas /

analyzed: rgyal po'i khab na 'od ma'i tshal ka lan da ka'i gnas na bzhugs so //

analyzed: nyi ma yang byed mgal me'i 'khor lo yang byed /
translated: making the sun, and making a fire wheel.

analyzed: byis pa khye'u dag kyang de ltar byed na /

translated: “Sirs, what is the difference between these children and the Śākya son’s monks? What is the point of thinking about it?

analyzed: tha dad du bya ba ni ci yod /
translated: What is the point of making distinctions?🔽Who would think of giving alms to these shaven-headed monks?

analyzed: su zhig dge sbyong mgo reg 'di dag la bsod snyoms sbyin pa dang / bya bar sems zhes smod par byed /
translated: ” They disparaged,

analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: drug sde dag la rmas nas /
analyzed: drug sde dag la rmas nas /

analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /

translated: “Noble one,

original: 'phags pa khyod kyi ston pa thugs rje can lags pas 'di ltar de nyid rkyen du mdzad nas rjes su gnang bar 'gyur ba gang lags pa de lta bu'i gnas mchis par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa
analyzed: 'phags pa khyod kyi ston pa thugs rje can lags pas 'di ltar de nyid rkyen du mdzad nas rjes su gnang bar 'gyur ba gang lags pa de lta bu'i gnas mchis par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa
translated: The monks reported this to the Blessed One.

original: dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de lta bas na na ba'i dus ma gtogs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na na ba'i dus ma gtogs so //
translated: “Therefore, I authorize this only when one is sick.”

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having praised the desire for training, respect for training, and the austerity of training,

original: dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas /
translated: spoke in a way that accords with, is similar to, and is appropriate for that,

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: and said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la /
translated: “Monks, therefore, the previous authorization

original: 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
translated: is now revoked.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: My disciples should recite this rule for training:

original: yang dge slong gang min bar bdag nyid kyi phyir me la reg gam reg tu 'jug na ltung byed do zhes gnang ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang min bar bdag nyid kyi phyir me la reg gam reg tu 'jug na ltung byed do zhes gnang ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘If a monk touches fire or has it touched for the purpose of heating himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni rgyal po'i khab /
analyzed: yul ni rgyal po'i khab /
translated: The place was Rājagṛha.

original: gang zag ni chos 'di pa'i dge slong rab tu mang po dang nad pa /
analyzed: gang zag ni chos 'di pa'i dge slong rab tu mang po dang nad pa /
translated: The people were many monks of this teaching and a sick person.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / nyes pa ni med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / nyes pa ni med do //
translated: There was no affliction and no offense.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: As for “If a monk,” it refers to the group of six or anyone else like them.

original: min bar zhes bya ba ni na ba bzhag ste'o //🔽bdag nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi ched du'o //
analyzed: min bar zhes bya ba ni na ba bzhag ste'o // bdag nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi ched du'o //
translated: “For the purpose of heating himself” means except if he is sick.🔽“For the purpose of heating himself” means for his own sake.

original: me la reg gam zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: me la reg gam zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: “Touches fire” means by himself.

original: reg tu 'jug na zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
analyzed: reg tu 'jug na zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
translated: “Has it touched” means by another.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Offense entailing confession” is as above.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the offense?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the characteristics of this should be understood by the basic downfalls, the preparatory actions, the preparatory actions of the preparatory actions, the downfalls, the non-downfalls, the trainings, and the restoration of vows.

original: de la 'dir yang dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis mes rtse ba nyid kyis gzhan la gtong bas zla ba dang nyi ma dang mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa byed pa dang / ston pa dang / chos dang /
analyzed: de la 'dir yang dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis mes rtse ba nyid kyis gzhan la gtong bas zla ba dang nyi ma dang mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa byed pa dang / ston pa dang / chos dang /
translated: Here, the basic downfalls are as follows: A monk who plays with fire makes a circle with a firebrand and so on, and then throws it away.🔽He teaches others to do the same, and he does not restore the vow when he is not sick and is not staying in a place where he is not allowed to make a fire.

original: dge 'dun dang / tshangs pa @200b mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis chos dang ldan par bya ba'i don nyid dang / lhung bzed dang tshon gyi las la brtag pa lta bus dus byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i dge slong na ba'i dbang nyid du gnas pa ma yin pas spangs ba dang /
analyzed: dge 'dun dang / tshangs pa @200b mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis chos dang ldan par bya ba'i don nyid dang / lhung bzed dang tshon gyi las la brtag pa lta bus dus byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i dge slong na ba'i dbang nyid du gnas pa ma yin pas spangs ba dang /
translated: He does not give the full ordination to a person who is not a suitable candidate.

original: gsod pa dang / mes reg pa dang / ma reg pa'i bud shing bskul ba dang / me dang bcas pa 'dren pa dang / bskul ba dang / mdag ma spung ba dang / 'dru ba dag dang / me ma mur dang / me lcer bud shing 'jud pa dang /
analyzed: gsod pa dang / mes reg pa dang / ma reg pa'i bud shing bskul ba dang / me dang bcas pa 'dren pa dang / bskul ba dang / mdag ma spung ba dang / 'dru ba dag dang / me ma mur dang / me lcer bud shing 'jud pa dang /
translated: It is a root downfall to kill, to touch fire, to kindle a fire, to carry fire, to fan a fire, to pile up coals, to spin thread, to put wood in a fire,

original: 'byin pa rang ngam bsgo bas byed na me la reg pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'byin pa rang ngam bsgo bas byed na me la reg pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: or to take out wood from a fire, whether oneself or by ordering someone else to do so.

original: dge slong mas rtse ba nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong mas rtse ba nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: If a nun does this, it is not a downfall.

original: mes rtse ba nyid ces bya ba de rnam pa gang gis yin zhe na /
analyzed: mes rtse ba nyid ces bya ba de rnam pa gang gis yin zhe na /
translated: What is meant by “playing with fire”?

original: de'i phyir gzhan la gtong bas zla ba dang nyi ma dang mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa byed pa zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan la gtong bas zla ba dang nyi ma dang mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa byed pa zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “To make the moon, the sun, or a fire wheel, and so forth, by throwing sparks at another.”

original: gzhan la gtong pas zhes bya ba ni byis pas bud shing mes spar te gcig gi lag nas gcig gi lag tu gzhan la thong shig gzhan la thong shig ces gzhan la gtong bar byed pa'i rtsed mo gang la yod pa de lta bus so //
analyzed: gzhan la gtong pas zhes bya ba ni byis pas bud shing mes spar te gcig gi lag nas gcig gi lag tu gzhan la thong shig gzhan la thong shig ces gzhan la gtong bar byed pa'i rtsed mo gang la yod pa de lta bus so //
translated: The phrase by giving to others means that, like children who play a game of passing a burning piece of wood from hand to hand, saying, Pass it to another, pass it to another, they play by passing it from one to another.

original: des zla ba lta bur byed pa dang / nyi ma lta bur byed pa dang / mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa byed pas rtse ba yin te /
analyzed: des zla ba lta bur byed pa dang / nyi ma lta bur byed pa dang / mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa byed pas rtse ba yin te /
translated: They play by making it like the moon, like the sun, like a circle of fire, and so on.

original: de dag la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de dag la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in that.

original: me nyid kyis rtse ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: me nyid kyis rtse ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in playing with fire.

original: ci rtse ba 'ba' zhig la ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci rtse ba 'ba' zhig la ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Does this downfall apply only to playing with fire?

original: de 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de /
analyzed: de 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de /
translated: It does not apply only to that.

original: dus phyin gyis ma brlabs pa dang / dge slong na ba'i dbang nyid du gnas pa ma yin pas me la rang ngam bsgo bas reg par byed pa dag la yang na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dus phyin gyis ma brlabs pa dang / dge slong na ba'i dbang nyid du gnas pa ma yin pas me la rang ngam bsgo bas reg par byed pa dag la yang na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if one touches fire in order to warm oneself when one is cold, or in order to warm a robe of a sick monk, without having obtained permission to do so.

original: dus byin gyis ma brlabs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dus byin gyis ma brlabs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is meant by not having obtained permission?

original: de'i phyir ston pa dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis chos dang ldan pa'i don nyid dang lhung bzed dang / tshon gyi las la brtag pa lta bus dus byin gyis ma brlabs pa zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ston pa dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis chos dang ldan pa'i don nyid dang lhung bzed dang / tshon gyi las la brtag pa lta bus dus byin gyis ma brlabs pa zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, the teacher, the doctrine, the Saṅgha, and fellow practitioners say, “The time is not free” in the sense of not being free to do a Dharma activity, such as the work of dyeing robes and so on.

original: ston pa dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / tshangs pa mtshungs bar spyod pa rnams kyis chos dang ldan pa'i bya ba'i don nyid ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten dang / dge 'dun dang /
analyzed: ston pa dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / tshangs pa mtshungs bar spyod pa rnams kyis chos dang ldan pa'i bya ba'i don nyid ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten dang / dge 'dun dang /
translated: The “very purpose of the Dharma activity” of the teacher, the doctrine, the Saṅgha, and fellow practitioners is the Buddha, the doctrine, the stūpa of the Tathāgata, the Saṅgha,

original: mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / dge slong tshangs pa mtshungs @201a * //
analyzed: mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / dge slong tshangs pa mtshungs @201a * //
translated: the preceptor, the master, and fellow brahmacārin bhikṣus.

original: par spyod pa rnams la bdug spos dang / mar me dang / chu dron la sogs pa 'bul ba ste /
analyzed: par spyod pa rnams la bdug spos dang / mar me dang / chu dron la sogs pa 'bul ba ste /
translated: It is to offer them incense, lamps, hot water, and so on.

original: de dag gi don nyid du dus byin gyis brlab pa ni dgos pa de dang / de dag gi don du 'di ltar bya'o zhes sems kyis mngon par 'du bya zhing lta ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi don nyid du dus byin gyis brlab pa ni dgos pa de dang / de dag gi don du 'di ltar bya'o zhes sems kyis mngon par 'du bya zhing lta ba yin no //
translated: The mental composition and view that “I should do this for the sake of those” is the consecration of time.

original: lhung bzed dang tshon gyi las zhes smos pas ni rang gi lhung bzed dang chos gos kyi las bstan te /
analyzed: lhung bzed dang tshon gyi las zhes smos pas ni rang gi lhung bzed dang chos gos kyi las bstan te /
translated: The phrase “the work of the alms-bowl and the work of the robes” indicates the work of one’s own alms-bowl and robes.

original: de dag gi don nyid du dus byin gyis brlab pa yang lhung bzed kyi las bya'o zhe 'am /
analyzed: de dag gi don nyid du dus byin gyis brlab pa yang lhung bzed kyi las bya'o zhe 'am /
translated: The consecration of time for the sake of those is the consecration of time for the sake of the work of the alms-bowl or the work of the robes.

original: tshon gyi las bya'o zhes yid kyis brtag pa gang yin pa de ni dus byin gyis brlabs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshon gyi las bya'o zhes yid kyis brtag pa gang yin pa de ni dus byin gyis brlabs pa yin no //
translated: The mental investigation that “I should do the work of the alms-bowl” or “I should do the work of the robes” is the consecration of time.

original: de lta bus dus byin gyis brlabs pa la ltung ba med pas de lta bus dus byin gyis ma brlabs pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de lta bus dus byin gyis brlabs pa la ltung ba med pas de lta bus dus byin gyis ma brlabs pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: Since there is no offense in consecrating time in that way, there is no offense in not consecrating time in that way.

original: dge slong na ba'i dbang nyid du gnas pa la ltung ba med pas dge slong na ba'i dbang nyid du gnas pa ma yin pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong na ba'i dbang nyid du gnas pa la ltung ba med pas dge slong na ba'i dbang nyid du gnas pa ma yin pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: Since there is no offense for a sick monk to remain in control, there is no offense for a monk who is not sick to remain in control.

original: me la rang ngam bsgo bas reg par byed pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: me la rang ngam bsgo bas reg par byed pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If one asks, “How does one make fire burn by oneself or by command?”

original: de'i phyir spang ba dang / gsod pa dang / mes reg pa dang / ma reg pa'i bud shing bskul ba dang / me dang bcas pa 'dren pa dang / skul ba dang / mdag ma spung ba dang / 'dru ba dag dang / me mar mur dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir spang ba dang / gsod pa dang / mes reg pa dang / ma reg pa'i bud shing bskul ba dang / me dang bcas pa 'dren pa dang / skul ba dang / mdag ma spung ba dang / 'dru ba dag dang / me mar mur dang /
translated: The text says, “The one who burns, kills, or makes fire touch firewood, or makes fire not touch firewood, or makes firewood with fire be drawn or be made to burn, or makes a pile of embers, or makes a firebrand, or makes firewood enter a fire, or makes it be extinguished, by oneself or by command.”

original: me lcer bud shing 'jug pa dang / 'byan pa rang ngam /🔽sgo bar byed na zhes bya ba smras te /🔽dus byin gyis brlabs pa'i dge slong na ba'i dbang nyid du gnas pa ma yin pa rang ngam bsgo bas me spar ram /
analyzed: me lcer bud shing 'jug pa dang / 'byan pa rang ngam / sgo bar byed na zhes bya ba smras te / dus byin gyis brlabs pa'i dge slong na ba'i dbang nyid du gnas pa ma yin pa rang ngam bsgo bas me spar ram /
translated: The one who burns, kills, or makes fire touch firewood, or makes fire not touch firewood, or makes firewood with fire be drawn or be made to burn, or makes a pile of embers, or makes a firebrand, or makes firewood enter a fire, or makes it be extinguished, by oneself or by command.

original: gsod dam / mes reg pa'i bud shing bskul tam /🔽mes ma reg pa'i bud shing bskul tam /🔽me dang bcas pa'i bud shing 'dren tam bskul tam /
analyzed: gsod dam / mes reg pa'i bud shing bskul tam / mes ma reg pa'i bud shing bskul tam / me dang bcas pa'i bud shing 'dren tam bskul tam /
translated: The one who burns, kills, or makes fire touch firewood, or makes fire not touch firewood, or makes firewood with fire be drawn or be made to burn, or makes a pile of embers, or makes a firebrand, or makes firewood enter a fire, or makes it be extinguished, by oneself or by command.

original: mdag ma spung ngam /
analyzed: mdag ma spung ngam /
translated: The one who burns, kills, or makes fire touch firewood, or makes fire not touch firewood, or makes firewood with fire be drawn or be made to burn, or makes a pile of embers, or makes a firebrand, or makes firewood enter a fire, or makes it be extinguished, by oneself or by command.

original: 'dru 'am me mar mur dang / me lce'i nang du bud shing 'dzud dam 'byin na thams cad la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: 'dru 'am me mar mur dang / me lce'i nang du bud shing 'dzud dam 'byin na thams cad la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one puts wood into a fire pit or takes it out, whether the fire is burning or not.

original: rang gis reg gam gzhan la bsgo bas reg tu bcug pa la na smad pa med do /
analyzed: rang gis reg gam gzhan la bsgo bas reg tu bcug pa la na smad pa med do /
translated: There is no offense if one touches it oneself or makes another touch it.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni me mar mur dang me lce ma gtogs pa'i me nyid dang / mes rtse ba nyid dang / dus byin gyis ma brlabs pa dang / na ba'i dbang nyid du gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni me mar mur dang me lce ma gtogs pa'i me nyid dang / mes rtse ba nyid dang / dus byin gyis ma brlabs pa dang / na ba'i dbang nyid du gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: The agent of this downfall is fire itself, except for a fire pit or a flame, and it is not a case of playing with fire, or if one is not in a time of crisis, or if one is not in a state of health.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The basis of this downfall is fivefold:

original: me nyid dang / mes rtse ba nyid dang / dus phyin gyis ma brlabs pa dang / na ba'i dbang nyid du gnas pa ma yin pa dang rang ngam bsgo @201b bas reg pa'o //
analyzed: me nyid dang / mes rtse ba nyid dang / dus phyin gyis ma brlabs pa dang / na ba'i dbang nyid du gnas pa ma yin pa dang rang ngam bsgo @201b bas reg pa'o //
translated: fire itself, playing with fire, not being in a time of crisis, not being in a state of health, and touching it oneself or making someone else touch it.

original: de dag las yan lag ma chang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma chang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors is missing, it is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor offense.

original: ji srid du me la reg pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du me la reg pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has begun the performance of the offense of touching fire but has not yet reached the actual basis, it is a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //🔽me mar mur ni phyed shi ba nyid yin pas de la reg gam /
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o // me mar mur ni phyed shi ba nyid yin pas de la reg gam /
translated: For each performance of the actual basis, however many there are, there is a minor offense for each.

original: reg tu bcug na nyes byas so //
analyzed: reg tu bcug na nyes byas so //
translated: Since a half-burned fire is half-dead, if one touches it or makes another touch it, it is a minor offense.

original: me lce dag kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: me lce dag kyang de bzhin no //
translated: So it is also with the flames.

original: skra dang spu dang rus pa dang / sen mo dang / mchil ma dang / snabs dang / skyugs pa dang / rlugs pa dang / mon sran sde'u dang mon sran gre'u dang til dang 'bru mar dang sbrang rtsi dang mar dag ni bud shing gi phyed nyid yin pas /
analyzed: skra dang spu dang rus pa dang / sen mo dang / mchil ma dang / snabs dang / skyugs pa dang / rlugs pa dang / mon sran sde'u dang mon sran gre'u dang til dang 'bru mar dang sbrang rtsi dang mar dag ni bud shing gi phyed nyid yin pas /
translated: Hair, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, bone marrow, kidneys, heart, liver, pleura, spleen, lungs, intestines, mesentery, undigested food, feces, head, brain, cranial flakes, and the like are half-fuel,

original: de dag rang ngam bsgo bas mer bcug pa dang byung ba ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: de dag rang ngam bsgo bas mer bcug pa dang byung ba ni nyes byas so //
translated: so if one puts them in the fire oneself or makes another do so, it is a minor offense.

original: de dag kyang dpe tsam du zad de /
analyzed: de dag kyang dpe tsam du zad de /
translated: These are merely examples.

original: ras bal dang bal la sogs pa yang bsdu'o //
analyzed: ras bal dang bal la sogs pa yang bsdu'o //
translated: Cotton, wool, and so on are also included.

original: 'bar ba'i chos can yang de dang 'dra'o //🔽gzhan gyi bya ba gzhan la byin gyis rlob pa ni phyed byin gyis brlabs pa yin pas dge slong gis dus byin gyis ma brlabs par mkhan po la sogs pa'i bya bas me la reg pa dang mkhan po la sogs pa gzhan gyi bya ba slob dpon la
analyzed: 'bar ba'i chos can yang de dang 'dra'o // gzhan gyi bya ba gzhan la byin gyis rlob pa ni phyed byin gyis brlabs pa yin pas dge slong gis dus byin gyis ma brlabs par mkhan po la sogs pa'i bya bas me la reg pa dang mkhan po la sogs pa gzhan gyi bya ba slob dpon la
translated: The blazing one is similar to that.

original: sogs pa gzhan gyis byin gyis rlob pa dang / log par byin gyis rlob pa thams cad kyang nyes byas so //
analyzed: sogs pa gzhan gyis byin gyis rlob pa dang / log par byin gyis rlob pa thams cad kyang nyes byas so //
translated: The blessing of one’s own action in another is half-blessing. Therefore, if a monk touches fire with the action of an abbot, etc., without blessing the time, and if the action of another, such as an abbot, is blessed by another, such as a master, and if all blessings are inverted, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The downfall through preparation is a subtle offense of wrong conduct.

translated: When Venerable Udayī had abandoned all disturbing emotions and actualized arhatship, Venerable Saṅgharakṣita had gone to Kauśāmbī and was staying there, and when it was time for Atimānī and Upāli to go,

analyzed: mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa yang yin pas de dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag yun ring po nas drug sde dag gis mtho btsams te /
translated: “Venerables, for a long time the group-of-six has harassed us.

translated: They have not harassed others as much as they have harassed Upananda. Come, let’s do a procedure of ejecting him from the place.”

original: de nas gcig gis smras pa /
analyzed: de nas gcig gis smras pa /
translated: Then one of them said,

original: phu nu bo dag de'i phu nu bo dga' bo rtsod pa la mkhas pas bdag cag gis nye dga' gnas nas dbyung ba'i las bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: phu nu bo dag de'i phu nu bo dga' bo rtsod pa la mkhas pas bdag cag gis nye dga' gnas nas dbyung ba'i las bya bar mi nus so //
translated: “Brothers, his brother Nanda is skilled in debate. We cannot do a procedure of ejecting Upananda.

original: de brel ba bskyed par bya'o zhes de dag dga' bo'i gan du song ste smras pa /
analyzed: de brel ba bskyed par bya'o zhes de dag dga' bo'i gan du song ste smras pa /
translated: We must make him anxious.” They went to Nanda and said,

analyzed: gnas brtan phyag 'tshal lo // tshe dang ldan pa dag aa rog gya /

analyzed: gnas brtan gyi chos gos dag dri ma can du gyur to //

analyzed: bdag cag gis gnas brtan gyi chos gos dag bkru bar bgyi /
translated: “We will wash the elder’s robes for him.🔽Give us your robes.”

analyzed: chos gos dag tshur stsol cig ces bcu bdun sde dag gis dga' bo rnyang rnying dag bskon te /
translated: The group of seventeen dressed Nanda in old, worn-out robes,

analyzed: de'i chos gos thams cad @202b blangs nas 'gyur byed kyi tshal der gnas mal bshams nas gand'i brdungs te dga' bo'i gan du song ste smras pa /

analyzed: gnas brtan dge 'dun gyi bya ba cung zhig mchis te gand'i brdungs kyi tshur spyon /
translated: “Elder, the saṅgha has a small matter for the saṅgha. The bell has been rung. Come.”

original: dga' bos smras pa /
analyzed: dga' bos smras pa /
translated: Nanda said,

original: bu dag kho bo 'di 'dra ba'i gnas skabs kyis dge 'dun gyi nang du ci ltar 'gro bar bya /
analyzed: bu dag kho bo 'di 'dra ba'i gnas skabs kyis dge 'dun gyi nang du ci ltar 'gro bar bya /
translated: “Sons, how can I go to the saṅgha in such a state?

original: dge 'dun gyi bya ba chos dang ldan pa la 'dun pa 'bul lo //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi bya ba chos dang ldan pa la 'dun pa 'bul lo //
translated: I offer my consent to the saṅgha’s virtuous activity.”

original: de nas dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par 'gyur ba na dge slong gleng ba po rgan pa'i mtha' logs su 'dug ste nye dga' la smras pa /🔽btsun pa nye dga' khyod kyis bcu bdun sde dag gi lto dral te /
analyzed: de nas dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par 'gyur ba na dge slong gleng ba po rgan pa'i mtha' logs su 'dug ste nye dga' la smras pa / btsun pa nye dga' khyod kyis bcu bdun sde dag gi lto dral te /
translated: Then, when the entire Saṅgha had gathered and agreed, the monk who was the accuser sat at the end of the row of elders and said to Upāli,🔽“Venerable Upāli, do you remember saying,🔽‘I will split the stomachs of the group of seventeen and

original: rgyu ma dag gis rgyal byed kyi tshal bskor bar bya'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i tshig smras pa gang yin pa de dran nam /
analyzed: rgyu ma dag gis rgyal byed kyi tshal bskor bar bya'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i tshig smras pa gang yin pa de dran nam /
translated: encircle the Jeta Grove with their intestines’?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag rma sogs pa dag dral te ci bya /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag rma sogs pa dag dral te ci bya /
translated: “Venerable ones, what is the point of splitting open a wound?

original: de ni 'das pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'das pa'i don yin no //
translated: That is a thing of the past.”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,🔽“The Blessed One established the bases of training for the hearers in the monastic code only with regard to the past.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'das pa'i dus kho na las brtsams te 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba mdzad do zhes de dag gis nye dga' la gya tshom du nan gyis gnas nas dbyung ba'i las byas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'das pa'i dus kho na las brtsams te 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba mdzad do zhes de dag gis nye dga' la gya tshom du nan gyis gnas nas dbyung ba'i las byas so //
translated: They then performed an expulsion for not recognizing an offense against Upāli without due cause.

original: nye dga' gnas nas dbyung ba'i las byas nas phu bo dga' bo'i gan du song ste du bar brtsams pa dang dga' bos smras pa /
analyzed: nye dga' gnas nas dbyung ba'i las byas nas phu bo dga' bo'i gan du song ste du bar brtsams pa dang dga' bos smras pa /
translated: After the action of expelling Upasena was performed, he went to his elder brother Nanda and began to cry. Nanda said,

original: nye dga' ci'i phyir du /🔽nye dgas smras pa /
analyzed: nye dga' ci'i phyir du / nye dgas smras pa /
translated: When the action of banishing Upasena was completed, he went to his elder brother Nanda and began to cry. Nanda said, Why are you crying?

original: lhung bzed nag po can dag gis kho bo gnas nas dbyung ba'i las byas so //🔽dga' bas smras pa /
analyzed: lhung bzed nag po can dag gis kho bo gnas nas dbyung ba'i las byas so // dga' bas smras pa /
translated: Upasena said, The monks with black bowls have performed the action of banishing me.🔽Nanda said, Those who performed the action of banishing my younger brother should be banished from the towns, cities, districts, and the three realms.

original: gang dag gis kho bo'i nu bo gnas nas dbyung ba'i las byas pa de dag grong dang grong khyer dang ljongs dang khams gsum nas gnas nas phyung bar gyur cig kho bos bdag gi nu bo gnas nas dbyung ba'i las byed par ma shes kyi /

translated: I did not know that I was performing the action of banishing my younger brother.

original: dge slong 'dun pa phyir byin cig / khyod la 'dun pa mi sbyin no zhes zer nas /
analyzed: dge slong 'dun pa phyir byin cig / khyod la 'dun pa mi sbyin no zhes zer nas /
translated: Give back the assembly of monks. I will not give you the assembly.

original: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge 'dun gyi bya ba chos dang ldan pa la dge slong la 'dun pa phul nas de'i 'og tu khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas spang ba'i chos su byed cing /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge 'dun gyi bya ba chos dang ldan pa la dge slong la 'dun pa phul nas de'i 'og tu khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas spang ba'i chos su byed cing /
translated: “Why, monks, do some monks, with few desires, give their consent to the saṅgha’s legal procedures in accordance with the Dharma, and then, in anger, become displeased and reject them?”🔽“They say, ‘Give back the consent of the monks!

original: 'di skad ces dge slong 'dun pa phyir byin cig / khyod la mi sbyin no zhes zer @203a * //🔽zhing smod par byed /
analyzed: 'di skad ces dge slong 'dun pa phyir byin cig / khyod la mi sbyin no zhes zer @203a * // zhing smod par byed /

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: they ridicule it,🔽and they speak in criticism of it.”

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, in this connection, in this context, assembled the saṅgha of monks🔽and questioned Nanda:🔽“This is not in accordance with the Dharma,

original: dga' bo la rmas nas dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: dga' bo la rmas nas dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not in accordance with the monastic code,🔽it is not suitable,

original: rung ba ma yin pa /🔽tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /🔽tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not proper,

original: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad da /
analyzed: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad da /
translated: This is not something that should be done by those who have gone forth.”

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: He saw ten benefits of establishing the bases of training and said, “My disciples, you should recite this basis of training in the Monastic Law:

original: yang dge slong gang dge 'dun gyi bya ba chos dang ldan pa la dge slong la 'dun pa phul nas /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang dge 'dun gyi bya ba chos dang ldan pa la dge slong la 'dun pa phul nas /
translated: ‘If a monk, after offering his assent to a legal procedure of the Sangha that is in accordance with the Dharma,

original: de'i 'og tu khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas spong ba'i chos su byed cing 'di skad ces dge slong 'dun pa phyir byin cig / khyod la mi sbyin no zhes zer na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas spong ba'i chos su byed cing 'di skad ces dge slong 'dun pa phyir byin cig / khyod la mi sbyin no zhes zer na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de //
translated: then, in anger, says, “I don’t affirm this legal procedure,” and “Return my assent,” he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The location is Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni dga' bo //🔽nyon mongs pa ni spong ba'i chos su byed pa /
analyzed: gang zag ni dga' bo // nyon mongs pa ni spong ba'i chos su byed pa /
translated: The individual is Nanda.🔽The affliction is any of the three.

original: nyes pa ni 'du na pa phyir bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni 'du na pa phyir bsgyur ba'o //
translated: The action is to return one’s assent.

analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu dga' bo'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: “A monk” means Nanda, the son of the Śākyas, or anyone else like him.

analyzed: dge 'dun gyi zhas bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi'o //
translated: “The Saṅgha’s” means the Saṅgha of the Tathāgata’s disciples.

analyzed: bya ba chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni las chos dang ldan pa la'o //
translated: “A legal procedure that is in accordance with the Dharma” means a legal procedure that is in accordance with the Teaching.

original: dge slong la zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa la'o //
analyzed: dge slong la zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa la'o //
translated: “A monk” means a monk in this religion.

analyzed: 'dun pa phul nas zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa byin nas so //
translated: “Having offered his consent” means having given his consent.

analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan na'o //

translated: “Angry, displeased, and upset” means angry and overcome with anger.

analyzed: spod pa'i chos su byed cing zhes bya ba ni smyon pa'i chos su byed cing ngo //

analyzed: 'di skad ces zhes bya ba ni 'di skad ces zer na'o //
