analyzed: dge slong 'dun pa phyir byin cig / khyod la mi spyin no zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni de skad ces zer na'o //
translated: If he says, “Monk, return the assembly,” and the other says, “I will not return it to you,”

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: then he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is an offense here?

original: 'dir @203b yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir @203b yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of this offense through the basic offense, the preparatory action, the subsequent action, the non-offenses, the training, and the amendment.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /

analyzed: dge slong gi las brgya rtsa gcig gi nang nas nan thur gyi las lnga dang / gang zag bcu gnyis bsko ba dang grangs su gzhug pa bzhi la sogs pa de lta bu dge slong gi don gyi ched kyi las dge 'dun gyi chos bzhin du byas pa la 'dun pa phul ba phyir bsgyur ba'i phyir dge slong 'dun pa phyir byin cig ;
translated: to return the consent of a fully ordained monk who has been given the consent of the saṅgha in accordance with the doctrine for the sake of a fully ordained monk, such as the four activities of appointing and counting the twelve types of persons.🔽If he says, “Give back the consent of the fully ordained monk,”

original: khyod la mi sbyin no zhes smras na 'dun pa phyir bsgyur ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyod la mi sbyin no zhes smras na 'dun pa phyir bsgyur ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: or “I will not give it to you,” then he commits the actual downfall of returning the consent of a fully ordained monk.🔽From among the one hundred and one activities of a fully ordained monk, the five harsh activities are:🔽to threaten,🔽to humiliate,

original: las brgya rtsa gcig gi nang nas bsdigs pa dang / smad pa dang / bskrad pa dang / phyir dgyed pa dang / mi mthong bas gnas nas dbyung ba dang / phyir mi 'chos pa rnams gnas nas dbyung ba dang / sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa mi gtong bas gnas nas dbyung ba'i nan thur lnga dang /
analyzed: las brgya rtsa gcig gi nang nas bsdigs pa dang / smad pa dang / bskrad pa dang / phyir dgyed pa dang / mi mthong bas gnas nas dbyung ba dang / phyir mi 'chos pa rnams gnas nas dbyung ba dang / sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa mi gtong bas gnas nas dbyung ba'i nan thur lnga dang /
translated: to expel,🔽to return,🔽to eject for not seeing an offense,🔽to eject for not making amends for an offense,🔽and to eject for not relinquishing a sinful view.

original: gnas khang bsko ba dang / zas la bsko ba dang / thug pa 'drim pa dang / bag chos 'drim pa dang / phran tshegs 'drim pa dang / snod spyad 'drub pa dang / gos kyi rnyed pa sped pa dang / gos kyi rnyed pa 'gyed pa dang /🔽dbyar gyi gos ras chen sped pa dang / dbyar gyi gos ras chen 'gyed pa dang / mdag gzhug dang / mdzes chos dang / sde spyad 'dri ma pa dang / gnas mal 'dogs pa dang / gnas mal byi bo 'bogs pa dang / shing thog 'drim pa dang /
analyzed: gnas khang bsko ba dang / zas la bsko ba dang / thug pa 'drim pa dang / bag chos 'drim pa dang / phran tshegs 'drim pa dang / snod spyad 'drub pa dang / gos kyi rnyed pa sped pa dang / gos kyi rnyed pa 'gyed pa dang / dbyar gyi gos ras chen sped pa dang / dbyar gyi gos ras chen 'gyed pa dang / mdag gzhug dang / mdzes chos dang / sde spyad 'dri ma pa dang / gnas mal 'dogs pa dang / gnas mal byi bo 'bogs pa dang / shing thog 'drim pa dang /
translated: They are: the person who assigns the living quarters, the person who assigns the food, the person who distributes the porridge, the person who distributes the pastries, the person who distributes the small cakes, the person who distributes the utensils, the person who stores the cloth, the person who distributes the cloth,🔽the person who stores the large rain cloak, the person who distributes the large rain cloak, the person who distributes the robes, the person who distributes the decorative items, the person who distributes the bowls, the person who assigns the beds, the person who assigns the bedding, the person who distributes the fruits,

original: chu'i zhil ta pa dang / bang rim gyi zhal ta ba dang / sge'u chung srung ba dang / sra brgyang sbed pa dang / lag gi bla la sogs pa gang zag las bsko ba dang / dor 'phya ba dang / gzhogs 'phyas byed pa dang /
analyzed: chu'i zhil ta pa dang / bang rim gyi zhal ta ba dang / sge'u chung srung ba dang / sra brgyang sbed pa dang / lag gi bla la sogs pa gang zag las bsko ba dang / dor 'phya ba dang / gzhogs 'phyas byed pa dang /
translated: the person who distributes the water, the person who distributes the stairs, the person who guards the windows, the person who stores the bolts, the person who assigns the individual tasks, the person who assigns the sweeping, the person who assigns the side sweeping,

original: bsgo ba rna la gzon pa dang / cang mi smra bas rnal gzon pa'i grangs su gzhug pa la sogs pa dge slong gdon gyi ched kyi las gsol ba dang / brjod pa dang / dgag dbye la sogs pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: bsgo ba rna la gzon pa dang / cang mi smra bas rnal gzon pa'i grangs su gzhug pa la sogs pa dge slong gdon gyi ched kyi las gsol ba dang / brjod pa dang / dgag dbye la sogs pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is not able to speak, or if he is counted as one who is well-behaved by his silence, or if he is participating in any of the various activities of the saṅgha, such as the recitation of the scriptures, the recitation of the Prātimokṣa, or the invitation ceremony.

original: las de dag dge 'dun gyi chos bzhin du byas pa la na smad pa med do //🔽de dag la dge slong rang @204a * //
analyzed: las de dag dge 'dun gyi chos bzhin du byas pa la na smad pa med do // de dag la dge slong rang @204a * //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is participating in any of the various activities of the saṅgha, such as the recitation of the scriptures, the recitation of the Prātimokṣa, or the invitation ceremony.🔽There is no offense if the monk has offered his consent.🔽There is no offense if the monk has offered his consent.

original: gi 'dun pa phul ba la na smad pa med do //🔽de'i phyir bsgyur ba ni phyir smras pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gi 'dun pa phul ba la na smad pa med do // de'i phyir bsgyur ba ni phyir smras pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk has offered his consent.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge slong gi don gyi ched kyi las byas pa las 'dun pa phul ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge slong gi don gyi ched kyi las byas pa las 'dun pa phul ba'o //
translated: The agent in this case is a monk who has offered his consent after having participated in the activities of the saṅgha.

original: 'di la yan lag ldas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag ldas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: This downfall has ten factors:

original: dge slong gi don gyi ched dang las dang de la 'dun pa phul ba dang dge 'dun gyi chos bzhin du byas pa dang / de phyir bsgyur ba'i phyir smras pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi don gyi ched dang las dang de la 'dun pa phul ba dang dge 'dun gyi chos bzhin du byas pa dang / de phyir bsgyur ba'i phyir smras pa'o //
translated: The monk’s purpose, the action, the intention to give, the Saṅgha’s doing things according to the Dharma, and the reversal of that.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these are incomplete, it is a downfall, as appropriate.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ji srid du 'dun pa phyir bsgyur ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ji srid du 'dun pa phyir bsgyur ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor offense. As long as the preparation for the downfall of intention to give is begun, but the actual action has not been done, it is a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the preparations for the actual action that is begun, there is a minor offense.

original: dge slong gi don gyi ched ma yin pa'i las gzhan la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong gi don gyi ched ma yin pa'i las gzhan la nyes byas so //
translated: If the action is not for the purpose of a monk, it is a minor offense.

original: las brgya rtsa gcig gi khongs su gtogs pa ma yin pa'i las gzhan la nyes byas so //
analyzed: las brgya rtsa gcig gi khongs su gtogs pa ma yin pa'i las gzhan la nyes byas so //
translated: If the action is not included in the one hundred and one actions, it is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The downfall of preparation for preparation is a very minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed do //
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed do //
translated: The application is the same as the number of applications.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te /
translated: The application of a minor offense is also a minor offense.

original: nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: It is a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni 'dun pa ma phul ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni 'dun pa ma phul ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does not offer one’s consent.

original: dge 'dun gyi las chos bzhin ma byas pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi las chos bzhin ma byas pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the saṅgha does not act in accordance with the Dharma.

original: phyir bsgyur ba'i phyir ma smras pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: phyir bsgyur ba'i phyir ma smras pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does not speak in order to turn the other away.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for a beginner, or if one is insane, deranged, or in pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du 'dun pa phyir bsgyur ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //🔽bsnyon pa'i chos mi bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du 'dun pa phyir bsgyur ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o // bsnyon pa'i chos mi bya'o //
translated: The training is that a monk should train in not relying on any of the forms of turning away one’s consent that constitute an offense.

original: mi mthun pa mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa mi bya'o //
translated: One should not act in a way that is contrary to the Dharma.🔽One should not act in a way that is contrary to the Vinaya.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: 'dun pa phyir bsgyur ba'i ltung byed de lnga bcu gsum pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: 'dun pa phyir bsgyur ba'i ltung byed de lnga bcu gsum pa bshad zin to /
translated: The Vinaya Verses states:

analyzed: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
translated: The Vinaya Compendium, a commentary on the Pratimoksha Sutra,

original: bam po sum cu gsum pa /
analyzed: bam po sum cu gsum pa /
translated: Volume thirty-three

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni byung ba dang gnang ba dang / bcas pa'i dbang gis rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni byung ba dang gnang ba dang / bcas pa'i dbang gis rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The introduction to the downfall of lying down together with one who is not fully ordained has three parts: the introduction, the allowance, and the proscription.

original: byung ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas @204b bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra na bzhugs so //
analyzed: byung ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas @204b bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra na bzhugs so //
translated: The introduction: The Bhagavan Buddha was staying in Shravasti, in the Jeta Grove, in the grove of Anathapindika.

original: bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gtsug lag khang du lhags nas dge slong rnams la smras pa /
analyzed: bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gtsug lag khang du lhags nas dge slong rnams la smras pa /
translated: Faithful brahmins and householders came to the monastery and said to the monks,

original: 'phags pa dag chos bstan du gsol /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag chos bstan du gsol /
translated: “Noble ones, please teach the Dharma.”

original: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa ;
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa ;
translated: The monks said,🔽“We are not allowed to teach the Dharma to women.”

original: bzhin bzangs dag bcom ldan 'das kyis ma gnang ngo zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bzhin bzangs dag bcom ldan 'das kyis ma gnang ngo zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said,

analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong rnams kyis kyang chos bstan par bya bar gnang ngo //
translated: “Therefore, monks, I allow you to teach the Dharma.”

original: dge slong rnams nyin mo chos ston par byed do /
analyzed: dge slong rnams nyin mo chos ston par byed do /
translated: The monks taught the Dharma during the day.

original: de ni khyim pa gang dag bsod nams kyi 'bras bus 'tsho ba de dag ni nyin mo chos mnyan nas mtshan mo rtsol ba'i 'bras bus 'tsho ba rnams la shes ldan dag 'phags pa dag chos snyan pa snyan pa ston par mdzad cing sbrang rtsi byed pa'i sbrang
analyzed: de ni khyim pa gang dag bsod nams kyi 'bras bus 'tsho ba de dag ni nyin mo chos mnyan nas mtshan mo rtsol ba'i 'bras bus 'tsho ba rnams la shes ldan dag 'phags pa dag chos snyan pa snyan pa ston par mdzad cing sbrang rtsi byed pa'i sbrang
translated: “Those householders who live by the fruits of merit listen to the Dharma during the day, and those who live by the fruits of their own efforts during the night say, ‘Sirs, the noble ones teach the Dharma in a way that is pleasant and pleasant-sounding.🔽They are like bees that gather nectar.

original: bu bzhin du chos sbrang rtsi lta bur ston cig / stobs par mdzad do zhes rjod par byed do //
analyzed: bu bzhin du chos sbrang rtsi lta bur ston cig / stobs par mdzad do zhes rjod par byed do //
translated: Teach the Dharma like bees gathering nectar.’

original: gang dag rtsol ba'i 'bras bus 'tsho ba de dag ni de la smod cing gal te bdag cag gis nyin mo las dag ma byas na ltogs te 'chi bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gang dag rtsol ba'i 'bras bus 'tsho ba de dag ni de la smod cing gal te bdag cag gis nyin mo las dag ma byas na ltogs te 'chi bar 'gyur bas /
translated: Those who make a living from the fruits of their labor disparage them, saying, “If we don’t work during the day, we’ll starve to death.🔽Noble ones, if you teach the Dharma at night, we’ll listen.”

original: 'phags pa dag khyod la mtshan mo chos ston par 'gyur na bdag cag gis kyang mnyan par bya'o zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag khyod la mtshan mo chos ston par 'gyur na bdag cag gis kyang mnyan par bya'o zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks asked the Blessed One about it, and the Blessed One said,

original: mtshan mo chos bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo chos bstan par bya'o //
translated: “Teach the Dharma at night.”

original: dge slong rnams mtshan thog thag tu chos ston par byed cing ngal bar gyur nas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams mtshan thog thag tu chos ston par byed cing ngal bar gyur nas /
translated: The monks taught the Dharma all night long and became exhausted.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: nam phyed kyi bar du chos bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: nam phyed kyi bar du chos bstan par bya'o //
translated: “Teach the Dharma until midnight.”

original: de lta na yang ngal bar gyur nas /
analyzed: de lta na yang ngal bar gyur nas /
translated: Even so, they became exhausted.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: tshes brgyad dang tshes bcu bzhi la chos bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: tshes brgyad dang tshes bcu bzhi la chos bstan par bya'o //
translated: “Teach the Dharma on the eighth and the fourteenth days of the month.”

original: dge slong rnams kyis tshes brgyad dang / tshes bcu bzhi'i nam phyed kyi bar du chos bsten pa dang / dge slong bsod snyoms pa zhig chos nyan du 'ongs pa de'i tshe mtshan mo mtha' gcig tu song nas skyil mo krung bcas te 'dug go //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis tshes brgyad dang / tshes bcu bzhi'i nam phyed kyi bar du chos bsten pa dang / dge slong bsod snyoms pa zhig chos nyan du 'ongs pa de'i tshe mtshan mo mtha' gcig tu song nas skyil mo krung bcas te 'dug go //
translated: One day a monk who was a beggar for alms came to hear the Dharma. He went to one end of the room and sat down cross-legged.

original: de ltar lhags pa'i khyim pa de dag kyang de nyid du nyal nas @205a * //
analyzed: de ltar lhags pa'i khyim pa de dag kyang de nyid du nyal nas @205a * //
translated: The laypeople who had come to hear the Dharma also lay down right there.

original: khang skyong gis mar me gsad par brtsams pa dang / de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: khang skyong gis mar me gsad par brtsams pa dang / de dag gis smras pa /
translated: The caretaker began to put out the butter lamps, but they said,

original: 'phags pa zhugs mar ma dgums shig dang bdag cag gis 'bru mar dbul lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa zhugs mar ma dgums shig dang bdag cag gis 'bru mar dbul lo //
translated: “Noble one, don’t put out the lamps. We will offer you oil.”

original: khang skyong gis mar me gsos te song ngo //
analyzed: khang skyong gis mar me gsos te song ngo //
translated: The caretaker relit the lamps and left.

original: de nas dge slong rgan zhugs brjed ngas pa zhig nyal ba de'i rmi lam na sngon gyi rnying ba dang lhan cig nyal ba rmis nas /
analyzed: de nas dge slong rgan zhugs brjed ngas pa zhig nyal ba de'i rmi lam na sngon gyi rnying ba dang lhan cig nyal ba rmis nas /
translated: Then an old forgetful monk went to sleep. In his dream he lay with his former wife.

original: des ci dang ci dag cig brdol bar brtsams pa khyim pa de dag gis thos nas 'di su yin zhes mar me'i 'od la bltas na /
analyzed: des ci dang ci dag cig brdol bar brtsams pa khyim pa de dag gis thos nas 'di su yin zhes mar me'i 'od la bltas na /
translated: The householder heard what was happening and said, “Who is this?”

original: ji tsam na rgan zhugs de phyi rgan du nyal zhing ci dang ci dag brdol ba mthong nas de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: ji tsam na rgan zhugs de phyi rgan du nyal zhing ci dang ci dag brdol ba mthong nas de dag gis smras pa /
translated: He looked at the light of the lamp and saw the old man lying down and doing whatever he wanted.

original: shes ldan dag rgan po rnams kyi gnas skabs kyang re zhig 'di 'dra na /
analyzed: shes ldan dag rgan po rnams kyi gnas skabs kyang re zhig 'di 'dra na /
translated: He said, “Sirs, the old man’s condition is like this.

original: rab tu byung ba gzhon nu dag gi gnas skabs ji lta bur gyur zhes ma dad pa go bar byed do //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba gzhon nu dag gi gnas skabs ji lta bur gyur zhes ma dad pa go bar byed do //
translated: What is the condition of the young men who have gone forth?”

original: dge slong bsod snyoms pa des nang bar sngar langs te dgon pa'i gnas su song ba dang / dge slong spong ba pa dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong bsod snyoms pa des nang bar sngar langs te dgon pa'i gnas su song ba dang / dge slong spong ba pa dag gis smras pa /
translated: The monk who went for alms got up early in the morning and went to the wilderness abode.

original: tshe dang ldan pa ji ltar tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag gis chos snyan pa snyan pa dag ston cing skye bo phal po che'i tshogs mngon par dad par byas sam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ji ltar tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag gis chos snyan pa snyan pa dag ston cing skye bo phal po che'i tshogs mngon par dad par byas sam /
translated: The monks who were practicing austerities said, “Venerable, how did you teach the Dharma well to the practitioners of pure conduct and cause a great crowd of people to have faith?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,🔽“Sirs, I did not teach the Dharma to anyone.”

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis ni de ltar byas so //
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis ni de ltar byas so //
translated: “The fellow practitioners of pure conduct did so.

original: rgan zhugs cig gis ni skye bo phal po che'i tshogs mngon par ma dad par byas so //
analyzed: rgan zhugs cig gis ni skye bo phal po che'i tshogs mngon par ma dad par byas so //
translated: But one old man caused a great crowd of people to lose faith.”

original: ji ltar gyur pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams la brjod nas /
analyzed: ji ltar gyur pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams la brjod nas /
translated: They told this to the monks,

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la rgyas par gsol to //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la rgyas par gsol to //
translated: and the monks told the Blessed One in detail.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One thought,

original: nyes dmigs gang cung zad ci byung bar gyur pa de ni dge slong rnams bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal bar byed pa dang / snang ba la nyal bar byed pa las gyur to snyam nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: nyes dmigs gang cung zad ci byung bar gyur pa de ni dge slong rnams bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal bar byed pa dang / snang ba la nyal bar byed pa las gyur to snyam nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Whatever little trouble there is, it is because monks sleep with those who have not completed the novitiate and sleep in the light.” The Blessed One said,

original: de lta bas na dge slong gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / lhan cig nyal bar mi bya zhing /
analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / lhan cig nyal bar mi bya zhing /
translated: “Therefore, monks, you should not sleep with those who have not completed the novitiate,

original: snang ba la yang nyal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: snang ba la yang nyal bar mi bya'o //
translated: and you should not sleep in the light.”

original: nyal bar byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyal bar byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he lies down, he commits a serious offense.

original: 'di ni byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni byung ba yin te /
translated: This is the origin story.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar ni mi mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar ni mi mdzad do //
translated: The Blessed Buddha did not at first establish a training rule for the monks.

original: gnang @205b ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: gnang @205b ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The story of the permission: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la dge tshul sgra gcan zin dang skul byed ces bya ba gnyis yod de /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la dge tshul sgra gcan zin dang skul byed ces bya ba gnyis yod de /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra had two novices: Rāhula and Cunda.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin nyin mo spyod du song ba'i gtsug lag khang du dge slong glor bur du 'ongs pa zhig gi gtsug lag khang bskos nas de mi dga' ba dang / tshe dang ldan pa skul byed kyis sgra gcan zin la smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin nyin mo spyod du song ba'i gtsug lag khang du dge slong glor bur du 'ongs pa zhig gi gtsug lag khang bskos nas de mi dga' ba dang / tshe dang ldan pa skul byed kyis sgra gcan zin la smras pa /
translated: One day, Venerable Rāhula went to the monastery to do his practice. A monk who had arrived unexpectedly was assigned the same room as Rāhula. The monk did not like this and told Venerable Cunda,🔽“Venerable Rāhula has been assigned the same room as me.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin mi dgar ma byed par gang yang rung bar nyol cig / tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin de'i nub mo bcom ldan 'das kyi snam phyis bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gis spos kyi byug pas bskus pa
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin mi dgar ma byed par gang yang rung bar nyol cig / tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin de'i nub mo bcom ldan 'das kyi snam phyis bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gis spos kyi byug pas bskus pa
translated: That night the Blessed One's robe was anointed with the perfume of the faithful brahmins and householders.

original: der song ste zhabs rten la mgo bo bzhag ste nyal lo //🔽de'i tshe mtshan mo sprin kha dog lnga pa 'dus nas des char 'bab par brtsams pa dang / snom phyis pa de dang ha cang thag mi ring ba na sbrul dug myur du khyab par byed pa'i gtso bo zhig gi tshang 'dug pa de char bab pa'i chus gang nas sprul dug myur du khyab par byed pa'i gtso bo de bcom ldan 'das kyi snam phyis
analyzed: der song ste zhabs rten la mgo bo bzhag ste nyal lo // de'i tshe mtshan mo sprin kha dog lnga pa 'dus nas des char 'bab par brtsams pa dang / snom phyis pa de dang ha cang thag mi ring ba na sbrul dug myur du khyab par byed pa'i gtso bo zhig gi tshang 'dug pa de char bab pa'i chus gang nas sprul dug myur du khyab par byed pa'i gtso bo de bcom ldan 'das kyi snam phyis
translated: Rāhula went there and lay down, placing his head on the robe's edge.

original: pa ga la ba der 'phags so //
analyzed: pa ga la ba der 'phags so //
translated: At that time, a five-colored cloud gathered in the night and began to rain, and not far from that robe, there was a nest of a powerful snake with swift-acting venom. The nest was filled with water from the rain, and the powerful snake with swift-acting venom went to where the Blessed One's robe was.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid can yin pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid can yin pas /
translated: The Bhagavan Buddhas are endowed with the nature of nonforgetfulness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
translated: The Bhagavan thought:

original: gal te sbrul dug myur du khyab par byed pa'i gtso bo des sgra gcan zin rnyed par gyur na ming gi lhag ma tsam las par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te sbrul dug myur du khyab par byed pa'i gtso bo des sgra gcan zin rnyed par gyur na ming gi lhag ma tsam las par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: If that chief of the swift spreading poison snakes finds Rahula, he will make him a mere name.

original: des sh'akya nga rgyal can dag gal te gzhon nu sgra gcan zin bzang po rab tu byung bar ma gyur na rgyal po dngos brtsan par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: des sh'akya nga rgyal can dag gal te gzhon nu sgra gcan zin bzang po rab tu byung bar ma gyur na rgyal po dngos brtsan par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: The proud Shakyas will think, “If the good prince Rahula had not gone forth, he would have become king.”🔽But now that he has gone forth, they will think, “It is time for him to be the protector of the helpless.”

original: de rab tu byung nas mgon med pa'i bya bas dus la bab po zhes ma dad pa go bar byed par 'gyur bar thugs su chud nas glang po che'i sna 'dra ba'i phyag brkyang ste sgra gcan zin blangs nas nyid kyi gzims mal du bsnyal te gzhag go
analyzed: de rab tu byung nas mgon med pa'i bya bas dus la bab po zhes ma dad pa go bar byed par 'gyur bar thugs su chud nas glang po che'i sna 'dra ba'i phyag brkyang ste sgra gcan zin blangs nas nyid kyi gzims mal du bsnyal te gzhag go
translated: The Bhagavan extended his arm, which was like the trunk of an elephant, picked up Rahula, and placed him on his bed.

original: // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig gnas gcig na gzims par 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin zhing skabs med pas /
analyzed: // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig gnas gcig na gzims par 'gyur ba ni gnas ma yin zhing skabs med pas /
translated: It is impossible and inconceivable that the Blessed Buddhas would sleep in the same place as a person who has not completed the preliminary stage of going forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis @206a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis @206a * //
translated: The Blessed One

original: dgung la 'chag pa dang bzhugs pa gnyis kyis shas cher mtshan mo 'da' bar mdzad do //
analyzed: dgung la 'chag pa dang bzhugs pa gnyis kyis shas cher mtshan mo 'da' bar mdzad do //
translated: spends most of the night walking and sitting,

original: dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag nad par sngar langs te /
analyzed: dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag nad par sngar langs te /
translated: and the elder monks get up early to attend to the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal du 'ongs pa na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal du 'ongs pa na /
translated: When they come to bow their heads at the Blessed One’s feet,

original: tshe dang ldan pa skul byed kyis se gol gyi sgras tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin bslang ngo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa skul byed kyis se gol gyi sgras tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin bslang ngo //
translated: the venerable Upacelā wakes the venerable Rāhula with the sound of her fingers.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag dge tshul 'di dag la ni ma yang med /
analyzed: dge slong dag dge tshul 'di dag la ni ma yang med /
translated: “Monks, these novices have no mother,

original: pha yang med /
analyzed: pha yang med /
translated: no father,

original: byams pa dang mdza' bshes kyi tshogs gzhan yang med /
analyzed: byams pa dang mdza' bshes kyi tshogs gzhan yang med /
translated: and no other group of friends or loved ones.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa khyed cag 'ba' zhig tu zad cing /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa khyed cag 'ba' zhig tu zad cing /
translated: “You are the only ones who are celibate,

original: 'di dag ni dgra bcom pa'i sgo nga dang ldan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni dgra bcom pa'i sgo nga dang ldan pa dag yin no //
translated: and they are the ones who have the eggs of an arhat.

original: gal te khyed cag gis 'di dag yongs su skyong bar mi byed na gzhan su zhig byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te khyed cag gis 'di dag yongs su skyong bar mi byed na gzhan su zhig byed par 'gyur /
translated: If you do not take care of them, who will?

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nub gnyis tshun chad gnas gcig tu nyal bar rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nub gnyis tshun chad gnas gcig tu nyal bar rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: “Therefore, monks, I allow you to sleep in the same room with an unordained person for two nights at a time.

original: dge slong zhig la 'khru ba'i nad byung ste /
analyzed: dge slong zhig la 'khru ba'i nad byung ste /
translated: A monk had a disease of the eyes.

original: de mun pa'i nang du mi bde bar gyur nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de mun pa'i nang du mi bde bar gyur nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: He was uncomfortable in the dark, so the Blessed One said,

original: de lta bas na snang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na snang bar bya'o //
translated: “Therefore, you should light a lamp.

original: der nyal bar yang bya'o //
analyzed: der nyal bar yang bya'o //
translated: You should sleep there.

original: dge slong nad g-yog dag kyang der nyal bar yang bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong nad g-yog dag kyang der nyal bar yang bya'o //
translated: The monk who is nursing the sick should sleep there.

original: byin len stobs pa bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dag kyang der nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: byin len stobs pa bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dag kyang der nyal bar bya'o //
translated: The one who brings the alms should sleep there.

original: nad pa dang nad g-yog dang / byin len stobs pa dag gis nub gsum pa la yang nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: nad pa dang nad g-yog dang / byin len stobs pa dag gis nub gsum pa la yang nyal bar bya'o //
translated: The sick person and the nurse, and those who have received the leftovers, should also sleep during the third part of the night.

original: nad g-yog gis byin len byas pa nad pa dang nad g-yog nyid kyis kyang bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: nad g-yog gis byin len byas pa nad pa dang nad g-yog nyid kyis kyang bza' bar bya'o //
translated: The leftovers should be received by the nurse, and eaten by the sick person and the nurse.

original: rgan pa dang gzhon pa dag gis kyang bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgan pa dang gzhon pa dag gis kyang bza' bar bya'o //
translated: The elders and the novices should also eat.

original: rgan pa rnams la gsar bu rnams dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rnams kyis nad g-yog bya zhing zas kyang bsnyod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgan pa rnams la gsar bu rnams dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rnams kyis nad g-yog bya zhing zas kyang bsnyod par bya'o //
translated: The novices and those not fully ordained should nurse the elders and give them food.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / gsar bu rnams la yang rgan pa rnams kyis de bzhin bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / gsar bu rnams la yang rgan pa rnams kyis de bzhin bya'o //
translated: The elders should do the same for the novices and those not fully ordained.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma'i snang ba dag ni tha snyad du bya ba ma yin bas de la nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma'i snang ba dag ni tha snyad du bya ba ma yin bas de la nyal bar bya'o //
translated: The light of the moon and the sun is not to be used for daily activities, so one should sleep then.

original: gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nub gnyis gnas gcig na nyal bas nub gsum pa la gtsug lag khang dang khyams nas phyir dbyung bar mi bya @206b bar 'di ltar nya 'khor du spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nub gnyis gnas gcig na nyal bas nub gsum pa la gtsug lag khang dang khyams nas phyir dbyung bar mi bya @206b bar 'di ltar nya 'khor du spang bar bya'o //
translated: If an unordained person and a monk sleep together in the same room for two nights, on the third night the monk must leave the temple and the courtyard. He should not be expelled from the monastery itself.

original: gal te gnas par khas ma blangs pa rnams kyi nang du dge slong sdig can 'ongs shing de dge tshul la 'tshe na de bskrad par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gnas par khas ma blangs pa rnams kyi nang du dge slong sdig can 'ongs shing de dge tshul la 'tshe na de bskrad par bya'o //
translated: If a sinful monk comes to stay among those who have not taken the full vows and if he harms the novice monk, the novice monk should be expelled.

original: gal te skrod mi nus na dge tshul khrid de gtsug lag khang gzhan du 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te skrod mi nus na dge tshul khrid de gtsug lag khang gzhan du 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: If he cannot be expelled, the novice monk should be taken to another temple.

original: gal te gnas par khas blangs pa rnams kyi nang du dge slong sdig can 'ongs shing dge tshul la 'tshe na de bskrad par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gnas par khas blangs pa rnams kyi nang du dge slong sdig can 'ongs shing dge tshul la 'tshe na de bskrad par bya'o //
translated: If a sinful monk comes to stay among those who have taken the full vows and if he harms the novice monk, the novice monk should be expelled.

original: gal te skrod mi nus na ni dge tshul dge slong mdza' bo'i gan du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te skrod mi nus na ni dge tshul dge slong mdza' bo'i gan du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: If he cannot be expelled, the novice monk should be placed in the care of a monk who is a friend of his.

original: gal te dge slong mdza' bo med na gnas gcig tu lhan cig zla ba gnyis 'da' bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dge slong mdza' bo med na gnas gcig tu lhan cig zla ba gnyis 'da' bar bya'o //
translated: If there is no other monk, he may stay in the same place for two months with a novice.

original: dgag dbye byas nas gal te dge slong sdig can de skrong bar nus na bskrad par bya'o //
analyzed: dgag dbye byas nas gal te dge slong sdig can de skrong bar nus na bskrad par bya'o //
translated: After the end of the rainy season, if the monks are able to expel the sinful monk, they should do so.

original: gal te mi nus na dge tshul khrid de gtsug lag khang gzhan du 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te mi nus na dge tshul khrid de gtsug lag khang gzhan du 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: If they are not able to, they should take the novice with them and go to another monastery.

original: dge slong dag lam du 'dod pa na de na dge tshul yang 'dong na nub gsum pa la 'gron pa don mthun gyi phyi rol du 'byung bar mi bya bar don mthun gnyis su byas te gcig gi nang du dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag lam du 'dod pa na de na dge tshul yang 'dong na nub gsum pa la 'gron pa don mthun gyi phyi rol du 'byung bar mi bya bar don mthun gnyis su byas te gcig gi nang du dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: If the monks are traveling by boat and the novice is also traveling with them, he should not stay outside with the other passengers for more than three nights. He should be made part of the group of passengers and brought on board.

original: gal te don mthun dpung chung na gnyis su mi bya bar dge slong rnams kyis mi nyal bar tron bya'o //
analyzed: gal te don mthun dpung chung na gnyis su mi bya bar dge slong rnams kyis mi nyal bar tron bya'o //
translated: If the group of passengers is small, he should not be made part of the group. The monks should stay awake and keep watch.

original: gal te dge slong rnams dal bar gyur na thun gsum mam gnyis sam gcig gam tha na skya rengs 'char kar tron bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dge slong rnams dal bar gyur na thun gsum mam gnyis sam gcig gam tha na skya rengs 'char kar tron bya'o //
translated: If the monks are tired, they should keep watch in three, two, or one shifts, or even until dawn.

original: de lta na yang ngal bar gyur na nyal bar bya ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang ngal bar gyur na nyal bar bya ste /
translated: If he becomes tired, he should sleep.

original: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not regret it.

original: dge slong lam du 'dong bas dge tshul gnyid bro bas rmya bar gyur na mdun du btang ste 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong lam du 'dong bas dge tshul gnyid bro bas rmya bar gyur na mdun du btang ste 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: If a novice monk becomes tired from sleepiness while traveling on the road with a fully ordained monk, the novice should be sent ahead.

original: der dge tshul dag gal te bru ba tsha bar gyur na de la nang par gyi dus su g-yar sus sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: der dge tshul dag gal te bru ba tsha bar gyur na de la nang par gyi dus su g-yar sus sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If the novice becomes hungry, the fully ordained monk should give him some of his food in the morning.

original: dge tshul dag ni me'i khams che ba yin pas de dag gal te dro kar yang bkres na /
analyzed: dge tshul dag ni me'i khams che ba yin pas de dag gal te dro kar yang bkres na /
translated: Novice monks have a greater element of fire, so if they become hungry even when it is not mealtime,

original: de'i tshe yang zan sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang zan sbyin par bya'o //
translated: the fully ordained monk should give him some food at that time.🔽The Introduction to the Precepts

original: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal bar mi bya zhing snang ba la yang nyal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal bar mi bya zhing snang ba la yang nyal bar mi bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, “A monk should not sleep together with a person who has not completed the novitiate, nor should he sleep in the light of a lamp.

original: zhes bka' stsal nas /🔽nye dga' la dge tshul tsher ma dang chen po pa zhes bya @207a * //
analyzed: zhes bka' stsal nas / nye dga' la dge tshul tsher ma dang chen po pa zhes bya @207a * //
translated: The Blessed One said this,

original: ba gnyis yod de /
analyzed: ba gnyis yod de /
translated: and Udayī had two novices named Kṣudra and Mahāta.

original: de de gnyis dang lhan cig nub gnyis las lhag par gnas gcig tu nyal bar byed nas /
analyzed: de de gnyis dang lhan cig nub gnyis las lhag par gnas gcig tu nyal bar byed nas /
translated: He slept in one place for more than two nights with those two.

original: dge slong rnams kyis de la smras pa /🔽tshe dang ldan pa nye dga' bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nub gnyis las lhag par gnas gcig tu nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal gyi khyod gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nub
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis de la smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa nye dga' bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nub gnyis las lhag par gnas gcig tu nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal gyi khyod gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nub
translated: The monks said to him,

original: gnyis las lhag par gnas gcig tu ma nyal cig / nye dgas smras pa /
analyzed: gnyis las lhag par gnas gcig tu ma nyal cig / nye dgas smras pa /
translated: “Venerable Udayī, the Blessed One has said, ‘A monk should not sleep in one place for more than two nights with a person who has not completed the novitiate.’ You should not sleep in one place for more than two nights with a person who has not completed the novitiate.”🔽Udayī said,

original: gang la nub gnyis rung ba de la nub gsum pa yang rung mod /
analyzed: gang la nub gnyis rung ba de la nub gsum pa yang rung mod /
translated: “If two nights are suitable, three nights are suitable too.

original: nub gsum pas chang 'thungs sam /
analyzed: nub gsum pas chang 'thungs sam /
translated: Did you drink beer on the third night?

original: kun dong zos sam ji nyes zhes zer nas /
analyzed: kun dong zos sam ji nyes zhes zer nas /
translated: Did you eat garlic? What’s the problem?”

original: dge slong don nyung du dag bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / lhan cig nub gnyis las lhag par gnas gcig tu nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal pa na /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung du dag bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / lhan cig nub gnyis las lhag par gnas gcig tu nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal pa na /
translated: The monks who had few desires complained and criticized them,🔽“Why do the monks intentionally stay more than two nights in the same room as someone who is not fully ordained?”

original: ci'i phyir dge slong dag ched du bsams te nub gnyis las lhag par 'da' bar byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dge slong dag ched du bsams te nub gnyis las lhag par 'da' bar byed ces smod par byed /
translated: They disparaged them,

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: and spread it about, saying,🔽“How can the monks do this?”

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.🔽The Blessed One assembled the saṅgha of monks and questioned the group of six,🔽“Is it true, monks, that you did this?”🔽“It is true, O Blessed One.”

original: drug sde dag la rmas nas dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /🔽rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag la rmas nas dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa / rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, rebuked them,🔽“Foolish men, how can you do this?🔽This is not in accordance with the Dharma,🔽it is not in accordance with the monastic code,

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not in accordance with the training,

original: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: This is not something that should be done by those who have gone forth.

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul pa la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul pa la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Having seen the ten benefits, he established this training rule for my disciples:

original: yang dge slong gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig tu nub gnyis las lhag par gnas gcig tu nyal na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig tu nub gnyis las lhag par gnas gcig tu nyal na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘If a monk spends two nights or more in the same sleeping place as someone who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The location is Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni nye dga'/
analyzed: gang zag ni nye dga'/
translated: The person is the monk Upananda.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags kyi cha la bsten pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags kyi cha la bsten pa /
translated: The affliction is any of the three.

original: nyes pa ni gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs ba dang lhan cig nub gnyis las lhag par @207b gnas gcig tu nyal ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs ba dang lhan cig nub gnyis las lhag par @207b gnas gcig tu nyal ba'o //
translated: The action is sleeping in the same sleeping place as someone who is not fully ordained for two nights or more.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: As for “a monk,” this refers to Upananda, the son of the Sakyans, or any other monk like him.

original: gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig ces bya ba la /
translated: Together with a person who is not fully ordained means

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa ni gnyis te /
translated: there are two who are fully ordained:

original: dge slong dang / dge slong ma'o //
analyzed: dge slong dang / dge slong ma'o //
translated: a fully ordained monk and a fully ordained nun.

original: de las gzhan pa ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Other than those two is one who is not fully ordained.

original: nub gnyis las lhag par zhes bya ba ni nub gnyis las 'das par ro //
analyzed: nub gnyis las lhag par zhes bya ba ni nub gnyis las 'das par ro //
translated: More than two nights means more than two nights have passed.

original: gnas gcig tu nyal na zhes bya ba ni gnas bzhi po thams cad g-yogs shing /
analyzed: gnas gcig tu nyal na zhes bya ba ni gnas bzhi po thams cad g-yogs shing /
translated: If they sleep in the same sleeping place means if they sleep in any of the four sleeping places:

original: thams cad bskor ba dang / thams cad g-yogs shing phal cher bskor ba dang / phal cher g-yogs shing thams cad bskor ba dang / phal cher g-yogs shing phal cher bskor ba dag tu nyal bas skya rengs 'char bar byed na'o //
analyzed: thams cad bskor ba dang / thams cad g-yogs shing phal cher bskor ba dang / phal cher g-yogs shing thams cad bskor ba dang / phal cher g-yogs shing phal cher bskor ba dag tu nyal bas skya rengs 'char bar byed na'o //
translated: if the sleeping place is covered on all sides and all around, if the sleeping place is covered on all sides but not all around, if the sleeping place is covered on all sides and mostly all around, if the sleeping place is covered on all sides and mostly not all around.

original: de la gnas thams cad g-yogs shing thams cad bskor ba ni gnas khang dang / 'khor gyi khyams dang / khang pa brtsegs pa dag go //
analyzed: de la gnas thams cad g-yogs shing thams cad bskor ba ni gnas khang dang / 'khor gyi khyams dang / khang pa brtsegs pa dag go //
translated: In this case, a sleeping place that is covered on all sides and all around is a house, a courtyard, or a multi-storied building.

original: thams cad g-yogs shing phal cher bskor ba ni sgo bcu pa dang / sgo bcu gnyis pa dag go //
analyzed: thams cad g-yogs shing phal cher bskor ba ni sgo bcu pa dang / sgo bcu gnyis pa dag go //
translated: The ten-doored and twelve-doored [altars] are mostly covered and mostly surrounded.

original: phal cher g-yogs shing thams cad bskor ba ni khyams ngos bzhi pa dag go //
analyzed: phal cher g-yogs shing thams cad bskor ba ni khyams ngos bzhi pa dag go //
translated: The four-sided [altars] are mostly covered and all surrounded.

original: phal cher g-yogs shing phal cher bskor ba ni khyams ngos gsum pa dang / 'khor gyi khyams dag go //
analyzed: phal cher g-yogs shing phal cher bskor ba ni khyams ngos gsum pa dang / 'khor gyi khyams dag go //
translated: The three-sided [altars] and the circular [altars] are mostly covered and mostly surrounded.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: One commits an offense is as before.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit an offense here?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mchan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mchan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the basis, the preparation, the preparation for the preparation, the establishment of the offense, the absence of offense, the training, and the amendment by the commentary.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong lam gyis dub pa rmya ba dang / dge slong gis byar mi rung ba sgrub par byed pa bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / lhan cig pa'i nad pa dang / nad g-yog dang /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong lam gyis dub pa rmya ba dang / dge slong gis byar mi rung ba sgrub par byed pa bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / lhan cig pa'i nad pa dang / nad g-yog dang /
translated: that a fully ordained monk makes a person who is not fully ordained do something that he should not do,🔽that a sick person or a nurse or🔽a fully ordained monk who has an enemy and who is a sinner and who is a threat to his novice monk is not the basis of the downfall.

original: khon yod pa'i dge slong sdig can rang gi dge tshul la 'tshe ba gnas der 'ongs pa ma gtogs pas khyim pa 'am rab tu byung ba'i gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa mtshan dang lta ba gang yang rung ba dag lhan cig gnyi ga nyal ba'i spyod🔽lam gyis gnyid log pas gnas phal cher g-yogs pa dang bskor ba la sogs pa gcig tu @208a * //
analyzed: khon yod pa'i dge slong sdig can rang gi dge tshul la 'tshe ba gnas der 'ongs pa ma gtogs pas khyim pa 'am rab tu byung ba'i gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa mtshan dang lta ba gang yang rung ba dag lhan cig gnyi ga nyal ba'i spyod lam gyis gnyid log pas gnas phal cher g-yogs pa dang bskor ba la sogs pa gcig tu @208a * //
translated: Except for these, if a fully ordained monk sleeps in the same sleeping place as a person who is not fully ordained, whether a layperson or a renunciate, and if they sleep in the same sleeping place with any of the four postures,🔽then the fully ordained monk commits the actual downfall of sleeping in the same place as a person who is not fully ordained.

original: mtshan mo gsum pa'i skya rengs shar ba'i tha mar nyal na bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan mo gsum pa'i skya rengs shar ba'i tha mar nyal na bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If the fully ordained monk sleeps in the same sleeping place as a person who is not fully ordained for more than three nights,🔽then the fully ordained monk commits the actual downfall of sleeping in the same place as a person who is not fully ordained.

original: dge slong lam gyis dub pa rmya ba ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong lam gyis dub pa rmya ba ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: Except for a monk who is exhausted by the path and emaciated, there is no blame for illness.

original: dge slong gis byar mi rung ba byin len bstabs pa la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig pa'i dge slong nad pa dang nad g-yog ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong gis byar mi rung ba byin len bstabs pa la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig pa'i dge slong nad pa dang nad g-yog ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: Except for a sick monk and his attendant, there is no blame for a monk who is not fully ordained to perform the duties of receiving and giving back what is not suitable to be done by a monk.

original: khon yod pa'i dge slong sdig can rang gi dge tshul la 'tshe ba gnas der 'ongs pa'i dge slong ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: khon yod pa'i dge slong sdig can rang gi dge tshul la 'tshe ba gnas der 'ongs pa'i dge slong ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: Except for a monk who has come to that place, there is no blame for a monk who has a grudge against a sinful novice who is harming himself.

original: de yang gal te dge tshul dang ldan pa'i dge slong de dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa dang khas blangs na yang dbyar gnas pa snga ma'i zla ba dang po dang / dbyar gnas pa phyi ma'i zla ba tha ma lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: de yang gal te dge tshul dang ldan pa'i dge slong de dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa dang khas blangs na yang dbyar gnas pa snga ma'i zla ba dang po dang / dbyar gnas pa phyi ma'i zla ba tha ma lan smad pa med do //
translated: Moreover, if that monk who possesses a novice accepts the rainy season retreat and accepts it again, there is no blame for the first month of the rainy season retreat and the last month of the later rainy season retreat.

original: khyim pa 'am rab tu byung ba'i gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa mtshan dang lta ba gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: khyim pa 'am rab tu byung ba'i gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa mtshan dang lta ba gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the person is a layperson or a renunciant who has not taken full ordination, or if the person is of the same gender.

original: lhan cig gnyi ga nyal ba'i spyod lam gyis gnyid log pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: lhan cig gnyi ga nyal ba'i spyod lam gyis gnyid log pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the person is asleep and the monk falls asleep while in a posture that does not involve lying down.

original: gnas phal cher g-yogs pa dang bskor ba la sogs pa gcig pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gnas phal cher g-yogs pa dang bskor ba la sogs pa gcig pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the two are in a dwelling that is completely covered and completely enclosed, or if it is completely covered but not completely enclosed, or if it is mostly covered and mostly enclosed.

original: gnas kyi mtshan nyid ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: gnas kyi mtshan nyid ni bzhi ste /
translated: A dwelling has four characteristics:

original: thams cad g-yogs shing thams cad bskor ba dang / thams cad g-yogs shing phal cher bskor ba dang / phal cher g-yogs shing thams cad bskor ba dang / phal cher g-yogs shing phal cher bskor ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad g-yogs shing thams cad bskor ba dang / thams cad g-yogs shing phal cher bskor ba dang / phal cher g-yogs shing thams cad bskor ba dang / phal cher g-yogs shing phal cher bskor ba'o //
translated: it is completely covered and completely enclosed, it is completely covered but not completely enclosed, it is mostly covered and completely enclosed, or it is mostly covered and mostly enclosed.

original: de la gnas thams cad g-yogs shing thams cad bskor ba ni gnas khang dang 'khor gyi khyams dang khang pa brtsegs pa dag ste /
analyzed: de la gnas thams cad g-yogs shing thams cad bskor ba ni gnas khang dang 'khor gyi khyams dang khang pa brtsegs pa dag ste /
translated: A dwelling that is completely covered and completely enclosed is a house, a pavilion, or a multi-storied building

original: steng thams cad g-yogs shing ngos thams cad bskor ba'o //
analyzed: steng thams cad g-yogs shing ngos thams cad bskor ba'o //
translated: in which the roof covers the entire structure and the walls enclose the entire structure.

original: thams cad g-yogs shing phal cher bskor ba ni sgo bcu pa dang sgo bcu gnyis pa dag ste /
analyzed: thams cad g-yogs shing phal cher bskor ba ni sgo bcu pa dang sgo bcu gnyis pa dag ste /
translated: The ten-doored and twelve-doored celestial palaces have all their upper parts covered and most of their sides enclosed.

original: steng thams cad g-yogs shing ngos phal cher bskor ba ste /
analyzed: steng thams cad g-yogs shing ngos phal cher bskor ba ste /
translated: The four-doored celestial palace has all its upper part covered and most of its sides enclosed.

original: 'dir phal cher zhes bya ba ni sum cha gcig lus par rig par bya'o //🔽phal cher g-yogs shing thams cad bskor ba ni khyams ngos bzhi pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'dir phal cher zhes bya ba ni sum cha gcig lus par rig par bya'o // phal cher g-yogs shing thams cad bskor ba ni khyams ngos bzhi pa dag ste /
translated: Here, “most” should be understood as three-fourths.

original: steng phal cher g-yogs shing ngos phal cher bskor ba ste /
analyzed: steng phal cher g-yogs shing ngos phal cher bskor ba ste /
translated: The four-sided courtyard has most of its upper part covered and all of its sides enclosed.

original: khyams ngos bzhi pa zhes bya ba ni gang la ngos bzhi char dang 'brel pa'i steng g-yogs yod pa dbus kyi mthongs khab @208b med pa'o //
analyzed: khyams ngos bzhi pa zhes bya ba ni gang la ngos bzhi char dang 'brel pa'i steng g-yogs yod pa dbus kyi mthongs khab @208b med pa'o //
translated: The four-sided courtyard is that which has a roof connected to all four sides, but has no upper story.

original: phal cher g-yogs shing phal cher bskor ba ni khyams ngos gsum pa dang / 'khor gyi khyams dag ste /
analyzed: phal cher g-yogs shing phal cher bskor ba ni khyams ngos gsum pa dang / 'khor gyi khyams dag ste /
translated: The three-sided courtyard and the assembly courtyard have most of their upper part covered and most of their sides enclosed.

original: steng phal cher g-yogs shing ngos phal cher bskor ba ste khyams ngos gsum pa zhes bya ba ni gang la ngos gsum dang 'brel pa'i steng g-yogs yod la /
analyzed: steng phal cher g-yogs shing ngos phal cher bskor ba ste khyams ngos gsum pa zhes bya ba ni gang la ngos gsum dang 'brel pa'i steng g-yogs yod la /
translated: The courtyard is a place that is mostly covered above and mostly enclosed on the sides. It is called a “three-sided courtyard” because it is covered above and has three sides,

original: ngos gcig gi steng g-yogs dang dbus kyi mthongs khab med pa'o //
analyzed: ngos gcig gi steng g-yogs dang dbus kyi mthongs khab med pa'o //
translated: but it does not have a covering on one side and an opening in the middle.

original: gnas bzhi po de dag gi sgo'i ngos dang 'brel ba'i nye 'khor gnas su gyur pa ni de'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnas bzhi po de dag gi sgo'i ngos dang 'brel ba'i nye 'khor gnas su gyur pa ni de'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin no //
translated: The area that is adjacent to the side of the door of these four places is included in the area of the courtyard.

original: grong khyer gzhan bar du ma chod pa sgo de dang 'brel pa yang de'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: grong khyer gzhan bar du ma chod pa sgo de dang 'brel pa yang de'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin no //
translated: The other city that is not separated by an intervening space and is connected to that door is also included in the area of the courtyard.

original: nang gcig tu rgyu zhing gnas gzhan med pa ma yin pa nyid la ni g-yogs thams cad gcig pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: nang gcig tu rgyu zhing gnas gzhan med pa ma yin pa nyid la ni g-yogs thams cad gcig pa nyid yin no //
translated: If there is no other place that is included in the same area, then the entire covering is the same.

original: rang gi char gtogs pa'i sgo gcad pa la nye 'khor tha dad pa yang 'dir gnas gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi char gtogs pa'i sgo gcad pa la nye 'khor tha dad pa yang 'dir gnas gcig pa nyid do //
translated: The courtyard is a different place from the door that is included in the same area.

original: rim khang gzhan la ni skas steng du brtul na gnas gcig pa nyid yin te gnas gcig pa de dag la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rim khang gzhan la ni skas steng du brtul na gnas gcig pa nyid yin te gnas gcig pa de dag la na smad pa med do //
translated: If the other house is on the same level as the first, then it is the same location. There is no offense if the two are in the same location.

original: mtshan mo gsum pa'i skya rengs dang po shar ba'i mthar nyal ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: mtshan mo gsum pa'i skya rengs dang po shar ba'i mthar nyal ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one sleeps at the end of the first watch of the night.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni khyim pa 'am rab tu byung ba'i gang brag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa mtshan dang lta ba gang yang rung ba dang / gnas gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni khyim pa 'am rab tu byung ba'i gang brag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa mtshan dang lta ba gang yang rung ba dang / gnas gcig pa nyid do //
translated: The agent of this downfall can be either a layperson or a renunciate. The downfall is completed when the other person is a non-novice who is of the opposite sex and is in the same location.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The basis of this downfall is fivefold:

original: dge slong lam gyis dub pa rmya ba la sogs pa ma yin pa nyid dang / khyim pa 'am rab tu byung ba'i gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa mtshan dang lta ba gang yang rung ba dang / gnas gcig pa nyid dang / gnyi ga nyal ba'i spyod lam gyis gnyid log pa nyid dang /
analyzed: dge slong lam gyis dub pa rmya ba la sogs pa ma yin pa nyid dang / khyim pa 'am rab tu byung ba'i gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa mtshan dang lta ba gang yang rung ba dang / gnas gcig pa nyid dang / gnyi ga nyal ba'i spyod lam gyis gnyid log pa nyid dang /
translated: the monk is not exhausted from travel, etc.; the other person is a layperson or a renunciate who is not fully ordained; the other person is of the opposite sex; the two are in the same location; and both are lying down and asleep.

original: mtshan mo gsum pa'i skya rengs shar ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo gsum pa'i skya rengs shar ba'o //
translated: The third night is the time of dawn.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors are incomplete, the downfall is a partial defeat or a serious violation, depending on the circumstances.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor infraction.

original: ji srid du bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has not yet completed the novice ordination, the downfall of preparation for sleeping in the same sleeping place as a fully ordained monk is a minor infraction.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed pa rtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed pa rtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each time one engages in the act of preparation for the actual downfall, one commits a minor infraction.

original: nyal ba ma yin pa'i spyod lam gyis gnyid log pa ni mtha' dang mdun rol gnyis kar nyes byas so //
analyzed: nyal ba ma yin pa'i spyod lam gyis gnyid log pa ni mtha' dang mdun rol gnyis kar nyes byas so //
translated: If one falls asleep in a posture other than the one in which one went to bed, one commits a minor infraction at the end of the night and at the beginning of the next day.

original: nyin mo ni mtshan mo las ltung ba tha dad pa nyid pas nyin mo bsnyen @209a * //
analyzed: nyin mo ni mtshan mo las ltung ba tha dad pa nyid pas nyin mo bsnyen @209a * //
translated: During the day, one commits a minor infraction for each of the downfalls that one commits at night.

original: par ma rdzogs pa dang gnas gcig tu nyi ma gnyis pa las lhag par nyal ba la yang mtha' dang mdun rol gnyi gar nyes byas so //
analyzed: par ma rdzogs pa dang gnas gcig tu nyi ma gnyis pa las lhag par nyal ba la yang mtha' dang mdun rol gnyi gar nyes byas so //
translated: If one sleeps more than two nights with a novice who has not yet completed the monk’s ordination, one commits a minor infraction at the end of the night and at the beginning of the next day.

original: shing ljon pa'i drung dang rtsig pa'i bar dang / tshang tshing gi drung dag ni gnas kyi phyed nyid yin bas der nyal ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: shing ljon pa'i drung dang rtsig pa'i bar dang / tshang tshing gi drung dag ni gnas kyi phyed nyid yin bas der nyal ba la nyes byas so //
translated: Sleeping between a tree and a wall, or in the vicinity of a wall, or in the vicinity of a thicket, is half a downfall because it is a place where one should not sleep.

original: gnas kyi nye 'khor yang gnas nyid ma yin pas der nyal ba la yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: gnas kyi nye 'khor yang gnas nyid ma yin pas der nyal ba la yang nyes byas so //
translated: Sleeping in the vicinity of a monastery is also a half downfall.

original: skya rengs gsum pa'i mdun rol du yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: skya rengs gsum pa'i mdun rol du yang nyes byas so //
translated: Sleeping before the third watch of the night is also a half downfall.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The downfall through preparation is a minor infraction.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many preparations as there are, there are that many preparations for the preparations.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation for a minor infraction is also a minor infraction.

original: ltung ba med pa ni dge slong lam gyis dub pa rmya ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni dge slong lam gyis dub pa rmya ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no downfall if the monk is exhausted from traveling and is weak.

original: dge slong gis byar mi rung ba byin len stobs pa la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa la bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig pa'i dge slong nad pa dang / nad g-yog la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong gis byar mi rung ba byin len stobs pa la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa la bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig pa'i dge slong nad pa dang / nad g-yog la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense for a sick monk or his attendant to perform the duties of a novice, such as receiving alms, when a fully ordained monk is not available.

original: dge slong dge tshul dang ldan pa gang gis dge slong sdig can sbag pa la 'bad pa byas sam byed pa'i sgo nas khon yod pa'i dge slong sdig can rang gi dge tshul la 'tshe ba gnas der 'ongs nas dge tshul dang ldan pa'i dge slong de la
analyzed: dge slong dge tshul dang ldan pa gang gis dge slong sdig can sbag pa la 'bad pa byas sam byed pa'i sgo nas khon yod pa'i dge slong sdig can rang gi dge tshul la 'tshe ba gnas der 'ongs nas dge tshul dang ldan pa'i dge slong de la
translated: If a fully ordained monk who is also a novice monk makes an effort to expel a sinful monk, or if a sinful monk who has a grudge against that novice monk comes to the monastery and harms the novice monk,

original: gal te dbyar gnas pa snga mar khas blangs pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te dbyar gnas pa snga mar khas blangs pa yin na /
translated: if the novice monk has previously agreed to remain in retreat for the summer,

original: dbyar snga ma'i zla ba gsum las /
analyzed: dbyar snga ma'i zla ba gsum las /
translated: he should remain in retreat for the first three months of the summer.

original: dbyar zla 'dring po nya nas dbyar zla tha chungs nya'i bar gyi zla ba dang po ma gtogs par dbyar zla tha chungs nya nas ston zla ra ba nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig dang / ston zla ra ba nya nas ston zla 'bring po'i nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig ste /
analyzed: dbyar zla 'dring po nya nas dbyar zla tha chungs nya'i bar gyi zla ba dang po ma gtogs par dbyar zla tha chungs nya nas ston zla ra ba nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig dang / ston zla ra ba nya nas ston zla 'bring po'i nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig ste /
translated: The third month is from the full moon of the first autumn month up to the full moon of the middle autumn month.

original: dbyar zla snga ma'i dus phyi ma'i zla ba gnyis po de dag la bab pa na dge slong de dge tshul dang lhan cig nyal ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dbyar zla snga ma'i dus phyi ma'i zla ba gnyis po de dag la bab pa na dge slong de dge tshul dang lhan cig nyal ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: When these two latter months of the summer season occur, it is not a downfall for a fully ordained monk to sleep with a novice.

original: dge tshul dang ldan pa'i dge slong de gal te dbyar gnas pa phyi mar khas blangs pa yin na /
analyzed: dge tshul dang ldan pa'i dge slong de gal te dbyar gnas pa phyi mar khas blangs pa yin na /
translated: If the fully ordained monk who has a novice is one who has accepted the later summer retreat, then he should not sleep with the novice.

original: dbyar phyi ma'i zla ba gsum las ston zla 'bring po nya nas ston zla tha chungs nya'i bar gyi zla ba tha ma ma gtogs pa dbyar zla tha chungs nya nas ston zla ra ba nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig dang / ston zla ra ba nya nas ston zla 'bring po nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig ste /
analyzed: dbyar phyi ma'i zla ba gsum las ston zla 'bring po nya nas ston zla tha chungs nya'i bar gyi zla ba tha ma ma gtogs pa dbyar zla tha chungs nya nas ston zla ra ba nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig dang / ston zla ra ba nya nas ston zla 'bring po nya'i bar gyi zla ba gcig ste /
translated: The two months of the latter part of the rainy season are the last month of summer, from the full moon of the middle autumn month to the full moon of the last autumn month, and the first month of autumn, from the full moon of the last summer month to the full moon of the first autumn month.

original: dbyar phyi ma'i dus dang po'i zla ba gnyis po de dag la bab pa na dge slong de dge tshul dang lhan cig nyal ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dbyar phyi ma'i dus dang po'i zla ba gnyis po de dag la bab pa na dge slong de dge tshul dang lhan cig nyal ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: When the first two months of the latter part of the rainy season occur, there is no fault in a fully ordained monk sleeping with a novice.

original: dbyar gnas par khas ma blangs pa @209b dang khas blangs pa la yang dbyar snga ma'i zla ba dang po dang dbyar phyi ma'i zla ba tha ma la ni nyes par 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: dbyar gnas par khas ma blangs pa @209b dang khas blangs pa la yang dbyar snga ma'i zla ba dang po dang dbyar phyi ma'i zla ba tha ma la ni nyes par 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
translated: However, if one does not agree to stay in the rainy season retreat or if one agrees to stay in the rainy season retreat, there is a fault in the first month of the earlier rainy season and the last month of the latter rainy season.

original: gnas nye 'khor dang bcas pa gnas khang tsam gyi pha rol na tha dad par gyur cing gnas pa ni de'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid ma yin pas /
analyzed: gnas nye 'khor dang bcas pa gnas khang tsam gyi pha rol na tha dad par gyur cing gnas pa ni de'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid ma yin pas /
translated: Since the place and its environs are different from the mere dwelling place, it is not included in that.

original: der nyal ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: der nyal ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in sleeping there.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin sprul dug myur du khyab par byed pas de'u bsad pa lta bu'i rkyen yod na dge slong gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nub gnyis tshun chad gnas gcig tu nyal bar rjes su gnang ba la sbyor ba'i🔽nyes byas kyang med do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sgra gcan zin sprul dug myur du khyab par byed pas de'u bsad pa lta bu'i rkyen yod na dge slong gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nub gnyis tshun chad gnas gcig tu nyal bar rjes su gnang ba la sbyor ba'i nyes byas kyang med do //
translated: If there are conditions such as the venerable Rahula killing a bird, since it was quickly pervaded by the poison of a magical emanation, there is no offense in applying the permission to sleep together in one place for two nights with a person who is not fully ordained.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bdag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bdag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for a beginner, one who is insane, one whose mind is deranged, or one whose mind is overwhelmed by feelings.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang lhan cig nyal ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule is that a fully ordained monk should train in not lying down in any way at all together with someone who is not fully ordained in any place.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma ma gtogs pa'i snang ba dang bcas pa'i gnas kyi phyogs su nyal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma ma gtogs pa'i snang ba dang bcas pa'i gnas kyi phyogs su nyal bar mi bya'o //
translated: Except for the moon and the sun, one should not lie down in a place that has light.

original: nad pa dang nad g-yog gi dbang nyid kyis snang ba dang bcas pa'i gnas kyi phyogs su nyal ba ni rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: nad pa dang nad g-yog gi dbang nyid kyis snang ba dang bcas pa'i gnas kyi phyogs su nyal ba ni rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: Lying down in a place that has light is permitted for those who are sick, or who are nursing the sick.

original: nad pa dang nad g-yog ma gtogs pa gzhan snang ba dang bcas ba'i gnas kyi phyogs su nyal ba 'di la kha cig skabs 'di'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'chad pa ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: nad pa dang nad g-yog ma gtogs pa gzhan snang ba dang bcas ba'i gnas kyi phyogs su nyal ba 'di la kha cig skabs 'di'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'chad pa ni mi rung ste /
